CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2017
CommentsContent: I'm very happy with this hub.  It's nice and small and works just great.  I own a Sabrent USB 3.0 hub as well, and my experience with it caused me to select Sabrent for this purchase, too.I would have given it 5 stars, but for one thing.  The cable is very short, maybe a foot or so, which is great for laptops, but I'm using it on a workstation tower that is located under my desk, so I had to get an extension cable for it.  No biggie, and I wouldn't let that stop you from getting this unit.NOTE:  I was having trouble with my Logitech Unifying Receiver when it was plugged into the back of my tower (poor reception from mouse).  I now have the receiver plugged into my Sabrent hub, which is located on my desk's work surface, and it works great!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2014
CommentsContent: I have been looking for a USB hub for a while and none were the "bang for the buck" I thought they should be. I read the reviews and thought I would try this one.It is nice. It works well and I have quickly filled up each port.The disadvantage of this unit is the length of the cord that runs from the hub to the computer. It is VERY short. I use a laptop and this would be really great if the cord was longer and I could then velcro it onto the lid and when using, the hub is out of the way. I can't do that with this unit. That is a big drawback for me and I do mean BIG however, the price was more than fair for four ports.If it had a longer cord, it would be PERFECT

CommentsTitle: All in all, not bad! Does what it says but with one exception..
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Looks great and is exactly what I needed. Only reason I gave 4 and not 5 stars is because sometimes the PC won't pick up the device plugged into the hub if you plug it in while the computer is running.  Plug everything you need into the hub and then start your computer to avoid any glitches.  Otherwise it's a great product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: One by one each leg went bad, only needed two outlets so it took a little while before completely worthless, but wouldn't buy again and certainly wouldn't recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2016
CommentsContent: In regards to the Sabrent 4-port hub with individual power switches and led lights is a great bargain. I have been using it with my lenovo ideapad, if anybody has one you know that there is a lack of usb ports like any other laptop.I've had no problems whatsoever, I attached a magnet from a old hdd so it can attached on the side of my metal cart/desk and not be in the way. As far as transfer speed it does what says it does. solid device at a low price, very satisfied with this purchase.

CommentsTitle: I really like this product, and it's a great value.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2014
CommentsContent: I really like this product. I use the USB 2.0 hub as an ON-OFF switch for USB LED lights mounted on my pull-out keyboard and for switching between monitoring my two UPS sources. The lighted switches are a nice touch. I use the USB-3 hub to disconnect my two USB 3.0 BACKUP DRIVES, flash drives, and card reader from my computer. That allows me to physically isolate my backup drives and thus better protect them from malware. I receive a notice from my calendar to reconnect the drive prior to my Acronis backup. Acronis 2014 sends an email when the backup is complete, as a reminder to disconnect the backup drives. Knowing that your backups are safe is truly priceless; and this is done with "remove hardware" followed by pressing a button.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: Very easy to use, just plug and go. Cord could be a few inches longer, but still easy to use. Lights let you know which port is active.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this product to hook up multiple usb devices to my laptop - mouse, keyboard, headphone.I like the idea that I can push on and off the device when not in use without having to unplug the entire hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2019
CommentsContent: Junk. It didn't even last 2 years. It was okay for the first 6 months or so, but then the USB cables that were plugged in would lose contact and weren't working properly. I would have to jiggle the wires for it to work. I would not recommend purchasing it. Spend the extra $10 for a quality piece of equipment instead of this garbage.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Not much to say other than it works quite well. It's been holding up for the past couple years I've been using it. Definitely recommended as a cheap, compact USB 2.0 hub. As other reviewers mentioned, it's a bit tight and you may need to pull a little harder to get the USB cable out, but I don't mind it too much.

CommentsTitle: Why I wanted 2.0 instead of 3.0 for wireless device dongles.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this product because USB 3.0 creates signal interference in the 2.4GHz - 2.5GHz range, which happens to be the frequency that Bluetooth and most wireless mouse and keyboard dongles use. So, if you plug those devices into a USB 3.0 plug, you are likely to get intermittent problems with those devices stuttering or not working. With this USB hub, and a USB extension, I am able to plug my wireless mouse, keyboard and Bluetooth dongles in at a safe distance from the USB 3.0 ports, and alleviate that problem.

CommentsTitle: Don't waste your time or money. Useless
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2019
CommentsContent: This was about as useful as a a block of wood in a steel factory. This would not charge anything that wasn't a simple device. IPhone?? No. IPad? No. Basic headset? Yes. But it charged slow. There is a place for a power supply that probably should have been included. This just was a vapid waste of money. Thankfully I was able to return them for a full refund.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I've been doing a lot of hybrid bible studies and I needed additional ports for my added microphones, cameras, etc. for my Macbook Air.  This worked just as I needed it to. One thing to note, I couldn't use any of the USB ports on my Macbook when I had this inserted. This was the only device I could use for ports.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020
CommentsContent: It is just what I needed, and at a great price!  My macbook only has two USB outlets and these days, with all the Zoom for work, classes, etc., it became necessary to have more than two items plugged in at a time - external microphone, cooling pad for my older computer, the printer, ring light, .....  Now I don't have to unplug things, and that is a welcome help.  I like that I can turn each slot on of off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I have had a lot of issues with my work laptop not allowing or recognizing my devices with this working from home quarantine. THIS WORKED!!! It gives you extra USB ports which is amazing! This is a MUST BUY!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2019
CommentsContent: Very convenient USB HUB! Definitely needed it to use my USBs on the desktop computer which doesn't have enough built in ports for me. It's small enough to stay out of my way. The only thing about this Hub is that with the type of USBs that I have, I can only use 2 at a time because my USBs are a little to wide to use all 4 ports. That's the only complaint I have.  For me, the chord is just the right length! Happy with my purchase..the price was excellent......I bought 2!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the 2nd one i bought in a few years. Reliable product. The first one still works fine. I needed a 2nd one for work.  The cord's length is perfect. Not too long and short enough to my likings.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020
CommentsContent: The 4-port charging station works well with the LED light.  Charges fast.  the only negative is the 2ft cord...it cannot be moved or reached other than where it is located.

CommentsTitle: Easy to use, works very well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2021
CommentsContent: This product is super easy to use. Plug it in and plug things into it and go. The cord is fairly short, which could be a problem if you need to connect it to the back, but its perfect for me,  since I just ran out of USB ports. Put a piece of tape on the bottom of it to stick it to the computer, and I'm a happy guy. I especially like the individual power buttons for each slot

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Because of my home office / studio setup, I needed USB ports in two locations. I purchased Sabrent’s 3.0 USB hub for my recording gear, webcam and game pads; and their 2.0 USB hub for my bluetooth mouse / keyboard dongle and printer.The 2.0 and 3.0 hubs transfer data exceptionally well - no connectivity issues, lag, or playback issues whatsoever. Having an on/off switch per USB port is incredibly convenient due to the number of instruments and mics I use for recording. Both hubs are the same size - they’re slim / compact and easy to keep out of sight.The Sabrent 2.0 and 3.0 hubs together cost me $17 and transfer data for 8 devices simultaneously without a hitch. Having two separate USB hubs allows me to keep all devices connected to my PC and in their proper place.I couldn’t be happier with these hubs, and highly recommend them!

CommentsTitle: I tried another USB hub and it didn't work well - this one's GREAT!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2014
CommentsContent: The laptop I was issued from work only has one USB port - NOT handy!  So a few months back I ordered a Belkin USB 2.0 4-Port Ultra-Mini Hub by Belkin from Amazon which didn't work very well for me.  The things I had plugged in kept losing connectivity. I thought maybe that's just how good it was going to get since I'd never used a hub before.  However I got so frustrated that several weeks back I came back to Amazon and ordered this Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs and I can't believe the difference.  I have not once lost connectivity with anything I plug into it. 3 of the 4 hubs are currently being used and I'm loving the fact that I don't have to work in frustration any more.  I wish I'd gotten this one first!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2014
CommentsContent: I was seeking to find a compact, self-powered hub for travel, as the Macboo0k Air is very limited on USB ports, and I've been pleasantly surprised with this gem. It fits neatly into a pocket in my carry-on bag, fits snugly in the port, and thus far has been completely foolproof with everything I've plugged into it.Turning off and on of individual devices is nice, as well. However, if I were to have one suggestion, it would be for a longer cord on the unit itself. The short cable tends to place the hub in some very awkward positions, especially when using the laptop in clam-shell mode (on a vertical stand). Fantastic little budget port for travel, though... Glad I purchased it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I am a virtual teacher this year. I have my wireless mouse and document camera plugged into my computer daily. I recently purchased a wireless keyboard. I only have two usb ports on my computer. I use to have to unplug one device in order to make room for the other. This port has solved my problem and another tool to make virtual learning easier.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a dandy little 4 port hub. It takes up very little space on your desk and works just fine. I wish the cord was a little longer but still it is a very good value.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2021
CommentsContent: Worked great for daily use connecting my flash drive, projection system, and pen-tablet.  After a year, it has failed.  three of the four ports do not work.  Not sure why the middle port is still working, but useless now.  I would buy another, but it could fail in 3 months...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2021
CommentsContent: This device works well! I have a couple midi keyboards, an audio interface, and external hardrive plugged into this that is plugged into my Macbook via Macbook usb adaptor.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2014
CommentsContent: It works! Just be careful about using multiple devices with high power consumption!Do not attempt to put, like, 4 hard drives on this thing! In fact, for something like a USB HDD, I wouldn't exceed one. They use considerably more power than something like a USB Flash Drive, which I think you could stack on without an issue.I actually bought this for my Raspberry Pi, which is a device where you especially need to be conscious about the power consumption of the devices you plug in. But overall, it's a great item for cheap. The switches are a nice touch, with a nice blue glow. It's easy to control what devices are on, without having to unplug them. But do be sure to safely remove them before switching the power off!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2014
CommentsContent: I love this 4 port hub and it fits my needs to a T.  I hate plugging chargers into the 12 volt plug in the ashtray. My car has an additional 12 volt plug in the boot so I plug this hub in that port and am able to plug my phone and my music usb drive into the port for playback in the car. I haven't found use for the other 2 ports yet but I like the convenience of the flexable cable that's long enough to rest comfortably on the floor of the boot without a bulky cable intruding into storage space.  I only turn on the two needed ports and keep the other two turned off.  It does everything I need it to do and because it is so light weight, I plan to purchase another one for my tablet dock. Most multi port hubs I've purchased would only allow me to use 2 ports at a time but not so with this one. When my friend's phone went dead on one of our out of state shopping trips, we were both able to charge our galaxy phones without any problems or decreased charging capacity.

CommentsTitle: New Laptops only one USB port!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: I like that by adding 4 port USB to the new Laptop ( 2 USB ports), one taken up with a wireless mouse. I can charge my earbuds, iPhone, and still have 2 more ports if needed!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2016
CommentsContent: Great accessory for laptops and portable systems. I use multiple of these to control speakers, headsets, and ham radio accessories on my laptops -- I use a single USB port on the laptop and can freely activate, de-activate, and swap the various adapter cables I need. Also useful for powering on/off USB accessories that don't have a switch of their own (speakers, etc.). GREAT for low-speed, low-power accessories and for providing just that little extra bit of standoff for flash drives.If they came with some hook-loop tape or some other adhesive, they'd be a perfect 5.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2013
CommentsContent: The company where I am employed replaced my previous laptop plus docking station (which provides additional USB ports) with a new laptop without docking station. The new laptop (for which I am grateful) has only three USB ports which, in my workplace, are required for external mouse, keyboard and headset. This left no USB port available for flash drive, webcam or other peripheral device.The Sabrent 4-Port USB Hub has proven to be a cost-effective solution for expanding the USB ports available on my laptop.Delivery was prompt and the product is functioning as advertised.I was particularly pleased to receive a personalized follow up email from Sabrent Customer Satisfaction department offering support and assistance with the product if needed. It is refreshing to find such post-sales customer focus.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I like that I can turn on any or all of the ports whiles leaving the others off. It is small, light, and well built. I would give 5 stars if the usb ports were slightly further apart. Some flash drives are too wide to fit side by side on this.

CommentsTitle: Sabrent 4-Port USB Hub  got my vote 5 stars
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2016
CommentsContent: This device has worked out better than expected having a laptop with limited USB ports I was looking for something like this and it has filled the bill. I have a wireless mouse which needed a port and a new cooling fan which also needed a USB port  and a portable drive My passport . So with all the demand this Sabrent product has been a savior and works with all these units. I highly recommend this product and I was contacted by the company to see if I was having problems with their product not many companies go that to insure that their device is working to your satisfaction .

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I have an extension cord from the outlet to my desk. I usually use a block and then charge my phone. Thought this would be a great addition so I could charge multiple things (and it looks cool.) but it didn't work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this as my work Lenovo laptop doesn't have enough ports.  I needed the extra for a desk lamp and fan.  Need to be comfy while working from home.  Leaves 2 extra ports if I need to charge my phone, etc.,

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I needed a hub for my work computer and this had looked promising. I've used it daily for the past few weeks and it started out great. However, the past few days I am  not having issues where it keeps randomly disconnecting and my computer gives me malfunction errors. This is a real bummer given that my bluetooth mouse and headset are run through it. I tried to save a few dollars and now I have to find another hub that works more consistently.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: So far it works just as a USB hub should. The power buttons are a bonus, so the camera we use it for can easily be turned off when not in use without having to plug and unplug every time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2019
CommentsContent: Surprised by the compact size. This works well if you have limited space. Like the on off feature. It allows you to plug in multiple flash drives. And select which you want to use. This hub has a good price. So far I am pleased with the performance.

CommentsTitle: Accomplishes what I need it to do
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this to use on my Xbox One. I needed it because the Xbox only has one USB port. I have four different things plugged into it and they all had no problems being powered or connecting to the Xbox. The different things I have connected to it is a keyboard I use to write messages (some games now allow the use of mouse and keyboard), a mouse, a charging cable for my controller, and an external hard drive for game storage.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2014
CommentsContent: I use wireless keyboard, mouse and a graphic pen tablet and some times an extra mouse. I have used another one and it was okay but this one is great. I like this one does not dangle off the tv tray that my laptop is on. The other one would dangle off and catch the attention of my kitten and did not need the aggravation of that. I like that this sits next to the computer and that you can turn off what you do not need at the time. I have never had one that you could turn on and off what you need. If you are looking for a very good usb hub then I would say get this one and you will not be sorry you have done. It works very well as the other one had issues after a month or so and of course was a good 8 inches long. This one is nice and short cord and is perfect.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I wish I would have had found this years ago! For years I have been constantly switching all my printers and devices throughout the day since I can only plug in two at a time on my computer, it was a frustrating. This thing is a LIFESAVER! I have all my devices plugged into it which uses one USB on my computer, and can use my phone charger in the other. Perfect!! If I ever need another one I will be back! Thank you so much!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this specifically to add my Apple iPhone. Says it works with Apple, but after receiving and trying it does not. If you then look into the questions, it's clear it can be used with some Apple products but does not charge Apple products. That should be a heck of a lot clearer in the description. Seems to work with other items, so it was inexpensive and I can use it elsewhere, but beware if you are wanting to use this with your iPhone/iPad.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Not enough USB ports on laptop required an additional solution to connect variety of hard drives.  Devices works perfectly.  The ability to turn the sockets on and off is a plus.  Arrived quickly and exactly as advertised.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2015
CommentsContent: Very happy with the flexibility this device provides me for my applications. With all the devices requiring USB connectivity, our iMac is out of USB ports. Also, I use this Hub to bring the USB access out in front of the computer where I can actually USE the port without having to get in behind the MAC to plug things in. Very convenient, and welcome expanded USB capacity as well. Everything I've used with this device has worked so far - ie: iPhone access, charge Fitbit, charge Tao Bluetooth transmitter, and connect an external hard drive. I love this thing!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2019
CommentsContent: small package and individual switches are attractive, but was unreliable cutting out occasionally and both the PCs (Win10) I connected it to said there was an issue installing the driver.I returned for which I had to pay the postage. For the $7 I got back I might as well have thrown it in the trash.Bought something much better instead (Aukey) which arrived next day and works. This product was a waste of my time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: This product takes the USB power output from a single source and splits it into four outlets, servicing up to four devices. It has illuminated switches for each port.  It is a simple device that costs little and works well.

CommentsTitle: Should have bought one years ago
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2015
CommentsContent: I can't believe I never thought of buying one of these before! Between the iPhone charger, fitbit dongle, fitbit charger, external hard drive, and I'm still using wired keyboard and mouse - I was always shuffling things in and out of the two available USB ports on the front of my computer - not anymore!I haven't had any power issues, though I seldom use all of these things at once so maybe if I was syncing and charging my fit bit and iPhone while also working on documents on the external hard drive it would be too much! But after three weeks of having this, I'm just amazed I didn't think of it sooner!

CommentsTitle: but the ports do not work until I find the perfect position. At the moment I have it plugged ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2015
CommentsContent: The connection of the port to my Surface 2 is very finicky.  I have to have the unit positioned perfectly in order for the ports to work.  Strange thing is that once I plug it in I can tell that the ports are receiving power because it lights up, but the ports do not work until I find the perfect position.  At the moment I have it plugged in and sitting on a scotch glass with happens to be the perfect height to give me a good connection.  But if I bump the desk and the glass moves even slightly it will lose the connection and I will need to wiggle it around until I find a good spot again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2020
CommentsContent: My PC needed additional USB  outlets so purchased this product and allows for the use of 4 addition outlets.  Each outlet has an on/off switch  which makes it easy turn on and off as needed when using.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2014
CommentsContent: I chose the Sabrent 4-Port hub for a couple reasons. Foremost is the size factor. I have a Dell all-in-one 23" screen and fits well on my portable computer stand. Very little space for extras, which is good as I am a stacker. The Sabrent hub fits perfectly under the monitor making for easy access. The hub is light weight yet with enough heft to let you know this is not something slapped together to make a buck or two.The second reason is price. With USB 3.0 becoming more prominent the 2.0 hubs are getting cheaper in order to clear out inventories. This hub was at my price point and I feel that I made a good and wise purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2017
CommentsContent: I ordered this for the home computer which is my old laptop. Then, liked it so much, we ordered another one for my laptop I use at school. I love that you can keep things plugged in and just turn off the port, and that there are blue indicator lights to let you know when a port is on. I have not noticed any power loss, and all our USB powered devices work well with this hub.

CommentsTitle: ALL LOOKS AS EXPECTED N NOW I NEED USE IT ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2018
CommentsContent: ALL LOOKS AS EXPECTED N NOW I NEED USE IT IN ORDER TO GIVE AN INFORMED REVIEW... THANK YOU ... SMILE ... .. PEACE ... V.PEREZ===04/08/2018=== After use i find it to be very weak & does not work when more than 2 are plugged in. unable to fix it. conclusion. not working as sold to work or this one is broken. .. if not to late, replace or refund if applicable please.V.PEREZ 4/8/18

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve been working remote for about 9 months and recently got equipment from my employer. The laptop only had two USB ports and with my dual monitor setup and various accessories, I needed more ports to accommodate them all. This was an affordable and easy fix and has met my needs tremendously. I now have enough USB ports available to accommodate everything at the same time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought this for the new toshiba laptop I recently purchased. One thing I like about this usb extender. One aspect of this usb extender I like is the fact the usb connection thing is attached to a cord. Other extenders I have had in the past simply have one that folds out. My laptop sits on a mounted fan to keep it cool and to help me work. So, this made it really head to plug it in and allow it to sit on my desk while I work.I didn't know this before, but on top (you can see it in the picture) this usb extender has buttons over each of the ports. You press one of those buttons when you have a usb plugged into it so it activates. A blue light comes on to let you know that port is active. I LOVE that! It's kind of cool since I do have quite a few computer items that tend to light up. So, that added to the little light show I have going on with my laptop.It's pretty fast and transfers data just fine. Perfect for being able to plug a bunch of things in at once.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2013
CommentsContent:
Pretty lights (a little bright), good design, but Windows 7 kept telling me it wasn't 2.0. Who am I to argue? Went back to my Amazon Basics, 

  
AmazonBasics USB 2.0 4-Port Ultra Mini Hub









  
  
    
   which Windows seems to have embraced enthusiastically from day one.Update - 11/21/13Was contacted by manufacturer's representative and we shared some email.  I was impressed by Sabrent's commitment to their product and to their customers and decided to try their product again.As it stands, I was wrong about the hub. The issue Windows was reporting was due to a problem I had with the usb port on my Asus X401A notebook -  the physical port itself was slightly malformed, causing problems with grounding. Since rectifying this problem, the Sabrent hub has performed flawlessly.

CommentsTitle: I needed this to be able to operate items like a Logitech 3D pro joystick
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2016
CommentsContent: I needed this to be able to operate items like a Logitech 3D  pro joystick,HP 4310 webcam or the Razer mouse,that I ordered from Amazon.Even if were the lone item selected,no they would work through this item.But if you want to charge four cell phones at once.I have put my wireless Logitech mouse on this bar,makes for a nice tidy extension.The company will probably think twice about thinking"Oh you have an inferior system"....HP Phoenix Envy 810-145qe is NOT inferior by any means.I was hoping for a switchable outlet to be able to select.Not happening.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2015
CommentsContent: Does exactly what it says; it is a USB hub. I haven't really taxed it too hard, but it's flawlessly performed with any number of devices I've connected to it. I've used it with several Windows laptops, a Macbook Pro, and an iMac and never had a problem. It was even supplying wired ethernet for the Macbook through a USB ethernet adapter at the same time I was running a portable hard drive off it.I had a few people go "where did you get that?!" since it is immediately apparent what its function is. They're even more shocked when they find it costs less than $10.The indicator LEDs are very bright, so you might not want it active while you're sleeping (bright blue LED light everywhere), but I mostly use it at work anyway and it doesn't cause any problems.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I have ordered many of these USB "splitters" in the past, and been disappointed in all of them. Usually they work at first them quit on me or stop doing what they should after a few hours. This is the first one I have ever gotten that actually keeps working and can handle 4 printers through 1 USB port. I run a Zebra shipping label printer, commercial HP office printer/scanner, Canon food grade edible ink printer, and a Primera LX2000 color label printer all through this USB splitter. It allows my computer to actually identify each one, almost better than my PC could when I was having to switch cables to use each one. I highly recommend! I cannot comment on the charging power for devices, but I imagine that wouldn't disappoint either.

CommentsTitle: This product works great for me
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2020
CommentsContent: This Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual LED lit Power Switches is perfect for me to use now that I must work from home.  The cord is very short, too short, but that is my only compliant.  The four power switches are nice.  The product works excellently.  My only negative comment is the cord is way too short.Overall, I would purchase this product again.  Good product for the price.

CommentsTitle: A competent USB hub with indiviual power switches for its ports - ideal for connecting simple devices.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2016
CommentsContent: With my ever growing group of devices, I once again found myself in need of a new USB hub.  My needs were simple, I had no intention of connecting a hard drive or anything that would draw a significant amount of power, all I wanted to do was connect multiple input devices like keyboards, trackpads and gamepads.  I came across this Sabrent model with individual on/off switches for each port and liked that idea.This hub is inexpensive and has performed the function for which I needed it very well.  As is often the case, you do get what you pay for so this hub doesn't feel very solidly constructed and the lights above the ports kind of bleed over into adjacent ones and I ran into one minor issue with it where for a time it failed to recognize the trackpad on a keyboard/trackpad combination device.  It has worked flawlessly aside from that one hiccup.One thing to bear in mind if you plan to use this to connect external storage is that it is a USB 2.0 hub, so you will not get the best transfer speeds out of USB 3.0 devices.  Also, as this hub is not powered, you may need to run into some issues depending on the computer or whatever device to which this hub is connected.  I use it primarily on an NVIDIA Shield Android TV and have not run into that issue.  I have also briefly tested it on a couple of computers.If you have a need to connect simple devices without a significant power draw and would like the ability to enable or disable them at the touch of a button, this unit will fit the bill nicely and is easy on the wallet.  If you need a hub for storage devices or other devices that may need to draw more power from the host unit, you'll probably want to look into a powered hub instead.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2015
CommentsContent: This little hub works great!  I have plugged my Miracast Dongle into it and it powers it up just perfectly.  I can also plug my phone into it and use it as a charging port.  I plan to plug a Bluetooth adapter/receiver into it as well and hopefully turn my TV into a Bluetooth capable TV...we'll see!  Either way this hub works as described and I love it's small, lightweight design!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Works perfectly fine and no I’m not a paid actor or bot, the usb works fine , got in perfect condition and in a box, opened it up plugged it in into my computer and it works perfectly with my keyboard and mouse, now I have more usb extra plugs for the future , I’m very happy about this product & will probably buy another one in future once I run out of USB ports again :)

CommentsTitle: Only buy this for read/write, don't buy if you want to charge as well -2 year update included-
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2015
CommentsContent: For the price, this hub is pretty good. Read and write speeds are really great, but if you move around a lot of data, you wanna look at the USB 3.0 version. The LEDs look very cool and the hub isn't as big as it looks in the pictures. It's 8 cm long and 3 cm wide. DON'T BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO CHARGE THINGS AS WELL, IT'S A VERY SLOW CHARGER!Update: It's been over two years since I had this product. The product definitely passed the electronics shelf-life test! And for that, I'm tempted to give this product 4 out of 5 stars, but I'm hesitant because of the charging issue. I've tried to test this product with various electronics to see if perhaps it could charge them well. With the iPhone 6s plus, the Samsung Galaxy Tab S2, and even Bose QC20s, the devices just simply refused to be charged by this hub. Read/write speeds are also pretty mediocre. For now, this product serves as a connection hub for my laptop. By this, I mean I've connected a USB Fan (works), a wireless mouse, a wireless keyboard and my printer. I tried to use this hub to transfer files from my laptop to a USB Flashdrive, and found it ineffective and slow and rely on my laptop's USB ports instead.All in all, final recommendation. Buy this product if you're looking for extra ports to connect wireless keyboards/mice, USB Fans, printers or other peripherals. Would 100% not recommend this device for device charging or file tranfers!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2020
CommentsContent: There isnt anything to dislike so far . Its doing what it's suppose to be doing and helped me out a bunch as far as keeping thinigs plugged up . I love that I can turn the ports off that are not in use . I would buy again if I needed one for another comp .

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2019
CommentsContent: UPDATE:It has been just a few months and I have now begun to experience disconnection problems with this USB hub. It started 2 days ago while trying to import pictures off of an SD card. I used it again a moment ago and had th re some problem while transferring a larger file. By larger I mean about 2 GB. I ended up having to use a different hub to transfer the file. The hub hasn't left our desk. It hasn't been pulled on excessively.  In fact, we have barely used it at all. We got about 6 months of LIGHT use out of this USB hub. I don't know if that would have been less had I been using this particular hub with my portable office.  At this point I can NOT recommend this hub to anyone. Look elsewhere. I am now going to replace this hub.Changed from 5 star to 2 stars. 2 stars for the pretty blue lights.I haven't had any trouble with this hub. Works as it should and the lights are helpful when I pay attention to them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2019
CommentsContent: My computer doesn't have enough USB ports for everything that I want to plug into it. I got this little gem, and I am really happy with it. The best part of it is this: It has about a 10" cord from the USB plug to the 4-port hub. This means that there isn't any weight on the plug itself. The cord stays plugged in perfectly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2018
CommentsContent: I have a laptop with only 3 USB ports, but when I have my fan, my portable mouse, my external hard-drive, that's three spots right there. Sometimes In need to plug my iPod in to charge it, or attach my phone to transfer files. I've noticed with the iPod it tends to not upload the album covers, and my external hard-drive doesn't quite fit the plug in's so I still manage to plug those two things into the laptop, but the portable mouse, the fan, and my phone all plug in nicely through this little 4 port USB port.This is my second purchase of this item because after owning the first one for a little over a year, the little white parts that the cords plug into fall out an the port it belonged to becomes unusable.

CommentsTitle: Cute little high functioning device with individual on off buttons
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This has survived over five spills and is incredibly convenient for my poorly designed HP pavilions USB port only located under the monitor, completely out of view, and impossible to use with any USB attachment longer than 2 cm (basically any USB) this little guy doesnt save superior bus ports (no midi or usbmidi) but it does a great job with devices requiring drivers, data sticks to transfer files, phone connections, android bridge debugging software etc. A+

CommentsTitle: Great little hub for iMac users or anybody who wants to increase USB connectivity options.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2015
CommentsContent: I'm an iMac user. I love the design of the iMac, but hate that the USB ports are all rearward-facing. I figured I could remedy this with a cheap accessory like this Sabrent USB hub, which I purchased and taped with 3M double-sided tape to the underside of the iMac with the ports facing forwards.It works great! I love how you can turn on only the ports you're currently using with the touch of a button. The blue LEDs clearly indicate which slots are active (a minor complaint is that there's no way to turn the LEDs off except by disabling the port, which sucks a little bit and costs the hub 1 star, but wouldn't stop me from purchasing this item again). The transfer speeds are fast via 2.0, and my devices are always recognized in OSX. Perfect compatibility - just the way a USB hub should work. It even provides enough power to charge my iPhone 6/iPad 2.Would recommend. Perfect purchase if a) you're looking to relocate USB ports to the front of your computer or b) you just want to expand your connectivity options. Looks great, too, with excellent build construction.

CommentsTitle: Works well lighted on/off buttons a bonus
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: Works great as a 4 port usb extender. The lighted on/off button per port is an added bonus.  I have connected web cam, presentation pointer dongle,  and flashdrive. I purchased a second one to use with my work laptop.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this so I can switch my music thumb drives in the car. My wife's Verbatim drive comes apart when ever its removed. So I didn't think it would last very long if I kept on removing it to listen to the music that I like.  It makes things convenient when you don't have to look for your drive.  I looked for a two port model, but couldn't find one. This works very well for my purpose.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2019
CommentsContent: This is an amazing product! Just what I needed, and works just how I thought.The buttons and lights work perfectly; button is pressed and light is on, showing USB is attached!The cord length is on the shorter side. I dont fully mind, but longer would have been a little bit nicer.This does NOT charge required items. Aka Keyboard, controller, etc. This product only works with USBs, and does not work for anything that needs power from the PC to function.

CommentsTitle: Helps me cycle through my laptops with ease
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2014
CommentsContent: I'm sure many of you have multiple laptops that get used in your house, just like we do.I have a MacBook, my husband has a work laptop, and his personal laptop. We have one desk with a monitor, printer, keyboard, and mouse in our house.I bought this so that we can each walk up to the desk, plug in one USB hub and connect to our mouse, keyboard, and printer.It doesn't matter if we're using a MAC or a PC, the unit works perfectly, just as described.It's a great Plug N Play product that helps us in a very practical way with each of our laptops.-Katie

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2020
CommentsContent: The USB port lights up when you are using the port and then it's off when you don't use it. The buttons make it really easy to use. I don't use it for charging but for plugging in other computer items and it's been working great so far. and then i can just click off the port I don't need when I shut down, like speakers or my mouse.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2018
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   So far so good.  Works well, does not get hot at all (i read posts about them getting hot).  All of the plug ins ports work. I have my interface, two hard drives  and my iphone plugged in.  I use them all day long have for the past couple of weeks since i got it and doing great.  The buttons are smooth and easy to press. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Very Good for the price.  You can put it on either side of the laptop without it getting in your way.  You can turn off the ports you are not using.  I like it a lot.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2020
CommentsContent: The buttons allow me to have different USB headphones/speakers plugged in at the same time and just turn one or the other off without having to plug or unplug the device.  That turned out to be much more useful than I expected.Also I was using a Mouse Jiggler, which caused some boot issues with my Surface Pro (not recognizing the keyboard upon boot).  Simple solution, turn it off, boot, and turn it back on.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I had purchased a new laptop without realizing it only had two USB ports when I was use to having four.  I needed those extra ports for my mouse and keyboard.  This option has proven quite effective.  yes, the cord could stand to be a little longer, but I'm making it work.  I haven't used it to charge anything yet, so I can't say anything about that, but for what I've used it for it's perfect.  I do like the fact that you can turn off the ports not in use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2016
CommentsContent: This product works well for the most part.  i connected it to a USB extension cord and use it with my new USB keyboard, which works well with rapid response.  What surprises me, however, is that my USB thumb drive does not get recognized at all when connected to this hub, but works well when connected to the USB extension directly.  I don't know what the problem is but it still is working for what it was originally purchased.  Easy connections and secure unlike many USB's that easily disconnect with movement.  Good product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2015
CommentsContent: So far, so good. It looks a bit flimsy, but then all of those little things tend to feel that way because it's plastic. So far, it works great, and looks really pretty with the lights on.I deduced one star because the buttons get stuck sometimes when you press them down, but it doesn't detracts from the device functioning, and you can easily unstuck them with your nail. It's nice that you have the option to switch it off or on with the buttons.I'll try to remember to update the review if it stops working at some point down the line, but for now I've had it for 2 or 3 weeks and it's working great. Fast and reliable.

CommentsTitle: This device is so useful for a laptop with only 2 ports and definitely ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2016
CommentsContent: I have researched many USB ports to use for my Macbook Pro, and I believe all that research has paid off. This device is so useful for a laptop with only 2 ports and definitely brings a lot for how much I paid for the small port. The sleek device is pretty easy to use and it works perfectly. None of the connections have been questionable after 6 months from buying it and it still works as smoothly as day 1. The only complaints I do have about the product is about the cable and the LED buttons.The cable seems very flimsy and could break if it's suddenly pulled, which makes me nervous sometimes when my cat gets near it. The buttons work great and give a satisfying, but small, click and is accompanied by a blue LED to let you know that the port is active. The problem is that the LEDs sort of "bleed" through to the next port and makes it confusing to see which one is actually active. Clicking one of the middle buttons would confuse me on if the adjacent buttons were lit or not and was a hassle sometimes.Overall, the device looks great on your desk and is perfect for travel due to it's small size. Just be careful with the small cable and don't give it too much stress. I would definitely buy this again, or even the 3.0 model, for the price, performance, and sleek design.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2021
CommentsContent: Purchased this to add functionality to an older laptop with one usb slot. This works great and allows me much more functionality on my old repurposed laptop.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2019
CommentsContent: I was so excited when I purchased this product thinking it would solve my USB shortage issue! It worked fine for the first hour, then it started disconnecting from my computer automatically, then reconnecting, and disconnecting. This can go on for over a minute if I don’t put a stop to it by yanking the USB out of the port of my laptop. My fear is that with it disconnecting automatically without permission, it will probably mess up the files on my flash drive. I give this 1 star.

CommentsTitle: I think EVERYONE with a laptop should buy one of these bad boys
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2019
CommentsContent: For some reason, most of my laptops (I have 3) only come with 1-2 USB ports, which is really frustrating considering I need to use a wireless mouse/mic/camera/SD reader etc. There are never enough ports, so I decided to buy this affordable hub as a way to simplify my work and I am so glad I did. I even bought more hubs for my desktops because I love the feature of being able to shut off certain devices with the push of a button. I think the cord could be a little bit longer, but I really can't complain, the device works great!

CommentsContent: Not sure what the caption camera quality referred to, but overall it powers my hardware from my computer very well and I am very satisfied with the small design and effectiveness of the device. I’ll hook more up to it later. It’s great for those people who use macs for they are notorious for not having many USB ports.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2016
CommentsContent: This is the first USB hub I have purchased that does not have a separate power supply.  It works just fine on an old Dell M1330 laptop running Vista and it is much more convenient/ useful.  The wireless mouse and keyboard connect and work just fine running through the hub.  I don't really care about the power switches on each port but since they are there I have turned off the two unused ports.  I don't understand the infatuation the designers (of all electronics) have with the blue lighting.  In a darkened room it is totally annoying.  I put the hub in a small cloth bag with a drawstring to resolve the issue of the blue lights.  Still gets 5 stars and a strong recommendation.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Love how I’m able to connect this easily to my computer. Worth the price! Love how I can utilize various USB at the same time. This has made my life easier.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this to watch my movies and such from flash drives on my tv cause I got tired of going in back of tv to switch out drives. But I can only put 2 in at a time instead of 4 cause ports are to close. I have all sandisk and pny flash drives and cant fit them in ports next to each other. Other then that it works great

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I received this as a X-mas gift.  It offers additional USB ports to my laptop.  The LED lighting adds a cool effect to the hub as an on & off option.  I like this hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2014
CommentsContent: With my husband and I both needing to charge our cell phones, kindles, iPad, etc. at the same time when traveling, we run short of easy to reach outlets, so this will help solve the problem.  We are also preparing to travel out of the country, and I have one outlet converter plug for the country we are going to.  Hopefully no problem--we can charge 4 devices with this handy, helpful USB Hub.UPDATE:I recently used it in New Zealand with an adapter I had purchased and was disappointed. It was so slow charging devices that I ended up getting more adapters to charge devices individually. I have not used it since.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: - use to switch on and off small low-speed, low-power devices- LED lights in the buttons shows which devices are active- adequate build quality and a great value even compared to small hubs without switches and lights

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I dont like having things plugged into the front of my PC, Picked this up, since I only needed 1 additional USB port and it did the trick. Low cost but good quality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I was thinking the switches were rocker type not push on / off, but with that said it seems to be working good so far. So I'll repost another review after I've used it a bit more.

CommentsTitle: The cord is too short it needs to be at least 4 to 6 inches longer.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021
CommentsContent: This USB hub is great, the only problem is the cord needs to be longer.  This USB hub is not made to charge batteries, it's only use is for data transfer, such as back up hard drives, printers, etc.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This is slow charger and doesn’t work on certain items, wish that would have been more clear in description. In addition, the buttons are easy to hit so you accidentally turn it off. Now I have to buy new product that actually charges so this was a waste

CommentsTitle: Good little addition to my desktop computer.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2019
CommentsContent: Whoever designed my new HP computer put all the USB ports on the back, making them impossible to reach without pulling the monitor out. CommentsTitle: It works well but don't overload it with high power devices
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2016
CommentsContent: Works great. My friend even bought one and his works great too. It does what it says. Gives you 4 ports in the space of one. I love the fact that you can use the switches to individual turn on/off as many ports as you want. It does not come with a power supply so it is drawing power from your computer usb port. With that in mind be careful of what you attached it. If you plug in several power hungry devices (eg a phone, external , tablet, etc) and turn on all of them one time it will overwhelm the system and cause it to shutdown the ports.For regular use with flash drives and lightweight stuff like that it functions very well.

CommentsTitle: Nice and you can turn power off
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I have a few of these and they have worked really well. I like that I can turn off power individually. I have a string of lights in my window that is USB powered, so I use this hub and just turn off the power to the lights via the hub when I am not using them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2016
CommentsContent: This Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UMLS) is just exactly what I needed.  I got a new computer for Christmas and it is made for travel and on the go, but it does not have enough USB ports for everyday use, such as for a printer or whatever I need to hook up to it.  I am using this computer on the go system for everyday use as a desktop computer, so I needed more USB ports.  Love it, just what I was looking for at a very good price.  Thank You Sabrent!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this because my laptop's USB ports are too close together and the things I need to plug in are not slim. With this, the wide plugs fit comfortably next to the slim plus (though I doubt two wides would play nicely together).I have not noticed any decrease in the performance of my headset or mouse from being plugged into this intermediary compared to directly into the computer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2013
CommentsContent: Overall, this product is great.  It does what it has to do.Pros:Build: it is built well and sturdy.  It feels like it can handle a beating.  It's strong yet lightweight.  The cord feels thick and I doubt it tears easily with constant maneuvering.Function: Works perfectly.  Plug it into your computer and then plug whatever USB devices you need to.  There is an LED blue glow around the buttons/switches which turn on when the corresponding USB port is activated.  The glow disappears when it is switched off.Compatibility: So far, every USB device has connected without any difficulty.  Connection remains strong without disconnecting randomly.Cons:Buttons can easily be pressed.  There is basically no security measure to prevent it from being pressed accidentally.  It's not a big thing but it's definitely something you wouldn't want to happen, especially if you're doing something like playing games.

CommentsTitle: Works well, and has a low profile.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this hub to provide low-profile USB connections between my auxiliary devices and my laptop. It works well. I like the ability to turn devices on and off at the hub. The cord is short, so the hub is right next to my laptop. It provides a better connection to my printer and Cricut than the USB slot on the pc does.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: So I used mine to plug into my tv so I could plug in my LED strip and neon sign. Works great, doesn’t get hot, and all the lights shine bright. Purchasing another for my computer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: I barely used this USB hub. Bought it for my car originally and turned out that I didn't drive much living in Brooklyn NY. I think it was about  6 months after the purchase, the hub stopped working. The LED lights were and are still on. But it wouldn't charge my phone or any type of device. Not sure about other 5 start reviews. Maybe this is one in a million bad product occurrence.

CommentsTitle: This item is something I should have purchased long ago
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: So far this is working great.  If you have multiple items to plug in to your computer, and you don't have enough usb ports..this is perfect.  I get tired of unplugging things then having to plug in again. What I like most about it, is the fact that it has buttons to turn an item off.  Like my camera for my desktop.  I can leave it plugged in, but I can turn it off when I am not using it.  So far great item for me

CommentsTitle: Great accessory, especially for devices with just one USB port.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2017
CommentsContent: CONVENIENT AND EASY TO USE:I have a Surface Pro with only one USB port.  I am so glad I bought this 4-port USB hub!  I can attach my printer, my 10-key pad, and an external hard-drive and leave it plugged in instead of having to keep switching them out.  The buttons are also convenient.  When I want to eject my external hard-drive from my computer, I can simply click the button to turn off that port after ejecting it.  My external hard-drive can still be attached physically, but its port is turned off.SMALL IMPROVEMENT SUGGESTION:The only thing I would like to see different about this product is a longer cord.  I was aware of the length at the time of purchase .  But it would help if it was just a bit longer by a few more inches.OVERALL:I would buy this product again.

CommentsTitle: Best value i found for this type device and,..
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2017
CommentsContent: i have a few multi-port usb hubs. those however have the connections at an off angle not flat or vertical as found with this one. it is an excellent value. i saw several others, the exact same thing but selling for nearly twice what i paid here. it does not have a separate power supply (i didn't want or expect to have one). usb 3.0 ports on a pc have more power supplied in contrast usb 1.0 & 2.0 (easily can tell by the shape of the male usb ends) which are very low power. so for most uses this is fantastic. IF however you are looking for something to charge a device, phone, tablet, mp3 player, etc. i would then recommend one with its own plug in power supply. that said couldn't be happier for something simple, priced well and does exactly what it needs to.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2016
CommentsContent: Wanted to love this USB hub from all the positive reviews but once i received mine i quickly connected it to a wall outlet cause nothing gives better power consumption than when using a wall connection, anyway I love how it allows me to power each one on or off and shows a cool blue light when it's charging but it doesn't charge any faster than if I was charging it off my computer and it's connected right to a wall plug so don't know if I have a defective unit or what. I will give it a few more days to see if charging improves with my devices otherwise I am returning for a refund.

CommentsTitle: Individually turn USB devices on and off
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2014
CommentsContent: I love this switch for the simple fact that it has a power switch for each USB port. Each switch is lit up when powered on which is very good for determing what is drawing power.I use this hub for my 3D printer. I have the printer plugged in as well as two web cams. Whenever I want to begin printing, I just go turn the three ports on that I need and get to work. This allows me to leave everything connected to my computer without being powered on. I run both webcam feeds through this usb hub and have absolutely no issues. The hub doesn't need an external power source which is even better.The cord is a little bit short, but I had plenty of USB extension cords that I could use since my 3D printer is about ten feet from my computer.The price of this USB hub is fantastic and it works very well. I will certainly be buying more.

CommentsTitle: It works but take forever to charge the phone or other devices
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2020
CommentsContent: When I first using this product, I thought my phone has a problem, not this product. But it turned out that this product takes way longer time to charge my devices like two or three more times is needed. I did not return it becaus it works although it takes forever to charge my phone. (I actually don't use it now, but I am still keeping it because for trip, its better than nothing I guess and it is really cheap so....)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2013
CommentsContent: Maybe I just got a faulty one, but it quit working not long after I received it, but the return window was closed.  It seems to have a short in it.  I plug it in and hear it connect on, then off, then on, then off.... VERY annoying!  If it worked, I would love it!  My new computer is small with only 2 usb ports, and I need a switch.  I thought I'd write a review of my experience, and look for a replacement device.  The idea is great, but it could cause damage to external hard drives or flash drives.  Occasionally I have to restart my computer, because this devices "on, off, on, off, causes this error:  "driver power state failure".  Hopefully they will improve their manufacturing of these devices.  Until then, I cannot recommend this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2016
CommentsContent: This thing doesn't do a fantastic job on its own. USB 1~2 standards dictate that a unit can deliver 100mA of current on average, and up to 500mA of current if the unit sends a request, and the host allows it. Now downstream if you have no power for your USB hub, you can only deliver 100mA per USB slot. So if your devices are not playing nice you may have dropouts in the USB Hub. Adding a power supply would fix this, but the power jack on the side appears to be non-standard. If you want a USB hub, I suggest spending a bit more and finding one that is powered. You will have fewer problems.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2014
CommentsContent: I have a problem with usb ports on my laptop that has space in between ports too tight that I can hardly use both ports at same time. Not with this unit, besides giving more ports to use, spaces between ports are not so close, not so far, and allowing me to use all ports at one time with ease. The on/off button is also convenient. If I want to connect or disconnect a drive, I just select the associated button and press it. I do not have to keep removing and reinserting the drives unless I need to carry them on a trip. The buttons are distanced enough for who with fat fingers.I might have one concern that the on/off switch is a little too soft to toggle. I have a cat which uses to hang around my laptop. I am afraid some day she is curious enough to tap on the blue light (button) while the device is in use. That might cause damage to files being written. I find a small hard-plastic cover to place over the buttons to protect them from possible accident. If the company could modify the switch to avoid accidentally turning off the device, I would give the product 5+ stars.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2021
CommentsContent: Works well.  Lights up cool blue and can turn off each channel separately so you don't need to keep plugging and unplugging cords.  Definitely worth the money and I would recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2021
CommentsContent: The product arrived quickly and I put it to use straight away. Although no instructions came with them, I was pretty confused about how it worked, specifically the buttons on the top. But after plugging it in and testing it out, I realized that they were used to eject/turn off the USB connection to the cable. I have plugged my keyboard and mouse into it and I have to say that it works perfectly. The connection is stable and there are no issues with a lag behind mouse movements or keyboard presses.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2019
CommentsContent: love it !! I run the usb from the back of the computer and taped it on the desk in front  so I can change plugs very easy and the power seams great nothing says low charge when there plugged in! plus it lights up blue my favorite color  KSW

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2014
CommentsContent: I was amazed at the quality of this unit, (and I'm a gadget freak). It has solid USB connections. Nothing loose and cheesy about it. I attached it to the face of my tower PC with mounting tape. Looks and functions very solid. I'm an amateur photographer and am constantly disconnecting one-to use it for something else. Having this has saved me a great deal of frustration. I can even leave the cables plugged into the hub and just power off the L.E.D. power switches, so now I don't need to hunt for cables. I'm using it full time now for a month and have had no problems whatsoever. I'm VERY glad I got over some of the "if'y" reviews and bought this.

CommentsTitle: Easy way to add an extra hub to our desktop computer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: We needed this item for another hub to plug our webcam into.  It is reasonably priced and works well. I've never used it to charge anything yet and that is why I gave charging power a 3rating.

CommentsTitle: Great idea, not enough power from the port
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I actually like this hub. It's nice to be able to turn the power on or off to each individual device that I'm charging. That comes in handy as the USB from my computer seems to not be able to support more than 1 maybe 2 of them being turned on without locking up the laptop. When I say "locking up" I mean that the mouse (also USB device plugged into another port) quits working until you shut off one of the charging ports on the hub.Is this the device's fault? I can't be sure if it's my computer or if it's because of the device. However, on the information provided from the seller there is no mention of this as a possibility to be aware of.The cord is very short and just barely long enough to put the port behind the laptop instead of having it sit on the keyboard.Perhaps a better solution would be to charge a battery pack and attach the hub to that pack to charge multiple devices? Maybe I'll give that a try.

CommentsTitle: Works fine, but not for what I needed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2020
CommentsContent: The product is sleek and probably works fine for most things, but I purchased this product to plug into my tv to power a light strip and my Roku stick. When I have both on, the hub does not have the ability to power both and the Roku turns off. Will be returning in hopes I can find one with a higher voltage capacity, but otherwise, the product works fine with only one thing plugged into it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I love to be able to turn the ports on and off. Four flash drives is a pretty tight fit, but it does work. Lap tops and computers keep reducing the number of USB ports. This is a must for people who need to store information in various places. I like it because if I get lost on which USB holds what information, I just shut a port down and watch the drive disappear. You may not understand what I mean, but if you buy this, you will.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Sometimes I think up ideas for products and am delighted to discover that they already exist. This was the case for the Sabrent 4-port USB Hub. This little friend does an exceptional job at powering my multiple laptop accessories: mouse, speaker, external keyboard, and more. I love the ability to switch ports on and off as needed.High quality at a low price makes this useful accessory a must-have.

CommentsTitle: Good for mouse & keyboard, BAD FOR LAN, WIFI, HD, SSD
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I was having problems with my wifi dropping out randomly, sometimes for a fraction of a second, sometimes completely (see photo). I thought it was my wifi adapter, so I bought a new one. Initially that seemed to do the trick, but then later I saw suggested items including versions of this very USB hub, except by maybe 2 or 3 different companies. Then my wheels started turning. I looked at the reviews for them and saw an issue come up again and again in the reviews. People using those hubs had trouble transferring large files to/from external storage (thumb drives, external hard drives, etc). So I did an experiment. I plugged the new wifi into this hub, plugged the old wifi directly into the computer, and ran a continuous ping with each (one at a time, not both at once). Sure enough, the new one gave results that look like the photo, and the old one was smooth sailing, not a single return slower than 25ms. So clearly this hub was the culprit. I didn't seem to have this problem when I got it in March, and it started acting up in mid July. I'd give this 2 stars but people aren't going to buy a hub unless they're going to be transferring data (wifi, HD, flash keychain, etc) and even at this price range that's not something you want to have working when it feels like it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2016
CommentsContent: My first USB hub and it is working out great. A very useful product and really comes in handy with all the electronics around these days, and saves wear on those USB ports. I should not have waited so long to get one but I am a procrastinator. I only have two ports on the front of my  desktop computer and one of those is worn out and plugging into the  back is too out of the way for me to deal with.Since purchasing this hub and plugging in to my computer it has really been a lot easier for me to keep things charged and ready when I want them it. I am a slow adapter to technology but in the past year I have  started to gain some ground, getting several portable items that need  charging quite often. My computer is a Window 8.1 and this hub works  with it.I love that there are light indicators to turn on and off the individual ports. I hope that I have helped you decide if you would like this product, it is working great for me. I used it to upload the pictures from my camera. Purchased this item from Store4PC.

CommentsTitle: Great Hub but needs longer cord.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2014
CommentsContent: I like this Hub for what it's suppose to do... connect other peripherals. I liked the buttons to turn ON/OFF the individual ports, but I don't think it was necessary after using it a few times. For one, I kept forgetting to push it ON. Which made me wonder why I couldn't see my external HD, DOH!! So most of the time I just leave it in the ON position. So far it has been doing well for the last month. Just had issues with just using it as a multiple charging port when plugged into a wall socket for phone and iPad, it charged only one at a time at a slow rate. Also the cord is very short, another foot would have been useful.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 29, 2020
CommentsContent: My first Sabrent hub worked fine for a year or more but then started sporadically cutting out whenever it got jostled. I bought another and that one cuts out, sometimes several times a minute, even when I'm nowhere near it.  I thought is was my computer until I tried each of the attached devices separately.  It's the hub and it's no good.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 29, 2014
CommentsContent: This product seemed like the best way to extend my 4 built in USB ports; however upon arrival I discovered it one of the buttons was already depressed, so no I have to push it down below the case to turn it off (fortunately  it still turns on and off) and in general due to the poor quality I am constantly nervous the buttons will break as they feel like they are always there right out of the case. all that aside, leaving them on, and just letting it sit and due its job; that it does just fine. If you plan to use the on/off feature, not the item to buy; if you want something cheep you can turn on and leave; but not planning on moving or taking are abuse then this might be okay.  I should note, that I have tried 3 other brands with a range of results; in the case of these style items, you get what you pay for and you will need to spend some money if you want something reasonably sized ( this is a very small item) which will take any wear and tear as it where.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this port to hook up my external keyboard, wireless mouse, and fan for my laptop. Works perfectly! I love how the ports not in use can be turned off. I love this one so well that I purchased a second port for my Xbox external hard drive and battery charger.My only complaint, the cord could be a little longer

CommentsTitle: This works well when your laptop has only one usb port and you need more.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: This product was recommended to me by my niece who is working from home.  I needed to open and download a data stick and still use my wireless mouse. Voila, this was a great solve.

CommentsTitle: Sabrent 4-port USB 2.0 hub saved the day!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2017
CommentsContent: My desktop computers hard drive recently took permanent leave so when I got it rebuilt I noticed my PCI card that was a hub for 5 USB slots no longer worked either! I done the natural thing and turned to Amazon, read the reviews and settled on the Sabrent 4 port 2.0 model and as usual it arrived in two days and saved the day! All of my Morher boards USB slots were busy So now I can plug in my backup hard drive, flash drives and thanks to Sabrent I can switch power on and off at will. I doesn't get any better! Thanks Sabrent and Amazon!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a really convenient little hub. It takes very little room, the cord is not so short that it's frustrating to actually use, and the small LED's are a pleasant shade of blue. The off/on feature of each port light is a nice touch. It seems sturdy and well made.It's always good to have a hub or two handy. Almost everything is a plug and play these days, it just makes sense to be prepared for multiple devices used simultaneously. As hubs go, this one isn't disappointing. Its almost elegant in its simplicity, actually.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2016
CommentsContent: although this was ordered by mistake (I actually needed an HDMI hub), at this low price, I decided to keep it.  With both back USB ports in use on my small no-physical-drive PC, I was able to use this hub in one of the front ones.  With this hub, I was able to plug in a portable CD-ROM drive, two flash drives and a portable hard drive.  And the real beauty is each port has its own on-off switch, so I can access each one as I need it.  The blue LED lights around each power button easily tells one which ports are active.I have seen higher prices for hubs that have none of these handy features.  And it doesn't require external power like some hubs do.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Has the four usb ports, there's power switches so you can turn off or on the usb connections individually, it's a bit short but that's fine since I'm working at a small distance not a long distance from my computer anyways.

CommentsTitle: The perfect solution to having too many fun (and useful) toys :)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2016
CommentsContent: We have too many gadgets and they all need to be charged with USB.  We had single plug chargers all over the house!!  It made me crazy (or crazier) because the plugs were never where I wanted them when I needed them!!!  So I had a brilliant idea, set up a charging station in a central location for all!!! :)  I bought this hub (which was delivered FAST) and extra charging cables.  WOOHOO I had a place to charge everything well almost everything at once!  I am going to be buying one more (maybe two more) so we can charge everything at once.  I have already set it up so that when we travel (even over night) it is easy to unplug one pack it and have everything we need to charge everything we want.  I love it, I had an idea that was actually helpful!!! :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2019
CommentsContent: I liked the first one I bought so much, got this one to have a spare. I like keeping some of my peripherals hooked up all the time even though I rarely use more than one at a time. That's really what it's for since it provides no power on its' own.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I've had two of these.  At first they worked great!  But, they only operate for a few months.  The first one worked for about 8 months.  I assumed this was not a typical issue.  However, the second one worked for 4 months.  I will not use again.  Poor product.

CommentsTitle: Plug and play at a great price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2014
