CommentsContent: I somehow broke the switch that turns my WiFi on and off for my Sony laptop.  Of course it was somehow in the off position and the local repair shop could not get it turned "on".  They offered me a USB wireless device to connect to my WiFi at home for a lowered price of something close to $50.  The reduced price was because they had tried to fix the switch.  I immediately thought of Amazon and ordered this to go with the wireless USB adapter since I only have 2 built-in USB ports and use one for a wireless mouse.  Received this quickly and plugged it in and was up and running.  I wish the attached cord was either longer, or the device was someway attachable to the laptop to make it more streamline.  Even so, overall I am pleased with the purchase.

CommentsTitle: Worst Camera Ever, But Has Other Uses
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2019
CommentsContent: For some reason, Amazon's automated system seems to expect me to review this as a Camera. I can safely say that, while this is a highly effective 4-port USB charger, it fails in every respect as a camera.Looking at Amazon's feature list, the first thing it wants me rating is camera quality. I'm afraid I have to give this only a single star. If I could, I would give it even less. Forget megapixels, I was unable to use this alleged camera to get even a SINGLE pixel onscreen. I really have to question the decision-making of the manufacturer, seeing as they decided to forgo camera quality in favor of accessory features, like four LED USB ports which light up when charging, and thus allow me to easily manage power output to multiple devices.I must give it a 1 in charge power as well. While it has proven itself exceedingly useful when it comes to charging OTHER devices, such as my tablet PC, Phone, XBox One controller, and wireless mouse, it does not keep a charge for even a single second. Had I been expected to rate its capabilities at charging other objects, I would of course have given it a five star, the blue LED lights take minimal power and allow me to choose between putting almost all of the charge power into my charging device when I go out for a walk, or having several devices plugged in at a time.My laptop's USB ports are largely broken, and there's only one of them. This USB hub allows me to plug in an extra keyboard and mouse, because the shoddy quality of the Alienware keyboard the laptop came with meant that its keys have largely fallen off. I have had no choice but to find a USB hub, such as this one, when it comes to charging. I've used several brands of USB hub, and this is absolutely the best one I can find.I have, thus, given it TWO stars for cable length. Its cable is actually slightly larger than normal for USB hubs, meaning I don't need to worry as much about bumping it when I move my hands around the desk. It's really quite generous in that respect. However, even long for a USB hub is very short for a camera, which somehow the algorithm believes this is. As a camera, the charge cable is far too small. Once again, however, you need not worry, because it won't actually keep its charge anyway.I'm sorry to say that I am cannot in good conscience approve of the camera I was provided. However, since the page I bought it was labeled a USB extender port, and it is 100% the best one of those I have ever seen, sturdier than most, sticking effectively in the port on my laptop that most other things jiggle out of, that's not really that much of a disappointment.If you are looking for a digital camera, look elsewhere. This is not a digital camera. However, if you want a USB port, I cannot possibly recommend it highly enough. This is a miracle, and if it ever breaks just from overuse from how much I am carrying it around and such, I fully intend to replace it with another of the same brand. You can't get a better 4-port USB port, a fact which, I hope, will somewhat soften the blow to anyone who expected a camera.Five stars to the product, and one star to whatever idiot made Amazon's product recognition algorithms.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a great gadget if you need multiple ports for headsets, microphones, light up pads and everything else gaming. Wish the cord was a little longer, but does the trick.

CommentsTitle: A great buy for anyone who dislikes using touchpads.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2018
CommentsContent: A handy dandy little accessory, especially in an era where manufacturers limiting the number of USB ports.  It came in real handy because I hate the touchpad/pointer on my laptop and connecting my wired all in one printer, wireless mouse and keyboard was a snap.  Made it easy to transfer the devices to my work laptop when needed.  I liked it so much I purchased a second one for a friend and she loves it too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2020
CommentsContent: LOVE THIS. my keyboard, laptop, webcam, and iphone all plug into one device and then into my work-from-home laptop.  Being able to turn off each item via the illuminated buttons is a nice feature instead of unplug-re-plugging every time.  ...and yes, it charges my iphone when plugged into a power source

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2016
CommentsContent: I have used this unit before; unfortunately I did not get that far this time.  I had a bad time with the packaging.I cut the top inch off and tried to tear it open.  It did not go well, and the package was covered in blood.  I moved lower to cut it open and the connector had or was packed in the top portion and I cut if off.  Needless to say it went into the trash.The packaging is cheap and dangerous and is overkill, especially if you cut yourself up.  I guess anti-theft is more important than safe packaging,I will reorder and use a chain saw to open the next time!While the unit is OKm, the packaging is CEAP

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: My new computer didn't have enough conveniently placed USB ports, so I use this to supplement it.  It's great for that.  I especially appreciate the ability to toggle the things plugged in on and off.  It makes it very easy to switch between a couple of different modes in my computer without having to fiddle with what's plugged in.I do wish the cord was maybe 6" longer so it could sit comfortably on top of my computer without the cord being stretched taught and prone to sliding.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Boss who has never touched a computer and guy at Walmart picked out new laptop for me to use.  No. This laptop only has 2 USB ports, one of which I have to use to access internet.  Yeah, I know. This has given me ports I needed for everything else and my cursor is now under control.  So grateful for Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub for putting me back in control.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 15, 2016
CommentsContent: This device totally fills needs I never knew I had. What a concept, switches for the different devices you have mounted on extensions... perfect for my backup external which does not have its own power switch. PEerfect for activating the line of a plugged in device which seems to be a boost for the system to recognize the USB, which is sometimes flakey on Windows machines. Saves me a lot of trouble, just wish the cable was somewhat longer... I had to buy an extension to get this too my desktop.Delivery and quality folow thru with shipping from this vendor. Very happy

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I had to do some research about whether to get a device that supports usb 2.0 or 3.0.  Also learned that this NOT a charger for phones. I wanted a hub for my laptop, to plug in keyboard, mouse, backup thumbstick, etc.  Love the short cord and lighted buttons to turn ports on/off. This device is exactly what I needed. It is performing well. My laptop only had 2 usb ports (because it also had HDMI and micro ones). This "extension cord" saved me from having to buy a new laptop. Well worth the price!

CommentsTitle: I'VE HAD THIS FOR YEARS. I LOVE THIS!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2020
CommentsContent: This purchase I have never once regretted - it's super portable and is a live saver for me. I use a ton of things attached to my MAC when I work - so it's awesome. Hope the quality is similar from years ago cause I would hate to disappoint new customers lol - BEST PURCHASE I HAD MADE THO... IT STILL WORKS PERFECTLY !

CommentsTitle: Cool-Cool -2 Cool-Mini Product!!!! Buy me and give me as a gift-yes great Holiday gift for a friend or Loved One
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2017
CommentsContent: Great product-switch that can be turned on and off and lites up blue on each switch when you push one of the 4 buttonsGreat item if you need more usb ports for keyboard wireless usb mouses usb speakers lamps-you name-I even charge my electronic cigarette and cell phone-Every penny worth the low price I paid-It's mini as well and doesn't take up any space whatsoever- the size of a mini harmonica-get one!!!!All ports work well and I am drawing a lot of voltage otta this little acer one netbook-without consequences so far.

CommentsTitle: The USB hub is a pretty basic, cheap
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2016
CommentsContent: Anyone who uses a mac knows the frustrations of the limited USB ports that most of them have to offer. I edit a lot of my photography work on the mac and it became frustrating when I had to transfer data between multiple devices or merely organize my external hard disks. The USB hub is a pretty basic, cheap, not so nice looking but works pretty well kind of a product. Even with all the positive reviews, I wasn't sure if it would be as good and was expecting a port or two to fail on me by now. But, much to my relief, it hasn't. It's been plugged to my system since it was shipped to me and became an essential part of my work gear. It has 4 slots with buttons that lit up with a blue light when on and fully pressed. I usually have my mouse and USB drives connected to it and also my 2TB external hard drive and it has been able to take all the load. One of the buttons is faulty and seems like its not on and presses when it actually is. So far, I haven't come across any cons of the product and glad that i bought it.

CommentsTitle: Ordered new, received used, replaced by seller w/ new one
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2017
CommentsContent: One USB port didn't work!  Didn't anyone TEST it in the manufacturing process?  Not worth the time/trouble to return.Edit #1: The package looked like it might have been opened.  Perhaps a prior customer damaged it & then returned it?  If so, who should have retested it?Edit #2: Seller shipped new, fully working replacement.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Even though new vehicles have lots of ports, this device offers an opportunity to charge phones, GPSs, lap tops, etc. all close by whether it's in your car or home. And you don't have to worry about not having enough wall sockets, especially in hotel rooms. Works well!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2016
CommentsContent: I use my Asus laptop as my primary "desktop" computer as well as a laptop, and unfortunately, the 3 included USB ports were not enough, or in good locations for stationary work. After a few months of use, I can safely say this product was a bargain for what it does. It is not powered, so you cannot use this to charge USB devices, but the four USB 2.0 ports are very well suited for most accessories. I saw no need to spend more money for a USB 3.0 hub when all I needed to hook up were a Keyboard, mouse, and occasionally a flash drive for small file transfers. I could use the 3.0 ports on my laptop itself if I needed the extra speed (though 2.0 is fine for most). The build quality on this hub is second to none, and I like that I can deactivate the ports when they are unused. The cable is thin and flexible so I can position this hub as I need it. I would highly recommend this hub and other Sabrent products. I also purchased a SATA III Hard Drive USB enclosure for my laptop's old hard drive when I swapped it out for an SSD. Again, a fantastic product of very high quality that will last for years.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been looking for a compact USB hub for my laptop. One that offers versatility and space saving attributes. This Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub does just that for me. I really like the short cord that really helps keep the desktop less cluttered. Works great.I have not tried the "charging" capability however I am certain it works just fine.

CommentsTitle: I bought one for home and it works wonderfully. I thought I'd purchase one for the office *update!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 15, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought one for home and it works wonderfully. I thought I'd purchase one for the office, that one works NOT so wonderfully and has promptly been sent back. I'm not sure if it's a product quality issue or just the fact that at home the product is working with an iMac and at the office a Lenovo laptop, but at work it constantly disconnected and reconnected and wasn't reliable. I also noticed the one I purchased for work had a very snug fit with all of my UBS devices and at times I felt like I was jamming them into the ports. Quality control needs to improve on this product for sure.**Update** Sabrent reached out to me and replaced the product free of charge. Excellent customer service and the new products work wonderfully. Thank you Sabrent and I will change from 3 stars to 5!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Worked good for a few months then just at random this past Saturday would not work for my iPhone 8 or any other iPhones that I have for that matter. Neither through my laptops or plugged into another USB port outlet.Definitely only has a limited time use for Apple products apparently. Works for everything else though. Being that I usually have my phone connected to my laptop through there, now that it doesn’t want to read my iPhone I won’t be using it as much and will be going with another product.

CommentsTitle: Does what the description says it does
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2018
CommentsContent: I don’t know what to say about this other than knowing I can now charge four five phones with this. Or connect a bunch of console controllers via usb through this.The product is simple, works, and has (admittedly mildly disappointing) LED switches to quickly power on or off ports whenever needed.Also, while I am unsure which ac adapter this product takes, you can plug in a compatible ac adapter to use power-intensive usb devices with it.

CommentsTitle: Does its job and does it well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2016
CommentsContent: Love itThis is my second one, they do break if dropped but work for quite some time and very helpfulI use this with my Toshiba laptop running windows 8.1 that doesn't work with a lot of USB wires. This little hub acts as a middle man so i dont have to bother putting things on SDs or getting to my windows 10 or 7 computers.if you have multiple of the same device type plugged in but don't want to take them out and risk losing the dongles you can just leae them in and turn off that specific port and this lil guy is much easier to find but its also small enough to carry with you when you go.

CommentsTitle: Works well. I like the on/off switches!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2020
CommentsContent: 7/10/2020 purchased this because my antique laptop has only two USB and in today's wired world, you need more.  It works well for connecting my phone to the laptop, I keep my mouse plugged in full time and rarely have an issues with it, and the on and off option allows me to not worry if I keep a cord in that the cord or the laptop will be damaged.  I do wish the cord was a bit longer, but honestly I haven't found many of the USB hubs with long cords, and this is the longest one of the lot.  My Kindle does keep tell me low-charge, but not sure if that's the hub or my computer.  My phone has said it twice since obtaining it.  Otherwise it's quite happy with it.  I'm happy too. :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2014
CommentsContent: I have had this for about a year now and have only occasionally had problems with it, but they are worth mentioning.Pros:Buttons to turn ports on and off is nice. In retrospect, this isn't as useful as I thought it would be, but it is still I fairly nice feature. It is just really not that often that I have something plugged in and I don't want to use it.Small and compactCons:The cable for this is insanely small. To make this product worthwhile I also bought an AmazonBasics USB Extension Cable. I have the entire hub set up on the top corner of my desk but wired down to the back of my computer. I can see how many people would not need an extension cable, however, if they are just setting this up on a laptop or have a spare port on a keyboard.Anything related to audio doesn't really work with this hub. My headset / USB Speakers or small things like that always end up receiving an annoying hum as feedback when plugged in here but work totally fine if plugged in anywhere else on my computer. Work around this hasn't been a problem for me, but if you need this hub to have more space for headset or other audio equipment, I would look for a different product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought the one in the photo December 2018. It's now July 2020 and I need to purchase a new one. I believe there may have been a power surge that caused two of my computer items to die. One was my laptop charging battery and the other was this USB port extender. I was surprised with how long and how well this USB port extender worked. I've used others that did not connect to my computer or gadgets. this works, buy it! I'm upgrading to the 10 port extender because I like it so much and because my computer is about 3 years old and only 2 of 3 of the USB ports on it are working.I can't speak for the 10 port yet, but if you are considering the 4 port USB extender, BUY IT :) I've used this for my mouse/keyboard, printer, scanner, to charge my phone and watch, and to open flash drives.

CommentsTitle: Avoid this hub and buy one that will work.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2014
CommentsContent: Couldn't get this USB 2.0 hub to even work. My PL recognized it just fine, but the moment you plug a device in and then hit the switch to send power to that port, and the hub resets itself over and over never allowing the PC to recognize the device or load the device drivers. Instead all you hear is the PC sound saying a device was plugged in, then start loading drivers but at that second chiming that the device was unplugged and it cycles bock and forth plugging in and unplugging. I'd return it but only paid $3 or $4 and the return postage would cost more than the refund. Avoid!

CommentsTitle: Great for lights and fans and such, not for data
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2020
CommentsContent: It's a beautifully made device, the switches are sublime, and the packaging was a work of art.  I plugged in my keyboard and mouse right away, but moved them back to the computer's ports about five minutes later - both devices became erratic.  Maybe one data-driven device at a time would work, but definitely not two.  However, my non-data devices are working great and I really like it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2016
CommentsContent: Purchased the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UMLS). The device only worked with my flashdrive. It did not work with my keyboard and my mouse. I work on a laptop but have a mouse and keyboard that I need to connect. Anyways, the device was useless to me because it couldn't connect those devices. The product description states that accessories such as a mouse or keyboard can be connected with this hub but that is not accurate information.

CommentsTitle: Hub simply stopped working for no discernible reason
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2016
CommentsContent: I was given this hub by a friend who bought it from Amazon for me. It's maybe nine months old (in my possession), and today it has simply stopped working. It's plugged in, as always, but I leave the ports off unless I am using the devices plugged into it. Now not one of the blue lights comes on when any of the four buttons is depressed.I just don't know enough about the technology to guess at why it has stopped working. Usually things with moving parts are most susceptible to breakdowns, but except for the buttons that activate and deactivate the ports, nothing else moves or has changed since I hooked this up. I have had a couple of power outages recently, but they have occurred when my Mac has been asleep. Perhaps there have been surges, but none of my other equipment has had problems.I'll be buying a new hub, but I won't be buying another one of these, even though it's Amazon's favorite.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2020
CommentsContent: The cord was too short for what I needed. But that issue is on me should've double checked. This product worked fine without any issues for about a month or so but recently I came across the problem that it is not recognizable on my computer. It was really convenient that I can turn off individually for each slot. I just wished it didn't stop working all of a sudden.

CommentsTitle: Do not use as charger. Actually DECREASES Battery!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I was so excited to get this USB expander/splitter.  My plan was to use this to charge multiple devices from one USB.  I plugged in my phone and my tablet, and was very disappointed. The tablet shows that the charger is plugged in, but there is a red "X" over the battery icon, indicating that it is not actually charging.  I tested that cord plugged directly into the original USB (the one that this new 4-port charger was plugged into)  and it works fine.  My phone gave me the message that it was "slow charging" and that I should check to see if it was plugged in properly.  I checked to make sure all of the connections were good, and went off to take a shower.  When I came back, my battery had DECREASED by 2%!!  I then checked that cord the same as I did the other cord, and sure enough, it works just fine.Thankfully, it was only $8, because I'd already thrown away the packaging, and I'm not sure it will be worth the time and effort of a return.Unfortunately, this device will not work for me for the purpose I intended. :(

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a nice USB hub and I've been using it a great deal with Zoom meetings. I can plug my webcam, USB mic, LED light, and powerpoint remote and use them with ease. Nice product, and I especially like being able to turn off each individual USB port when I want.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2021
CommentsContent: does a great job.  Plug into the laptop, add your extra stuff (mouse, keyboard, headset, etc) and turn on the outlet.  Downside:  if it "rolls over" it might press the button and shut it off!

CommentsTitle: Does the job it's supposed to do, great value!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2015
CommentsContent: Original product got lost in shipping (currently says it's in Memphis TN???). I blame that on USPS though... Amazon cancelled that order for me, refunded me the money, and after I re-placed the order, they upgraded my shipping to overnight at no charge... so the package did get here with no major issues at all. It's super easy to unpackage, plug it in, switch on the buttons for the ports you are using, and it works. Really nothing to it, just a great little compact item if you have a lack of USB ports on your computer for your peripherals. For the price, it's hard to beat. I have not noticed any speed or download issues with this product (I am using two ports, one for a printer and one for an external Hard Drive). I even like the blue lights!

CommentsTitle: Great item for a great price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2016
CommentsContent: Item arrived on time and as advertised.  Thanks to this handy little item, I'm able to hook up 2 older printers to my laptop along with the stick for the wireless mouse and I still have one more open slot as a spare.  Everything seems to be working well so far and as Amazon had the item for a GREAT price (especially when compared to an in-town electronics store), I couldn't be happier with the item.  Item is small and compact with just the right amount of cord and I will gladly buy another one for our other laptop if the need arises.

CommentsTitle: This is one of the best out there.. my version lol!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2013
CommentsContent: This is really good one! Don't have to buy the expensive one, they work the same, well unless you are a mad scientist or Computer super programmer that knows a lot better than me about cables.. oh, so you are!.. ehemm... sorry..Advice; always push the button on top of socket that you plugged in, that my friends, is the power supply buttons to supply power and retrieve information from your usb storage device that you plug in to, not the one that you don't plug in. anyway,.. just push that damn button will ya.. then you can write a good review.If someone said the other products are far better than this.. buy it!  ........well at least that guy has already try this one and also try another one and still decide that the other product still better, I don't, I'm not that mad scientist.

CommentsTitle: Great USB Hub that I use w/ Raspberry Pi Zero
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2016
CommentsContent: Great USB hub! A great price and it works great, although I've only been using it with my Raspberry Pi Zero for RetroPie gaming. I've noticed that this hub is one of the few that is able to power all of the ports when used with the Zero board. Other hubs don't distribute enough power evenly through all the ports at the same time. This one is great, and I especially love the option to turn off individual ports with a simple button. And, the LED light around the button makes it easy to know which ports are powered and which ones are off. I can't recommend this enough, especially for those in the Rasp Pi community!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I probably would not be writing this bad review on one of the ports being bad but I bought 2 of these Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual LED lit Power Switches (HB-UMLS), but there is 1 port on each one that does not work so don't waste your money on these external USB ports.

CommentsTitle: SO convenient in our Shelter In Place home office
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I can plug in keyboard, trackball, camera plus one other thing - this means when I switch from work laptop to personal laptop I have only ONE thing to swap out!  This saves endless untangling of cords!  It seems to handle all my devices quite happily, nothing has failed, charged devices seem to be just fine.  Overall entirely happy

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2020
CommentsContent: Life saver!  This totally helped me out when I had to transition to work from home since I was using my laptop that only had 1 usb slot.  This helped out a bunch and allowed me to connect a wireless mouse, bigger keyboard and even left me with a slot to use for my phone.  Good price and quick shipping!  Product definitely works well for the price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020
CommentsContent: This was recommended by a friend and is perfect for my needs, with clear blue on/off switches for each plug used.  Compact, well made, great packaging.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I ordered this three days ago. Thought it would come in a week, imagine how surprised I was when I saw it on my front porch (BTW, not safe: could have been stolen or something. We have mailboxes for a reason). It seems to work fine, has all the features the description said it has. I especially like it because my current PC only has one (1) USB port and a lot of things I need to connect to it (at the same time) have a USB cord. It's also nice that I can decide which port I want off when I want. Not a bad purchase! Let's see what happens in a few months....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2015
CommentsContent: I had before given this a bad review by saying it was lose and would fall out. little did i know that it was my usb port on my laptop board. so after opening the case to the laptop and tightening a few screws it works perfectly. Sorry it took me so long to correct this as i could not figure out how to edit the review. Once again great product and the seller contacted me and even offered to send me a replacement even tho nothing was there fault. Great company great item. 100% positive review . to bad the don't make cars!! lol

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Needed something to add USB ports as the company sent a laptop with 2 ports and equipment that required more. This works great for that purpose; haven't had any issues. Would recommend for expanding USB ports if that's what you need.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Smaller than I thought it would be but, that was a pleasant surprise. I love the options to turn device on and off directly from hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: Really great port. Was able to free up so much space in my work area now that I have the usb cords behind my lab top. Love the fact that I can turn off the usb for each individual connection.Great product

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2020
CommentsContent: We are using this product as we teach from home. The Bluetooth for the mouse and 2 flash drives are plugged into this extension. Everything works well.

CommentsTitle: Great product works like it’s supposed, short cord.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2021
CommentsContent: It gets a 4 of 5, only because the cord is short. It works to switch off the camera & headset, external drive & I have a spare still for a jump drive to share info. The light is bright. Up = off & down, blue light on = on. It arrived fairly quickly. Package was simple & easy to open, recycle too.

CommentsTitle: Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual...  sold by  Sabrent
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2018
CommentsContent: Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual... sold by  SabrentThis is a handy usb controller and the lit PB switchs are also helpful in isolation of the sockets.  Small in size can be carried most anywhere.A word of caution....  when you have drives running from this device, DON'T TOUCH IT!!!  I don't know if the switch contacts are not pressing hard enough or if contact somewhere else fails but you will shut down your drive by simply moving it.It works FINE as long as you do not touch or move it until the drive has completed its task.Works where you need to expand your USB drive, like with a laptop that only has one USB port.  and the buttons light up when pushed to use the associated USB port.  Honestly, I have had no failure using it as long as I don't touch or move it while data transfer is initiated.I took one star off because of the sensitivity of the hub but otherwise, I like it.***  I did receive an email from the seller, right after my order was in for this device.  They wanted to know if there were any problems after I received it so they could take care of any concerns......  and I told them of the problem.That was the LAST I heard from them....  for what its worth.  ***I am not associated nor did I receive any merchandise or monies for my unsolicited review.180413 1453

CommentsTitle: Good unit for the price, does the job!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2015
CommentsContent: I needed an extra Hub ports to charge my tablet, Ipad and the phone. This 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub does the job.I like that there are buttons over each port which you press to activate the port you are using now. The blue light which comes on when the port is activated is very helpful; it shows you which ports are in use.The unit is very compact; I plan to take this USB Hub with me when I’m travelling because it doesn’t take a lot of space at all. I can easily plug all my electronics at the same time.What I don’t like about this unit is that the four ports are really close to each other. So when I tried to plug in a simple flash drive I couldn’t plug in another device next to it. Also the cable could be longer, it easily disconnects if the hub is moved.Otherwise I think it’s a good gadget for a price. I would recommend it.

CommentsTitle: Bought first in 2013, and now in 2014
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2014
CommentsContent: EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED!!! I was desperate for something like this - my laptop only has 3 USB ports, and 2 are permanently spoken for. There are times when I needed to have more USB ports because of my devices that need to be connected via USB to my laptop. This works great. Just plug into laptop USB and plug into it whatever you need. And you don't have to keep connecting and disconnecting - you can turn the USB off with the switch (LED light indicates on/off). And if you need more than a 4 port, you can get another 4 port and connect it to this one (according to the package). When you have everything turned off, you don't need to eject USB on the laptop because it only reads what is turned on.I highly recommend this product.**UPDATE 9/15/2014**I ordered another one because with all the products I'm getting that require a USB port (wired keyboard, USB LED light, etc), I just needed another. Took it right out of the packaging, plugged it in....and it works. It works connected to the laptop directly, and it also works connected to another 4-port Hub that's connected to the laptop.I know some people will wonder why I bothered getting a wired keyboard that would require a USB port (because my laptop key pads are acting up, and I don't want to worry about battery life with a wireless), but all in all, I'm happy with my first and second Sabrent 4-Port USB Hub.Fast delivery, and I've had no problems with it. Both times. Now THAT says something.

CommentsTitle: So glad that someone had the smarts to invent something like ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2016
CommentsContent: So  glad that someone had the smarts to invent something like this especially now days when notebooks and laptops don't have enough USB ports  and everything is headed towards the flash drive.  Being able to turn each port on and off for what is needed is such an awesome feature.  Each port will display a light letting you know if it's on or not.  My Surface Pro 3 laptop only has one port. Because of this ingenious device, I am able to plug in a mouse, an external hard drive to back up my work, a portable flash drive (thumb drive), with another port open to charge various devices (if my notebook is plugged into an outlet) such as my phone, iPad or Bluetooth earphones!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I found that the ports themselves are a little hard to use-- with all of my devices I had to jiggle the cord a bit to get them to fit which worried me at first, but once you get them in it works!It came quickly and is a really convenient addition to my workstation.

CommentsTitle: The Sabrent hub did not work with any device.  All devices work on my old hub.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2015
CommentsContent: Since the Sabrent hub was inexpensive, I decided to replace my old working hub with the Sabrent to take advantage of individual USB port switches.  My old hub has no switches.  The computer responded to the Sabrent USB hub being plugged in, but no devices would work with it.  I also had difficulty inserting my wireless mouse USB receiver into any of the slots, although my wireless keyboard receiver inserted OK.  I  then  connected the Sabrent hub to a different USB port, but the Sabrent hub still did not work.  Neither my wireless mouse nor my wireless keyboard would work.  The buttons on the Sabrent did  illuminate when plugged in.  I tried turning buttons on and off and still nothing worked.  I plugged the devices back into my old hub and everything worked again.  Could just be bad quality control and the mfg never tests the device before selling it.  I must rate it 1 star since it did not function.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I started out using a 32GB thumb drive (USB) and partitioned it to separate MP3s and for Tesla Dashcam, it worked fine but I noticed some quality issues and a few bugs while screening through dashcam videos. I read that a USB hub will work and found several Tesla owners giving this a high rating. It works as intended and I am able to charge my phone, connect two thumb drives, 32GB & 16GB, for music and dashcam, and best of all I can use the Logitech gamepad F310. I do like the feature of disabling the USB ports and the only time I do that is when removing the video drive.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2019
CommentsContent: Have a touchy keyboard that won't fully function until it's unplugged and then plugged back into the USB port. Very inconvenient. Got this switchable hub to see if that would lessen the inconvenience and for that it works like a charm! Only real complaint is the very short cable length; that's okay for my Mac Mini, but could be a bit of a headache for other setups.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2021
CommentsContent: Has 4 ports and each has its own switch. You don't have to mess with the computer to disconnect, you just turn off the switch. It works better than the USB ports in my computer. They are getting old and there doesn't seem to be any good way to clean them.

CommentsTitle: great if you need extra USB connections
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2021
CommentsContent: this is my 3rd 1 from Store4PC and they are great. Putting in a USB PCI card in the back is so much trouble.This plugs in and you.re ready to go

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I liked the reasonable price, and the 4 blue off-on lights, and most important it extended the 2 ports on the front of my computer tower to 6, and it did not lose a sound or connection strength. It does exactly what it was said to do.I am delighted with this product and give it a full 5 stars. Thank you Brent and Amazon!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this device for my son who needed extra USB ports for his MIC/Camera needed for school. Its been works great. He loves the fact that you can turn each USB port on/off individually without turning everything off or unplugging it. Also, the light up LED is a nice touch. Especially, since his Keyboard, mouse, headset, PC all light up.

CommentsTitle: Great if you're not charging devices.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: If you're charging multiple devices with this off of one power supply than the devices will charge slowly. If you're just trying to increase the number of usable ports on your Xbox, Playstation, or PC/MAC then this product is great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2014
CommentsContent: Most things being USB driven these days, my laptop and two older towers are always in need of "just one more" USB port.This gizmo is ideal, not only can you attach additional devices, but you can turn any on or off in any combination, and the blue LED helps keep it all straight. If you, like me, have a bunch of USB memory sticks, chips and adapters each with a copy of "something" and want to get it all consolidated on one machine, this helps. I have a dozen or more microSD chips for smart phones, mp3 players, even bluetooth speakers that accept a chip with mp3 tunes, digital camers... you get the idea.It's also a bargain accessory. Works very well, recommended.

CommentsTitle: Not reliable, would not buy again.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2018
CommentsContent: Junk. I tried using it for two months but found it to be very unreliable. Sometimes the ports worked, sometimes not. For instance, if I ever disconnected my laptop and took it in the other room, then returned and hooked the external keyboard back up to the laptop through this port, it wouldn't work until I restarted the laptop. Countless other similar situations and it got to the point where I just unhooked it because it would make me so frustrated at times. I basically burned $6.99 for nothing.Bottomline, if you like a device that works half the time, this is for you

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021
CommentsContent: This little charger works great for charging general USB devices (like hand warmers, lanterns, toys, etc) however it does not charge my iphone (it must not be mac compatible). So many things have replaced batteries with USB charging cords that I needed something to charge multiple things at once and this seemed to be the answer. It does take a bit longer than I would have liked but overall it serves its purpose for now. I can't decide if the on/off button for each port is useful since sometimes I plug in the device and do not turn ON so I go get my device later expecting it to be already charged and nothing, because I forgot to push the little ON button.

CommentsTitle: Value for money, depending on your use case
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2020
CommentsContent: This review is for the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual LED lit Power Switches (HB-UMLS).So look carefully, it is USB 2.0 not 3.0, so if you need speed, forget it. But it's perfect for my use case, where I have multiple wireless dongles for keyboards and mice that I attach to the hub. It's nice to be able to switch them on/off individually and the hub lets me quickly switch from using one computer to another. And at least when I bought it, it was cheaper than other options.

CommentsTitle: Useful for computers with minimal usb ports or for wireless devices at work
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2017
CommentsContent: With newer laptops coming with less and less usb ports, this hub is essential. I have a laptop where the usb ports are so close together you can't stick two usb sticks in next to each other. There are four ports on this hub which can be "turned on" by clicking each of the little buttons above it. I use it to keep the receivers for my wireless keyboard and mouse that I only use at work and at the end of the day I just remove the hub and keep it in my desk- no more searching for your receivers that you accidentally took out at home. The cord length is about 9 inches, so more than enough to clear whatever else you may have plugged into your computer. The hub itself is very light so you can leave it hanging off your computer.

CommentsTitle: Convenient but, only for simple things
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2013
CommentsContent: So I'm editing this because I've had it for a bit now and I can be more accurate. It works great! I love that I can turn the ports on and off, but it sucks I can't plug up a drawing wacom tablet (pressure won't work). Actually at first a hard drive wouldn't work in it but, now it does for some reason. a problem that i forgot about is! MOVING UT AROUND WHILE YOU HAVE THINGS PLUGGED INTO IT WILL ON AMD OFF SAY IT'S DISCONNECTED ETC. ITS ANNOYING. THIS DOESNT HAPPEN WHEN YOU FIRST FIRST GET IT. otherwise i experience no other issues. At the same time it is great if you just need the extra ones to charge a phone or plug in a usb for a wireless mouse or something! So far so good! Etc.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2013
CommentsContent: I was trying to look for a USB hub to connect to my Nexus 7 2013 via OTG cable, and this is exactly what I wanted. Most of the USB's couldn't attach directly through the OTG cable, but when I plugged this USB Hub into the OTG cable, it allowed any and all of my accessories (Flash drive, mouse, sd card reader) to be connected.The thing I liked best about this USB hub was the ability to turn on or off the ports on the hub, which meant, I could turn off the devices without completely unplugging the device. The fact that the power switches had a blue LED was an added bonus to all my other blue LED lit up devices.For the price and convenience, I would buy this USB hub again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Great value for the price, does the job for which it is intended.Picky gripes:The lights "bleed" through to their neighbors' indicator windows, so depending on your lighting conditions it isn't always easy to tell which ones are on.The cord could be longer.  I would certainly like it to be more easily accessible, but obviously that depends on your setup.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021
CommentsContent: This USB extender is perfect for my laptop I only have 2 USBs and since everything uses USB ports 2 just doesn't cut it. Now I can plug in speakers, a CD Rom ( since my laptop didn't come with one ) my cell phone, and my portable HDD.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: I like it but it just isn't long which is my only problem since it's just dangling off of my pc and gets in the way at times. overall though it works great and works with anything that supports the USB drive.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I LOVE this thing. It was super easy to set up (just plug it in) and you get extra USB ports. It also has on/off buttons for each item you plug into it, which is a really nifty feature. Super helpful. I would recommend this item!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2016
CommentsContent: I own two of these hubs; one for my laptop (constantly plugged in) and one for my netbook. They both work great. Driver installation took a very short time. Any USB device that I have plugged in to this hub are recognized and work seamlessly on Windows; devices like keyboard, mouse, bluetooth keyboard/mouse combo, flash drives and also a TV Tuner. What Iike most about this is the buttons. So, I don't need to physically unplug my TV Tuner (for instance); I just turn the switch off when I don't need that devices and turn it back on when I need the device.

CommentsTitle: A good option, curiously, for case modders.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2016
CommentsContent: Small enough to stash in a laptop bag or conceal in a PC build.  The latter is actually why I bought this hub: to use with a few wireless dongles to add concealed Bluetooth and Logitech Unifying to my gaming PC.  Combined with the NZXT IU01 internal USB hub, this Sabrent hub works well with the aforesaid dongles and works with any OS.  I took a couple of Command strips and stuck it to the front of my case (NZXT H440) behind the vanity shroud and ran the wire inside through a conveniently placed hole to plug it into the IU01 board.  That's it: that's all it takes.  Now I get built-in Bluetooth and Unifying with essentially no signal loss.  I like the individual power buttons -- I can disable the ports I don't need, hopefully reducing overall power draw.Probably far enough off the spec sheets to confuse the guys (and gals) at Sabrent, but I like it. :-)

CommentsTitle: Very nice product. I love the LED indicators and the ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2014
CommentsContent: Very nice product. I love the LED indicators and the push buttons to turn a port on or off. The cord is very short but I just got an extension cord and have no problems with it. This is an excellent purchase for the price I was planning on upgrading to a larger hub later on, but I've had this one for 6 months now and I'm so happy with it I am thinking about just buying another and pocketing the $40 I'll save for not buying a 7 or 10 port hub. $14 for two of these and $50-$60 for a decent quality 7 or 10 port hub. I currently have a keyboard, mouse, webcam, and flash drive plugged in to this and they all function perfectly.Pros:LEDs turn on when a port is on and are off when a port is off. They work perfectly.The ports are spaced far enough that devices shouldn't have problems when plugged in adjacently.Very small and unobtrusive.Cons:Cord is short (you can see this in the picture though... You get what you see).Overall this is a great product and I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again.Note: My WD MyBook external 2TB hard drive won't work using these ports. However, it's a finnicky drive at best and I never know whether a port will read it or not. I haven't tried these with any other external drives.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: My computer only has two usb outlets and I needed to charge my phone, my headphones and my watch, on top of having a mouse. I chose the four outlets port since it was good enough for me and I love it. I like that is small and nice looking, also like the on and off feature that allows you to consume only the right amount of electricity. So far it has been working beyond expected. I do have to mention I have only charge two things at a time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought one for a laptop I use in the basement for my Cricut. I also have some speakers for my computer hooked up to it and it works great. I love that the cord isn't too long, you can turn each individual port on and off and the blue glow is so pretty. Just ordered 2 more, one for my daughter and one for my upstairs pc. Great item for the price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2013
CommentsContent: Very useful for adding more usb's to a laptop. I use one for a mouse and two for an external hard drive. What's really nice about this product is that you can disconnect a device without unplugging it, thus decreasing the stress on your device. Plugging in and unplugging in a device is bound to put some wear on it and this product allows you to avoid this problem. However, I don't like the aesthetics. The product is advertised as having a "Sleek black finish" but it's nothing impressive. It looks like regular plastic that kid's toys are made of. Also, the 2" cable is inflexible, so you can't bend it to whatever you want.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: You HAVE to make sure the buttons are pressed for the occupied USB. Does what I need it to.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a wonderful item to add extra usb ports.  The laptop we needed it for only had one and a wireless mouse/keyboard was in there.  We used this to be able to read thumb drives. Being able to leave them in but turn them on or off is a great feature

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I've been using this product for a bit now, and I am nothing short of happy with my purchase! I use it for my wireless mouse, my printer, my wireless number pad (accounting homework while left handed is a bit uncomfortable without it) and I also sometimes use the fourth port as a charger. This thing can handle all of it, and I'm so impressed. I think everyone should get one and watch their productivity go up :)

CommentsTitle: On/Off buttons are more helpful than I realized!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: After getting a monitor/laptop stand for my sit-stand desk, I found that two of my laptop USB ports were covered by the clips that held the laptop in place. I ordered this USB hub to remedy that problem. It was perfect for that - I have my camera, wireless mouse/keyboard and headset plugged into it, and all work perfectly. What I didn’t realize is how helpful the “on/off” buttons would be! I used to need to plug-in or unplug whenever I wanted to switch between using my headset or using my laptop mic/speakers. Now, all I have to do is push a button to turn the headset on or off! So much better! I used strong 3M adhesive to attach the hub to the bottom of the laptop platform on the monitor/laptop stand. I couldn’t be happier with this little gadget!

CommentsTitle: Amazon's return policy is great and this unit was replaced with one from a ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2018
CommentsContent: Defective when received.  Enabling power to one of the ports would shut down the whole unit.  There was a short which should have been detected.  Amazon's return policy is great and this unit was replaced with one from a different vendor.  Quality control IS important to me.  Nice looking unit had it worked.

CommentsTitle: Perfect to split a USB port
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2018
CommentsContent: I have a couple failing ports on my motherboard, and only two of them were still working. Simply needed to expand one of them to multiple ports for my KB and Mouse.This works perfect. I mounted it on the back of my PC case with velcro. Plan to buy more for other applications.Keep in mind, this unit is not powered so if you need to run devices like Hard Drives or other high power required items, this may not work. You will need a powered hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2020
CommentsContent: With working from home AND doing virtual school for my kiddos, my prior conference call set up wasn't working. I only had one free USB outlet on my laptop and forever switching lines back and forth between a speaker device and/or headset, this device sits right on my docking station and easily allows me to seamlessly flip back and forth between audio options. Seriously a HUGE improvement. Definitely a huge value for the money. The power switches illuminate to easily let you know which line has power. Great product!

CommentsTitle: A must purchase product -- Love it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2017
CommentsContent: OMG, I needed one of these so bad. I'm super glad I purchased it. My computer didn't come with enough USB ports so this comes in extra handy. I love the  lighted buttons that turn each port on & off.  Fast connection too. Whomever thought of this is genius.  I waited a bit before posting my reviews because I like to ensure my honest opinion. I hope others do the sane for me. I would buy another one in a heartbeat.  Sabrent is an excellent manufacture,  in my opinion.  Ty

CommentsTitle: Works Great! Gave me more USB ports
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2019
CommentsContent: My desktop has a limited amount of USB ports.  I kept having a problem with my keyboard, no matter which USB port I was using on my desktop.  I ordered this and I am very happy.  My keyboard is working properly again, and I have three other ports that I can use when needed.  I love that the individual USB ports are lit up while you are using them.  Great product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had two hubs in the past.  Both caused issues with the functionality of the laptop.  Thank you for making a product that works.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2019
CommentsContent: Works for playstation classic with bleemsync to allow you to play two player by plugging both controllers to this hub into port number 1

CommentsTitle: Great USB Hub! Cord length may be an issue for some.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2019
CommentsContent: This little thing is quite handy for my situation. I use it on a laptop that suffered a Humpty-Dumpty-esque fall. The entire right side, where most of the USB slots are, was damaged beyond repair. One USB is more than enough though, because of this 4-port hub. I love the lights as an indicator. They're obvious in both bright light and darkness, but not overwhelming. (Easier than shown in picture to tell what is on) Easy on and off. For some, I think the cord length could be an issue. It is quite short. For me, it's great because of placement. But, if I ever needed longer, I'd be in trouble.

CommentsTitle: Arrived faster than expected and works as anticipated
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2016
CommentsContent: I've only had this device for a few weeks but so far it's great! I use two of the ports daily (and I mean ALL DAY, daily), and a third hub on occasion without any loss of connectivity or performance. I use one hub for a keyboard and the other for a wireless USB mouse - both of which work perfectly using the hub.Also, my all-in-one wifi printer suddenly stopped connecting wirelessly for no apparent reason one day when (after spending too many hours trying to troubleshoot it), I remembered it had a super long USB cable that I've also connected to the hub on occasion and all three of my connected devices worked flawlessly.Lastly, the hub order confirmation had me expecting it would not arrive for a few days after placing the order but it showed up in my mailbox the very next day -- woohoo! I was stoked because I really needed it.I'll update my post if the device stops working or causes trouble... but for now I'm very pleased.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2014
CommentsContent: I bought a couple of these a few weeks ago. The one for my keyboard and mouse I haven't had any issues with. The one I hooked up to two C310 webcams, though, has periodically (3-4 times an hour) has been dropping and causing a rescan of the usb bus (lots of warnings in dmesg about this). I only use them for snapshots at 1m intervals, and the power consumption shouldn't be enough to warrant a powered hub. Furthermore, when I replaced it with an "Amazon basics" 4-part unpowered hub a few days ago, I stopped having any issues. That leaves me uncertain if one of the two is bad, or if the application to which I put it is not ideal, so take what you will of the above. I bought it because it was cheap, not because of the switches, which I don't need.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2021
CommentsContent: I use these for my surface which only has 1 usb port. Very useful for remote teaching! Love the lit up power switches and the 4 ports! Good buy!

CommentsTitle: So nice I bought it twice
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2019
CommentsContent: When I bought this one Amazon told me that I purchased this item before.  Since I can't find it since my move, I bought it again.  To me that is the best proof that it is a useful item.  My computer is several years old and only has one usb port on the front so I recommend using this usb "extension cord".

CommentsTitle: Didn't work as well as it should
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this because my 13" laptop has only one USB port. I plugged it in and was using 2 of the 4 ports, one for my mouse and the other for a external hard drive.  After about an hour my mouse stopped working. I tried different ports but it still didn't work. Plugged it into my laptop directly and it worked fine.  Not sure what the problem is, but disappointed in this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2016
CommentsContent: Product shipped on-time, and works perfectly ...as a simply technique...  to conncet FOUR (yes, 4x) 2-Tera-Byte, Western Digital, 2TB "My Book Desktop External Hard Drives", to a "Dish Network" receiver/descrambler/demodulator - result?  8-Tera-Bytes of external, movie storage (that's space for about 2,000 to 2,500 HDTV events!  Of importance: the Dish Network receiver "box" allows a user to connect only 1x USB-drive at a time.  The trick to use this idea?  Power-"OFF" the receiver box, before selecting any given USB-drive (remember: only one at a time), then Power-"ON" the box again.  It's safe, sure - and it works!  Note:  the external DVR drives used with Dish Network [MUST] have their own power supply - so, I also bought a power-strip for transformers (the transformers are turned 90-degrees, and there's a surge-suppressor), which allows all FOUR (4) external drives to remain powered-up.  This USB hub allows the user to "Select" (connect), just ONE external drive at a time.  Doing so, doesn't damage anything, and the connection methods respects the Dish Network warranty of your receiver box.  ;-)  Enjoy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered this product a long time ago, and it served me well the entire time I Had it.  I can say because of my really dated laptop, I was having a few issues with the USB hub when it was already getting much older.  I recently got a different usb hub that served me equally well.  My main issue with my work space is I am using a really dated laptop so I am trying really hard not to fault USB devices like this.  I know the product did it's job well for as long as it worked, and it lasted me a very long time.  I recommend this product for people who have a much larger work space available to them than what I do.  Having to move it around a lot, etc, likely caused it to get damaged on my end so was not your guy's fault right there.  Either way though, for folks needing extra USB slots these sorts of products work really well just make sure you guys are using more modern laptops and desktops than I am currently am hahah.  Either way guys, keep up the good work here.

CommentsTitle: Solved my problem of not enough USB 2.0 connections
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: My new laptop only has 2 2.0 USB ports and I needed more to work efficiently.  The 4 ports on the hub has worked great to transfer files to thumbdrives and use various devices.  The hub works great and date transfer is fast enough for my needs.  I would buy this product again.  I am not sure if the on/off buttons on the hubs are necessary instead of just unplugging the device from the hub, but I have only used the hub for less than a month.

CommentsTitle: Customer Service was excellent, replaced product doing well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2018
CommentsContent: That about sums it up.  The original product wasn't working well.  The company very quickly responded and sent me another hub.  It has been working fine ever since.  It was super inexpensive, and it is super light-weight which is both a blessing and a curse.  I use it to allow me to plug in mouse, extra monitor, keyboard, and sometimes a separate keyboard or a scanner or a third monitor (which given my software version, doesn't always work - but the hub works).The LED makes it easy to see if the individual ports are on or not.  Good value for the price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I like  how you can turn on and off of each slot individually, it is small and doesn't take up much space from my desk, the black color the blue LED lights for each bottom make this adaptor looks good and high tech, I like it, another good buy on amazon.

CommentsTitle: A Sad Story Made Happy by Andrew at Sabrent Support
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2015
CommentsContent: This hub is a piece of junk.  I connected devices to it that didn't require bus powering and these devices would constantly disconnect from my system.  I can't sustain a successful connection with any of my devices and my computer using this hub.  I wish I had never purchased it.  It is super cheap, and you get what you pay for.  Too cheap for me to bother returning it.  Bummer.[UPDATE Sept 7, 2015]  Andrew from Sabrent contacted me (on his own initiative, I might add - and solely because he saw this Amazon review) and followed up by sending out a replacement unit to me, including an AC adapter (which wasn't even part of my initial purchase).  The replacement USB hub works just fine.  Thanks very much Andrew!  Also, to clarify, attached to the older (failed) unit was in the simplest scenario of just one device - a PNY USB flash thumb drive which draws very little current - and even with just that one device the drive would erratically attach and detach constantly (while it was plugged in) which made it basically impossible to access the thumb drive in any reliable way.  This doesn't happen with the new hub - it maintains the connection (so far).So I have to say that I'm very impressed with Sabrent's proactive support.  It's unusual, and speaks highly of them.  Given this experience, I would purchase future products from Sabrent.

CommentsTitle: It looks way better than the previous hub I had
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2020
CommentsContent: My previous hub, an Insignia unit, stopped working after may be two years of using it to hook regular USB keyboard/mouse to my laptop.Found this Sabrent unit in Amazon, as having a ton of favorable reviews, almost five stars rating, costing less than ten bucks, featuring four ports with individual on/off switches, so it was a no brainer to pick this one.So far, highly satisfied about it. Now, besides hooking my keyboard/mouse, I also use it as the charging station for my phone - of course, my laptop is always plugged into the wall.The cord length  is just what is needed for it to sit comfortably over my laptop left "cheek". A longest cord would defeat the purpose of being also a tool to help diminish cable cluttering, not the opposite.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2017
CommentsContent: Works great, love that I can toggle the power on/off for devices when not in use. Cord is only long enough to dangle away from my Chromebook, so it doesn't get tangled up at all. Haven't used it to charge any devices. I can plug in a bluetooth mouse, full size keyboard, a mini doc cam, and a headphone/microphone headset at the same time, and everything works the way it should with no glitchy lags.

CommentsTitle: USB ports are so close to each other than even thumb drives do not fit next to each other.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2015
CommentsContent: Did they really have to make it so small? I bought it with the only purpose - to be able to connect 4 thumb drives to my TV. The plan was to save my fitness videos by category to 4 separate USB flash drives and switch between them as needed. This would enable me to overcome the limitations ob the built-in player in my TV (it can see only a small number of files on a drive). Guess what? The distance between the 4 connectors is so short that USB sticks do not fit next to each other. One can only plug in 4 USB cables, but not 4 USB drives.  A couple extra millimeters between the ports would've sold this problem. Now, I have to buy short extension cables to be able to achieve my goal. Why not do it right from the very beginning?Otherwise, the price is good and it is good that a hub with switches is available.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Very inconsistently certain hubs won't work. They'll work with one cord, then not work., then will work again. I just had my phone plugged in for an hour and it wasn't charging. Then I put my other phone ON THE SAME CORD attached to the SAME HUB and it charged fine.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2019
CommentsContent: My daughter needed a hub for her school computer, so I got this one for her, as I liked the idea of being able to toggle the individual ports on/off. It was pretty slick, and I experienced a brief sadness resulting from my lack of necessity for a new hub.Well, my day finally arrived about four months later when my hub suddenly and mysteriously died. Now I too can enjoy the power of controlling each hub. This also has the benefit of being more compact than my old hub, so I've got that going for me...which is nice.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2019
CommentsContent: I have an alarm clock with one port on the back that I plug my phone charger into. I thought it would be nice to have a splitter so I can charge my phone and kindle at the same time.  The power output is so low that it doesn't even charge my phone. My phone prompts to plug it in to the original charger. It is plugged into the original cord plugged into the splitter.  The same power cord plugged right into my clock charges my phone in an hour or two.  On the splitter the battery was still dead the next morning. And yes I had the power on to that specific outlet on the splitter

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: My only complaint is I wish the cord were just a few inches longer. I do like that you can turn on and off the individual plugs.

CommentsTitle: I have never been so happy about a product like this hub
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2018
CommentsContent: I have never been so happy about a product like this hub. Absolutely essential and important especially for those people working constantly with multiple active portable devices simultaneously. Works like a charm. It only takes the a single USB port on you computer. Very good product for a very good price. It arrived on time as well. I recommend it very much.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: This thing is exactly what I needed to give me additional ports on my laptop. The swiches to turn each port on/off is great so you don't have to unplug, just push the switch and power goes off! Price was great, delivery fast. Only been using about a week so can't comment on longevity. Would definitely recommend

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2021
CommentsContent: Exactly what I needed, for a really great price. I'm also able to turn on/off my extensions when needed, which helps save a TON of hassle since I'm in and out of meetings all day and need to constantly plug/unplug my headphones.10/10 would buy again, and recommendDo note; when you have a port active, it the square button lights up blue, which is fine for me, but it may annoy some people (like my partner) who don't like random things lighting up

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2017
CommentsContent: Yes I know this review is a year or two late, but I can definitely tell you that this is worth the money. I've had it for quite some time and I have never had any problems with it. Works great for charging multiple phones or controllers at once. I bought this to use, so I could charge a couple of my PS4 Controllers as well as my phone at the same time. Worked great for that. Now I use it at my computer desk to plug my webcam, headset, and my USB Floppy drive into as I'm not someone who likes to have a whole lot of wires showing in the front of my computer. I would definitely recommend it. My only thing is if charging multiple phones I may recommend plugging it into a wall charger base, as phones need a little more power than a controller.

CommentsTitle: I like that it has the on/off switches too
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2014
CommentsContent: This works exactly the way I hoped it would.  The only thing I can say negatively is that I should have bought one that had even MORE ports!  Who knew that within a week of it getting here, I'd decide to add a bunch of USB devices to my computer?  Now I will be buying another one to piggy back on to THIS one!  I like that it has the on/off switches too.  That works great for my headphones because my son can use them for his Rosetta Stone program, and then when I want to use the speakers, all I have to do is tap the switch above the headphones and the regular computer speakers engage.  Much easier than trying to plug and unplug a USB!

CommentsTitle: 0 Hub with Individual Power Switches & LEDs (Black) almost two years ago and it still works great. Others have mentioned in thei
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2016
CommentsContent: I purchased this 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches & LEDs (Black) almost two years ago and it still works great. Others have mentioned in their reviews that they ran into some issues with it disconnecting their external hard drives while in use. Fortunately, I can say that although I have had this happened to me before with this device, it has only happened once or twice in the whole time I've had it. The one or two times it has disconnected or improperly ejected my drive was when I either plugged or unplugged something else into the 4-Port Hub (I believe it was during a transfer, so it seems that the connection was disrupted from the additional source added or being taken away), or when I turned pressed or depressed one of the buttons to cut power to that USB port.Because I cited either of these activities as disrupting the connection to my external drive, I just do not mess with the on/off port buttons or plug/unplug anything during a transfer just as a precaution. (Note: the drive does not disconnect every single time that things are plugged/unplugged or the button for a port is pushed, I can usually use it like normal even when my external is connected. The drive has only disconnected due to this activity those very few times mentioned).I like the ability to "turn off" the connection to specific ports by using the buttons so certain drives though ejected are "unplugged."I have a MacBook Pro so having additional USB ports was a must with only two available on my computer. I would definitely recommend this product to a friend. The price is extremely good too considering the use I've gotten out of it thus far.

CommentsTitle: Does the job that I needed it for.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2018
CommentsContent: Quality and operation is first class.  I got what I expected... no surprises.I went to the manufacturers web site looking for the power supply for it so that I can plug in devices that draw more current and found nothing.The unit has a socket but there is no data on it.  I assume it is 5 volts but it would be nice if there was a part that I could buy to add to it.Otherwise, it works fine and I'm pleased. I would recommend it to others.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2013
CommentsContent: Originally I thought that this was a gimmick hub; however it turned out to be very useful. I purchased this to use in my car in order to power a Bluetooth receiver for streamed Internet audio. However I also wanted a second port to recharge my Samsung S4 smartphone. And this hub just turned up at the bargain end of the price spectrum.So I tossed it in the center console, thinking "done". As it turned out running the Bluetooth receiver made my phone fail to work with the car's integrated Bluetooth for incoming calls. So now it's as easy as reaching inside the console to power down the receiver with a button if I expect a call while I'm driving. And of course I can power it back up when I want to listen to Internet radio. Result is less wear and tear on USB connections, and it is also a lot faster to push a button than to unplug cables.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this for my xbox bc i have 2 external hard drive and needed a second alot for when the wife wants to play with me. Ot gets the job down and looks good when doing it.

CommentsTitle: Works well, not for Apple producrs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: We use these to charge all our non-Apple products like cameras, charging batteries and other electronics. Does not charge Apple products like watches, phones and iPads. The cord is a little short to sit on some of our counters, but otherwise it works great!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a well-designed and practical way to add USB ports to a notebook. The product is packaged nicely and sealed. Just understand that it is for docking - NOT for charging. Basically, it's like an extension cord. That's it. There is another, more expensive model that docks AND charges. So, don't be hasty when ordering. If you just want to add USB ports to your notebook or laptop, you can't beat this unit for functionality or price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2018
CommentsContent: Gaming laptops do not have enough usb ports for gaming. I bought this for the extra ports and it works but some minor things were a bit discouraging. The lights that show which port is powered on light up the adjacent lights a bit so it could be difficult to know which ones were on. The headset I used in these would sometimes become static laden and if I plugged in direct to an on board usb would be fine. And checking device manager the headset got to Logitech headset #11 a week or two after first use with no change on my end. I know, really minor issues but I thought these might be good to know before purchase. I am sure there are other ones of these without these issues though I know not which.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I am a musician and use many different instruments and devices to record my music. All of my midi controllers, keyboards and interfaces between my mics and guitars that all link into my computer use a standard USB connection.  This device saves me time, keeps me organized and saves me a big hassle from having to swap USB cables between all of my instruments.

CommentsTitle: Works for accessories but not for external hard drives
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2016
CommentsContent: Works fine for connecting mobile device for power and sync.Does not work when I connected either of my 2 portable hard drives or my desktop external drive. I thought maybe it needed power and plugged in a power adapter I had (it does not come with one) and it still did not work which was a big disappointment. When I connected my drives they weren't recognized by my computer as being connected at all. Some reviews misled me to believe it would work.If you just want to connect some accessories but not external hard drives, then I suppose this will work for you.

CommentsTitle: Does not work - NO POWER CABLE INCLUDED
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2020
