CommentsContent: Be aware that this will not work without the power cable that is not included.  I am sending mine back because after plugging it in there was no connection to anything I plugged into to it and then the laptop.  There clearly needs to be a power cable that doesn't come with it.

CommentsTitle: Wasn’t able to use it as a power source.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2020
CommentsContent: This USB hub is OK. I bought it because I liked that I could tell which devices were connected.  The main reason I bought this was to connect my fire stick to my TV. I wanted to use the USB part to power my fire stick without having to plug it into the wall.  I also wanted to use the Other ports to connect my other devices to my TV. Unfortunately when I plugged in my fire stick into the hub and then hub into my TV, I got an error message saying my fire stick did not have enough power. I was very disappointed. I guess I’m going to have to use my hub for other things around my house.

CommentsTitle: Push-Button USB a MUST to avoid USB crashes
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2013
CommentsContent: Someone commented on a switch being improper disconnect, but proper Plug nPlay devices wont get improper plug warnings. If you unplug and the drive wasnt ready, youre safer to plug the same item back in; the danger is to plug a different directory into that same port, and then from RAM it writes the former directory onto the new different drive. Computers have only so much memory for directories, and once they max, they will drop a drive from your hub to load the next drive up of your hub. I learned this with a ten port USB hub. This maxing the directory memory of your computer will crash one directory to load up the next directory. And in my case twice i lost a WD Passport Tera drive permanantly because of too much directory Gigs. (Yes, i did swap a drive, and it tried to claim the new drive was the former one plugged in.) So the push-button off is a must for safely having four Tera drives connected. The off-on buttons is a must for USB hubs. WAIT until you hear the computer beep of USB connect or USB drop. I wont buy a USB hub anymore without switches. They were formerly expensive and i was being tight and cheap. I wont buy a switchless ten hub anymore, anybody want mine for free?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2015
CommentsContent: I really like this switch.  It has an input for a power adapter, which I supplied. (There seems to be some confusion about this is the Q&A answers.)  It allows me to power or unpower individual devices (e.g., my Arduino processors, backup disk drives) as desired, without plugging/unplugging USB cables.  I can also charge my phone or GPS, or whatever with it.The paragraph above is actually from my review of the USB2.0 version of this hub.  I liked it so well I ordered the 3.0 version (with power supply) for my new machine with USB 3.0 ports.  I now have it plugged into my Dynadoc U3.0 docking station so I can leave a couple of HDDs and a flash drive plugged in and take them on- or off-line using the appropriate switch if  I don't forget to eject them first :-)I initially had two problems: 1. I didn't plug the power supply into my power strip - the hub will drive flash drives, but won't supply enough power to handle a disk drive.  It easily handled two HDDs when I plugged in the power supply.  Duh.2. At one point, I ejected all (3) devices on the hub (a flash drive and 2 HDDs), turned off the corresponding switches, then tried to bring one of the devices back on line by turning on it's switch.  The computer didn't recognize the presence of the device.  I managed to clear this condition by unplugging the huib from the docking station, and reinserting it.  After this, each device would come up, and I could eject them all (and power them down), and could bring them online again by pushing the appropriate switch.  I haven't seen the problem since.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2013
CommentsContent: I haven't had any problems with pushing the buttons and having hard drives pop off the computer. Of course, I'm only pressing the buttons to  connect the drives. I unmount them first before pressing a switch to disconnect them. As a precaution, however, I don't ever touch any buttons if I'm doing something that is using a hard drive. Just good practice.With that said, this -- and similar -- FOUR port units are the largest I have ever gotten to work consistently at 2.0 speeds. I've tried 7 ports and 10 ports and nada. It seems like FOUR is the magical limit, especially for hooking up hard drives. You won't go wrong with this and you probably will with the larger ones. If you need more ports you might get by with two of these and plugging one of them into one of the vacant ports of the other giving you a total of SEVEN ports with one hookup tot the computer, but I haven't tried this. A better plan would be to get EIGHT ports by hooking each box to a separate USB port on your computer.The switches have a nice blue glow around them when active and pressing them drops the button height a tiny amount as well when in the "ON" position. The glowing light is really needed if it's dark to tell what's on and what's not. I like mine so far.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2018
CommentsContent: I use this to control my USB fans at work and home. This way, the USB hub wears out first before the fans, which has never happened. I sometimes push some of the buttons multiple times a day, and the older one is still going strong after a few years. No issues here. Would purchase again with no hesitation. I can not attest to the speed of the USB, but the power works.

CommentsTitle: Review: Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UMLS)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2017
CommentsContent: Very nice hub.  I use it with an OTG adapter for a cell phone.  It allows me to switch on and off power to each individual port which comes in hand in getting Andriod OS to recognize hot plugged flash drives. It is very lightweight but yet sturdy enough to suit my needs.  I really like it's linear layout with all the ports on the same side.  I have not used it with an external power brick, so I can not comment on that.  Based on this unit, I will be buying more and also trying the USB3 model as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Works good on my HP laptop with Windows installed. Had to get this because of a crash on my computer while installing updates, I not only lost all my information but also 2 usb ports..anyway after installing Windows AGAIN and putting this device in my remaining usb port I now have a functional laptop as good as before the problem..

CommentsTitle: I chose this one in particular because it was cheap and had good reviews. Unfortunately it works horribly for charging
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2017
CommentsContent: I bought this item solely to charge more then one phone off the same outlet.  I chose this one in particular because it was cheap and had good reviews.  Unfortunately it works horribly for charging.  Don't get me wrong, it DOES charge.  But 30 minutes to get a 9%charge is unacceptable.  When I plugged the same cord directly into the wall box I got 9% in about 7 minutes.  And that was with only 1 phone plugged in.  I would guess that plugging in more things would slow it down even more but I'm not sure.  I'm going to end up just putting this in one of our travel bags to use in hotels where we have limited outlets because it is far too slow to use on a regular basis.

CommentsTitle: Works fine. Adds three USB ports to your computer.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2016
CommentsContent: For some reason all the USB ports on the front of my computer have stopped working, so I needed to add more to the back. This adapter plugs into one port and gives your 4 ports, for a net gain of 3 USB ports. Good to have.It works, but it feels kind of flimsy. Also, somehow the computer detects that a device has been added when the cable touches the port on the hub, even if the port is turned off. The device doesn't connect to the computer unless the port is turned on, so that is good, but the computer makes a lot of annoying bing-bong and bong-bing noises as I try to get the device attaced.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2020
CommentsContent: The idea of the ON/OFF switching is great, but it doesn't always turn on/allow reading of the flash drive. I find myself having to restart my PC to get it to read more often than not...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2013
CommentsContent: Quick pros and consPros1. It works for simple things like keyboard, mouse, microphone (if you have a usb mic like i do), etc. This is why I bought it, so consolidate all my input devices.2. It's deceptively small. Fits easily in the palm of my hand.3. The switches do work even if they feel a little cheap. Nice to have that option.4. It's really cheap.Cons1. The cable to connect it to the computer is pretty short. Wish it were longer.2. It's cheap and thus feels cheap. I don't fear for its safety or anything but I imagine I'll have to replace this sooner than any of the things I have plugged into it.All in all, it's cheap and it works. Obviously since it's not AC-powered you probably won't be able to use this with power-intensive things. It worked for my non-AC powered external hard drive and my usb-powered speakers so I guess it can output at least that much juice. It's less than $10 so it's not really a big deal.

CommentsTitle: Great for working at home when you need multiple devices charged
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: It would have been nice to have more instructions (I'm a techie and found it a little confusing) but overall a good product for the money if you just need one or two extra ports. i found the cord to be a little long but my desk isn't huge. I recommend it.

CommentsTitle: Size matters..... But so does price and quality. Great news is this has both.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2016
CommentsContent: We have all been there, standing in the aisles of the place where you are supposed to find the best of buys, staring at the glorious peg hooks filled with USB hubs ranging from $15 and all all the up to $100 plus. I was literally there when I decided to pull out my phone and check Amazon for the same thing I was looking at (not exact same brand but same device) and found this little gem. The first thing you should notice is the size of the chord that connects the hub to the usb on your pc or laptop. Notice it looks nice and long. I didn't get out a tape measure but my guess is at least a foot long. The one is the other mentioned store for twice the price was about 2 inches maybe. Doesn't sound like an issue until you go to plug 4 chords into it. The nice long chord on this one gives you plenty of room to set it on something rather that just leave it hang from your desktop or crowd your lap top so much you cant move it. It is fast as well, takes about 7 seconds for windows to recognize the device once you hit the power button. Which by the way is a really nice feature. A file gets locked and you need to disconnect and reconnect quickly it is literally a push of a button. All and all this is a great little usb hub and I am very happy with my purchase.

CommentsTitle: Nice way to add (noncharging) USB ports to device ..
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2020
CommentsContent: If you are looking to connet/sync multiple devices to a laptop, desktop or other device with limited USB ports, this will allow you to do.  I like the switches that allow you to turn on/off each port.  If you are looking for something that will also allow simultaneous charging, you need to look for something else.  In fact this will accelerate batter drain on cell phones and other battery operated devices.

CommentsTitle: Everything It Claims? Yes. Everything I neededs? No.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2015
CommentsContent: This hub does everything it says it will do.Never the less, I wish I had spent more.  I'd like a hub with about 8 ports, with an external power supply so I can plug in my Fire HD7 for file transfers without getting an error message saying that charging will be slow, or perhaps not happen at all.The switches allow one to turn off individual ports.  They definitely work.  In fact, they work too well.  I sometimes bump the buttons are turn off my keyboard or my mouse, or whatever, and it takes me an annoying long time to figure out what's wrong.  You may be smarter than I am.  There are lights, but my hub is in a place that's hard to see and hard to reach.

CommentsTitle: They can be Depressed really easily and turn off the device in the port
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2014
CommentsContent: Windows 7 found this adapter really quickly and I have all 4 ports used by various USB adapters. NO ISSUES AT ALL.....my ONLY grip (why I gave 4 stars) is the on/off buttons for each port on the top of the adapter. They can be Depressed really easily and turn off the device in the port. I may just put a piece of electrical tape across the buttons to keep them ON all the time. I also put a piece of Velcro on the bottom and have it attached the lid of my laptop. Looks geeky but keeps it in place. Worth the cost. I have 3 adapter slots on my machine and now with this hub I have 7 ports total (2 open on my machine now for iPHone charger and whatever else.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2016
CommentsContent: 05/11/16 Works great and is very inexpensive - would buy again  -- 2nd Review - - 9/28/16 I have used the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub for over four months now, and still give it a 5-star review -- it has worked great, was certainly very inexpensive and has given me more USB ports than I have ever had (most laptops today have fewer USB ports)  - when with all the new products we need more NOT LESS USB ports for our computers.  I certainly urge computer/laptop users to consider buying a Sabrent4-Port USB 2.0 Hub -- you will not be sorry.T. R. Hagin  Ocala, FL 09/28/16

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2015
CommentsContent: Not only does this USB hub come with a small extension to leave you with more room to work, but you can control which USB ports are active with individual buttons.  As this is not a powered USB port (it does not need to be plugged into a wall outlet) make sure you don't try to use devices that will draw a ton of power or it will not get enough power from the single USB socket for all of them.  This is a limitation of using an unpowered USB hub and not of this one in particular.  I would gladly trade that for the convenience of not having to plug it in though.  Any of my high-power devices can use one of the other free USB ports of my machines.  Works fine with 4 USB controllers simultaneously.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I am setting up an art desk in a newly refurbished room. I bought the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual LED lit Power Switches (HB-UMLS) because I thought that it would be inobtrusive. It works perfectly. Sits behind the new desk lamp with a USB slot.

CommentsTitle: This product works just fine and I've had not problems with it after and ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2016
CommentsContent: This product works just fine and I've had not problems with it after and extended period of time.  One thing to be aware of, is that if you push a button to make the connection live, you have to push it again to kill the connection.  I thought that when you pushed another button the live button would pop up and no longer be live.  It was important to my application to have full juice at the live connection, but if you don't give the button a second push it stays active and you end up sharing the current with more that one port.The above is a minor inconvenience for what is otherwise a fine product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2019
CommentsContent: I work from my home office and have several items tethered to my laptop. I needed a device that would accept all USB devices and this item would not accept any of my mice usbs. I thought this would accept all standard USB items but it iod not and I returned it immediately.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: The first one sent to me had one dead port (bent pins), but the other three ports worked perfectly. Returned and got another one with all ports functional. I use it for the small usb sticks from 2.4g wireless peripherals (jelly comb mouse, keyboard, and number pad) with no issues. I've heard that these usb sticks don't work well with usb 3.0 so I went with this 2.0 hub.The fit is quite snug, so I would suggest using it for things not removed often (like I am). The power buttons do what they're supposed to. The blue light on one button in the on position does bleed over to the adjacent buttons, but I don't mind it much.

CommentsTitle: Already failing after a couple of months
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2013
CommentsContent: Some of the ports have already started to fail, and I've only had it a couple of months. If I plug something in, the computer will make the "duh DAH" plug-in sound over and over -- it reads the new peripheral as plugging in and then unplugging, over and over.  If I unplug the external keyboard and then plug it into the regular computer port, it works fine.  Sometimes other ports on the hub will work when one doesn't.  Every day it's a new guessing game, and not why I purchased it.The return period has passed, so I'm stuck with it.  Will purchase my electronics only from local sellers from now on.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2016
CommentsContent: UPDATE:  I was contacted by Sabrent after they saw my initial review. They offered me a replacement and it arrived within a few days. I have been using it for several weeks now without any problems. The original turned out to be defective. I guess that can happen. I like the small design and the on/off switch for each port. Great personal customer service! A+It worked for ten minutes then stopped. I received Windows error messages, one that the "device is reporting problems and Windows will shut down this device". I was using it to read 16g flash drives. After numerous hours spent troubleshooting I returned it to Amazon.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This USB hub is sweet. The buttons are a huge plus. It allows you to save power on unused sockets and push more juice into the ones that are being used. Also if you have th in NHS that stay plugged in, it's a good way to switch them on and off. I have one on the back of my Fire TV to expand the single USB socket into 4 which allows me to expand the memory, use a more advanced remote control, webcam and speaker system. It can be used for so many things since so many things are now USB powered.

CommentsTitle: Changed my review - unstable and stopped working after a month or so
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2015
CommentsContent: I originally gave this product a great review, because for the first month or so I owned it it was fine. Lately though, it's started disrupting the connection with the devices I have plugged into it. I went to a forum to troubleshoot and someone suggested that I tape it to the table so it wouldn't wiggle around so much. I thought that it was a bit ridiculous to have to do that but fine, I needed to be able to use my devices so I went ahead and did that. STILL breaks connection after 2 minutes or less. The shaking from typing on my laptop causes the connection to break. I have stopped using it altogether because I have a hard disc with a lot of data and a few other things plugged into it, and don't want my data to get corrupted....It my seem fine at first, but DO NOT get this product, it's a dud.

CommentsTitle: You get what you pay for, but it is fully functional.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2014
CommentsContent: I've only had it for a couple days, so I don't have time with it to say to much about it. But I used it to plug in a wireless mouse, an external hard drive, and a Wi-Fi antenna, and had no problems.  Individual on-off switches are definitely a nice feature, and they are lit up to let you know which one is active. As far as the complaints with power drops, when adding another device, I don't doubt that is happening, because it's using whatever power source such as your USB port from your computer. I haven't had a problem yet.  It doesn't have an external source for power. Most of the big dollar USB hubs, have an external power cord. If you are going to run multiple external hard drives, then you should get one of those instead.Also some of the complaints about the size being small, and the short cord, I'm using this for a laptop, and my iPad. I think that is what is designed for. I think it is designed to be small, easily portable, and low-power consumption.  I say using common sense, if you need something with more power, then get something else, but otherwise this will just do fine. Especially for small portable jobs.

CommentsTitle: Nice 4 port hub - a quality product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2018
CommentsContent: Quality product with a nice look and 'feel' throughout.  The packaging demonstrates this company's respect for the product and it is nicely presented.This is a simple plug and play port hub and the on/off switches are a nice addition and work smoothly.  It's a simple product and though I did not perform any tests other than plugging it in and verifying that it works... I'm impressed.

CommentsTitle: Amazon showed this one as being the most recommended --- its not a powered USB hub
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2016
CommentsContent: The USB hub works with out any troubles, my issues is that I searched for a Powered USB hub , Amazon showed this one as being the most recommended --- its not a powered USB hub, it is passive. The switches themselves have lights on them hence the "Powered switches"  -- I have to take some responsibility here for not readying the title correctly. I'll keep this one and use it but will ensure I triple check the next USB hub I order to ensure it has a power supply and cable included :-)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent: This is my second usb hub and I love it. I am able to charge devices and use my mouse and keyboard. I use this usb hub with my Lenovo Chromebook and Microsoft Surface Pro 4

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2015
CommentsContent: It works intermittently. When I plug it up securely so that no connections move, it still connects and disconnects intermittently. Not terrible but it has gotten to the point of 2 offs within a minute.  I would buy a better one for products that remain connected to your devices.  This one is good for casual use devices more so than like an external harddrive.  Possible that I received one with a loose solder connection internally.  This is common with cheaper alternative products and not necessarily the product in general but a small batch from the manufacturer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I like that is has 4 ports, and the ability's to turn each of one the ports on or off without unplugging anything. There are blue lights that let me know which one of the ports is on or not.  Also the cord is long enough to hide it behind my computer. My other one had such a short cord it was awkward, didn't set level and in the way of my mouse. This comes in two lengths but this ones perfect for my computer and desk.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2020
CommentsContent: It charges very, very slowly. I am not pleased at all. I only gave it 2 stars because it does charge it after all, and if you have nothing else, this will work, otherwise, it's a waste of money.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2019
CommentsContent: This USB hub is exactly what I needed. The four USB ports fit my devices snugly. And I love the lit switches, so I can easily connect to only the individual devices and thumb drives I am using at the time, and know which are active at a glance. A great product and a nice design.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2019
CommentsContent: My second one I've purchased. Ordered one for my PS4 a while back and it's been working great so when I needed one for my computer I knew where to go. I mounted mine with a piece of 3m double sided tape. Mounting holes would be a nice option but the 3m tape works great. Definitely a must buy for USB expansion.

CommentsTitle: Good off the bat, a bit sketchy though
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2014
CommentsContent: Pros:- Everything is functional.- The ports are tight, no USB will wiggle off or fall out in any way.- Small, lightweight, aesthetically pleasing.Cons:- The button's are a bit sketchy, I feel like they will jam eventually. Hopefully it's not an issue.- The LED's are not uniform, it lights the USB port side very well, and the back of it doesn't lights almost at all.- The cable could be longer, it limits the places you can set it up unless you buy a male-female USB cable.I will update this review if I run into any inconveniences.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2016
CommentsContent: Great product. I needed a USB 2.0 hub, but apparently, USB 3.0 hubs are much more common now, because they're more "advanced" and popular. I realize that 3.0 is faster, but every product had a disclaimer that said that it wasn't compatible with a 2.4 GHz wireless mouse (or keyboard), which was exactly why I needed a USB hub. Anyways, enter Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub. Super easy to use; no setup required. I just keep this plugged in to my desktop computer. The size is perfect - doesn't take up any room on my desk. My mouse's nano-receiver is always plugged into this, and I frequently use another port for thumb drives. Everything is working great so far.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2020
CommentsContent: This hub was not expensive and allows me to control the hookups to my laptop. I just have been using it for a couple of days so I can't testify to it's longevity but it  seems well built and sturdy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2015
CommentsContent: it works, but if there are multiple signals going through it, you can notice a performance issue. I have a feeling this is because it is only usb 2.0. if the devices aren't simultaneously transferring data at the same time, it's not too big of an issue. The issue I had was that when I would use it to program one device while an oscilloscope was running, it would kick me out of my oscilloscope and I would have to restart the program. If your using it with sensitive devices I would look for something that was USB 3.0 compliant. If you just using it to charge a phone and run an external mouse, it will probably be fine.

CommentsTitle: I have absolutely no reservations in wholeheartedly recommending this product!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2016
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
  I am a huge fan of the USB Hub. It works exactly as advertised, the price is exceptional, and the LSD function that tells you which ports are currently open is a God-send. I have had it for about one month, used it extensively, and been extremely impressed (especially at the low price -- the value you are getting is a significant one). Highly recommended, without any reservations!

  
Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UMLS)

CommentsTitle: Use it for multiple controllers on Nintendo Switch, works great
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered a bunch of these for my Steam Link, Nintendo Switch, and my PC. I can run multiple controllers just fine off these. However, it all does run off 1 USB PORT, REMEMBER that. I couldn't run my Keyboard AND Mouse because my Keyboard takes a lot of power, it has 2 separate cords for it. Once I turned off the RGB lights it worked, but just keep in mind you're still plugging everything into ONE USB port. If it draws too much power, that isn't this product's fault.Other than that, they all still work great.

CommentsTitle: Makes you life easier and allows you to control when you want your computer to recognize your usb plug ins.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2016
CommentsContent: I was looking for a way I could place all of my usb and thumb drives but not have them activated all the time since the computer was picking up on them when they got plugged in.  This gadget is nifty since I can plug in all my usb type items but not have them automatically connected to the computer.  I have an apple computer so the keyboard has a usb port that I can plug items into.  If I did not have this item, I would only be able plug in things one at a time.  My computer has additional ports but some of the ports are already taken up by my backup hard drive, mouse and keyboard, so again I only have one port that I would have to remove when I want to plug something else in.  I would highly recommend this to anyone, especially if you have multiple components and usb plug ins.  It will make your life that much easier to have everything in one location and allows you to choose which ones you want the computer to recognize and whichever time.

CommentsTitle: Small, lightweight, portable for my laptop
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2016
CommentsContent: Love it.  Small, lightweight, portable for my laptop used for recording music.  My laptop has limited USB ports and I'm already using a Rosewill  USB 2.0 quad hub but it didn't provide individual on/off buttons. I'm running a usb mouse, usb external DVD writer and a usb midi keyboard. The only remaining port on my laptop provided bus power, for charging devices, even when the laptop was turned off.  I want the bus powered peripherals to shut down when laptop shuts down. Chained the Rosewill hub into port 1 so I only need to click one button to turn off the peripherals.  My usb mouse adapter was in the original hub so i moved that over to one of the open Sabrent ports so i can operate the laptop when not using laptop for recording/mixing.  so far so good.  My only disappointment is with myself for not purchasing the USB 3.0 hub version since my port is 3.0.  Although my current peripherals are USB 1.1 or 2.0,  the upgraded model would have provided more flexibility.  current model holding it's own and no complaints with the product itself.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2017
CommentsContent: When the world has moved on to USB 3 and USB-C ... why buy a USB 2.0 hub? For starters, USB 3 hubs and wireless mice & keyboards don't play well together. For another, each of the USB inputs has a dedicated switch. This hub connects my Logitech G613 and G603 nano receivers, as well as allowing me to switch my Logitech webcam on and off (without needing a webcam cover). With a USB3 hub and the USB2 receivers, I had glitches and momentary drop outs - especially when I connected any USB3 device. With this - no glitches so far ...Pros: works without any fuss, and works well with my Logitech gaming receivers as well as webcam.Cons: Don't like the blue light, should have been soft white and dimmer.

CommentsTitle: Got this to allow quick movement from sit-down desk to treadmill desk
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2014
CommentsContent: My wife and I both have offices with sit-down desks and stand-up treadmill desks, and we move between them regularly throughout the day. Moving was a pain, even with laptops, because we had to disconnect/reconnect so much gear.To remove the obstacles from using our stand-up desks, I duplicated our primary peripherals (monitor, mouse, keyboard, speakerphone, camera) at both locations, with the USB devices being plugged into a hub at each location. I then ran a single USB cable to each location, and plugged those two cables into this switch.Now, if I move to my treadmill desk I simply turn off the port that connects to the hub at my sit down desk, and turn on the port that connects to the hub on my stand-up desk. It takes about 30 seconds for all the devices to be re-recognized when I do this.All my applications (Lync, Webex, Windows, etc) automatically switch to the 'new' devices without any manual intervention, at least they do after the initial setups (one setup for each USB hub when it is first activated).Separately, I use a VGA splitter to push video to both monitors simultaneously.Now I have no excuse for not switching to my treadmill desk, other than entropy. Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This external USB port works great!  It's lightweight and has 4 ports.  They have individual on/off switches for use.  The only thing I would have liked it to have is a longer cord.  The cord is very short.....maybe 2".....and can't lay down.  It hangs from my laptop.  Overall though, that's minor and everything else about this product is great!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Easy to use. Voila!Helped me prove Maritime Admiralty Law and the U-Verse of: KNOW_This port helped me close a massive energy hole that proved my work and that Eye Am not Satoshi Nakamoto, but The Destroyer of the False Realm.Amazing what can be done with a $7.99 device that is humbly and gently accessed via the Amazon of my neural network and the incredible people who proved WITH me what Crystalline Baby Halo technology is and why dark matter particle resistance was a massive success to all who played FORTNITE with me while I was assembling a sophistocated port-authority protocol to enhance security for the lives of children.My Mom and I love these ports! And we're grateful to YOUR good company for posting my crazy review of what iQ is...some of the people whose products I have been raving about for this same purpose decided to not accept the reviews.Ported, Gated, Locked.

CommentsTitle: Great for travel when you need to connect multiple devices
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm a trainer and travel with several USB devices that I use during my training, including a barcode scanner, external number keypad, and others.  My laptop only has a couple of ports.  I bought this to use when I travel, and it worked beautifully.  All the devices I use connected without issue.  It's small enough to easily fit just about anywhere.  I like that I can turn on the ports individually too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2015
CommentsContent: This hub feels cheap and the cord is only 10" long which leaves it hanging since I work with my laptop on a stand. It doesn't fall out so I don't mind that as much. One of the ports is difficult to plug into and those blue lights are distractingly bright (then again I am very sensitive to lights in my face). So I unplug it often or else I'm completely distracted by it like a squirrel in the headlights.It's black, has 4 ports and each port has its own on/off button. It's not very pretty, but it's handy, inexpensive, and it works.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this because I work at home. My laptop only house 2 usb ports. Saw this had good reviews. I need all kinds of devices hooked to my laptop. This works wonders. The buttons are the on/off. Indicator lights around button let you know that port is on. No issues at all using this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2017
CommentsContent: This device lasted 3 months, 14 days (or barely over 100). The "A to Z Guarantee" expired Nov. 8--the hub stopped working around Nov. 23 (Thanksgiving). A hub should last longer than that!!I have contacted the seller (TechSafe) twice for either an exchange or a refund of $5.99--NO RESPONSE. I have contacted Amazon for help in this.I'm willing to chalk this up to a defective unit if TechSafe can exchange the broken unit with one that DOES work. I'm waiting, TechSafe....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: Works just as I would expect.  Best features are that it has 4 ports so I can use multiple thumb drives and the fact that I can also use my computer power cord simultaneously. Win, Win!

CommentsTitle: Great little device, works great on Mac Mini El Capitan OSX (soon to be macOS)
CommentsAuthor: Eric Beaty, Author of the SMART FOCUS series
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2014
CommentsContent: With a Mac Mini you're limited to only 4 USB ports, so I needed a hub for expandability.  This one works great.  Only reason for 4 stars is it's super lightweight, so it slides around a bit under the load of the extra cords. Going to have to try the mounting tape another reviewer suggested. (I hadn't even thought of that.)I find that the Mac Mini does tell me from time to time that one of the devices plugged in (mainly using it for external hard drives & backup) that it has not ejected properly, but it's no big deal, especially when they recommend you plug in external devices like hard drives directly into the USB ports on the Mac Mini.  Definitely recommend.Update: I've had this little gem for nearly 3 years now, and it's still going strong! The only problem is I need to order another one for all the extra gadgets I keep getting! Would love to see a stackable version.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This switcher works perfectly and not only provides additional inputs but minimizes the drain on the computer's resources by letting you select what you need to have active.  Highly recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Received this product quickly, and put it to work instantly to back up some files and get them off my desktop. Worked well and just as I had hoped. A terrific addition to my setup. Previously, I had to remove my mouse cord in order to use a flash drive, and then I couldn't manage the touch control well. Now, I can just put in a flash drive and let it copy files, using my mouse to guide it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I love this adapter to my computer,  I have several things that I plug into my computer and it has a lack of usb ports.  This little device make it great to add a printer, extra storage unit, and adding my silhouette cutter  to my computer...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I have an iMac 27 which has USB ports behind the screen...a pain to use.  Now with the Sabrent 4-port hub, I do not have to reach behind the monitor.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: My Razer headset got a ton of static using this thing. But for my Bluetooth mouse and ps4 controller hookup, it works fine. To be clear, I purchased a USB 2.0 hub.This reviewing process is leaning towards reviewing a camera. So maybe this seller is semi fradulent, FYI

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2017
CommentsContent: I absolutely LOVE this hub!!  It expands my two ports to an extra four!!  The only thing I would suggest would be to make the cord longer.  I would love to be able to put the hub on top of my desk but the cord is pretty short, it only reaches to sit on top of the main computer "box".  I also really like that each hub has its own on off button!  That's really comveniant!  I can leave several things plugged in but turn on only the one I'm using!!  Shipping was super fast, price was great.  I would recommend this to others and would buy again!

CommentsTitle: I’m going to give 5 stars because the product works great just can’t get it to work how I need ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2018
CommentsContent: The product works if it’s plugged into a computer. I tried plugging it in too four different wall plugs and it won’t work. Computer USB is only 2.0 and would assume direct wall plug should be equivalent if not stronger to supposed it. The wall plug I tried was 2.3 and still wouldn’t work. Any suggestions. I needed this for my kids tablets and phone and wanted it plugged in behind couch and have the hub on table next to couch. I’m going to give 5 stars because the product works great just can’t get it to work how I need it too which could be error on my side. Lol.

CommentsTitle: To turn off that stuff that keeps on glowing
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2019
CommentsContent: I didn't really buy this to charge stuff. I bought it so I could manage devices that stay on after you turn off the computer. And for that, it is excellent. The buttons feel great and they only glow when they are on. This tells you exactly what is receiving power and what isn't. My only complaint is that the cable is a little too short by like a foot. But I guess that really depends on where the usb ports are at on your particular device...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2017
CommentsContent: Definitely a good investment.  I ordered some computer speakers that are USB powered for my HP All-In-One computer.  Now we all know with these All-In-One computers you only get but so many USB outlets so I took a chance and ordered this and this gives me just enough outlets that I need for all my other USB powered devices or external hard drives.  I am satisfied.  Let's see if it can stand the test of time.  But for the price point you cant beat it!

CommentsTitle: Very good quality with on/off switch for every usb port
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 11, 2020
CommentsContent: My laptop only had a couple of USB ports and adding this device helped convert one USB to 4. I love this product so much that I bought a second one for my home pc. The best part is that every port has an on/off switch. It helps because someone I use my headset and camera for meetings.  When I want to use my laptop speaker I just turn off that port instead of unplugging the headset.  Same with Camera. I turn off the camera when I am not using it and turn on the camera usb port when I need it. I used to convert the camera but now can just use this instead.  The quality of product looks good.  Comes in very nice packaging.  Cord is very short around 10 inches long.

CommentsTitle: Died after 16 months of normal use and the Sabrent company refuses to make it right!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2021
CommentsContent: It died without any notice after 16 months of normal use.All the ports are dead -- the LEDs still light up when I turn on the button, but it won't communicate the device to the PC.  I tried all kinds of troubleshooting steps and nothing works.  Even tested it on a different PC that never seen it before, and the same issue.I contacted the company Sabrent via their support system (email), but they are not willing to make it right.  I guess they know that they are selling junk and as long as it's over the limited warranty date, they will simply not help you out.They could easily make it right, but sending me a replacement, so I can continue with the goal of why I purchased this device in the first place, but they rather just ignore that -- I guess they don't want to grow their repeat customer base.Now I gotta buy something else to replace it, since I now have only a useless paperweight on my desk.So if I were you, I'd get something else, the device will fail to work and the company will refuse to stand behind their product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2019
CommentsContent: All of the products that I plug into this say that they are slow charging, meaning you cannot use them while they're charging because they'll die as though they weren't charging at all. The cord length is extremely short which means you've gotta have long cords for your electronics. Disappointment.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this hub to be able to charge multiple devices (including my iPhones - the household has multiple ones) from one charger port.  It does NOT work with iPhones to charge them.  I tried different iPhones on different ports with different working chargers and it does NOT charge any of them from any port.  I even tried charging just ONE iPhone and it would NOT charge it at all.  As soon as I plugged the iPhones directly into the charging source (in other words not going through the hub) the iPhones would charge.  I am disappointed in this but will keep the hub because I can use it to charge my micro-USB devices.  Just giving everyone a warning in case you were looking to charge an iPhone through the hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2014
CommentsContent: Finally, I have the extra USB ports I need for my laptop.  At work I've got two zebra printers, Logitech wireless keyboard, Anker wireless mouse, extra monitor, and a flash drive hooked up to my laptop at all times.  It was a nightmare trying to prioritize what to hook up and when.  No more.I have had read other reviews on here mentioning this device can be sensitive to touch and lose connectivity at times.  That made me nervous, but for the price I thought it was well worth the risk.  And so far I've had no such issues.  It's sits right on my desk all day and gets jostled constantly with no problems.  If you need extra USB ports, this will hook you up.

CommentsTitle: Didn't work - connected but no data transfer.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2018
CommentsContent: This did not work nearly as described. When plugged into my computer (tried multiple) it would detect as a USB hub, but the switches did nothing. It was able to detect devices plugged into the ports, but was unable to transfer any data to/from them. I was unable to communicate to my printers (USB to Serial), flash drives (USB 2.0 or 3.0), or even my USB mouse.I sent it back to Amazon for a refund.

CommentsTitle: Not worth it for led lights
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2017
CommentsContent: Purchased this to connect 2 led light strips. Once connected it doesn't emit enough power and the remote wouldn't work on the lights, when individually connected the lights worked just fine.I was surprised because this product is sold as an ad-on to the lights.I tried to return it and it would cost me well over $8 to do that which is more than I paid for this item in the first place.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I have used it for about 12 hours now and so far its great for my laptop. If you are using something like a desktop it may be inconvenient because the cord is very short, but for a laptop user like me it works great. My only other issues is that I felt like I put the USB all the way into my PC but it was still out a bit so nothing was powered, also the USB ports are not big enough to fit the entire tip of the usb so a bit of it sticks out that is not a big deal but I would of preferred it to go in all the way.

CommentsTitle: Good unit - but I do have a suggestion ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2016
CommentsContent: Works as advertised.  Bargain price. I even bought 2 more of these units after trying out the 1st one.There is one thing I would like to suggest however: I would much prefer to have a detachable USB cord than one which is permanently attached.  This would enable me to:1.) replace the short cord with a longer cord so it will work better with my PC setup2.) replace a defective cord.  As it is now, if the cord goes bad, the whole unit becomes inoperable.Because of this cord issue, I had to buy a separate USB "extension cable" which costs as much as this device does, and worse yet: my experience with extension cables is that they can be flaky, which is obviously no good - ruins the integrity of this device.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2016
CommentsContent: Nothing plugged into this would work. Took a look at the back of the package and saw, "Some power-intense USB devices may require a AC-Powered USB hub". Well, apparently that means anything you would actually want to plug into it. Mouse, Keyboard, wireless headset receiver and three different USB thumb drives wouldn't work in any of the ports.Well, fair enough, I can see how modern devices may require more power. It has a power port, what sort of AC adapter do I need to get? There is no input/output power information on the packaging or on the device model/serial number. So an AC adapter is a no-go.I tried plugging it into different USB ports (case ports in front are powered differently than the ports on your motherboard or back of the PC) and was able to get a ping for the wireless adapter, but the device was unrecognized by windows. All other devices didn't even register in the windows Device Manager.

CommentsTitle: Simple to use, powerful to use, value is incredible!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2015
CommentsContent: This is absolutely the best usb port hub that I've ever used! I'm so tickled pink with it that I immediately ordered one for my daughter! I use them to charge my e-cigarette batteries and can charge 4 at the same time, insuring that I never have a dead battery at that last minute! I've used others but the power switches are what makes this one work so much better than the other. I'm extremely impressed. I guess 3,490 positive customer reviews pretty much says it all... no, wait.. make that 3,491 positive customer reviews! I'd buy from Sabrent again feeling confident that I was getting a quality product at an excellent value!

CommentsTitle: Excellent for extending USB porrts on smaller laptops/PCs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2015
CommentsContent: I only have 2 USB ports on my work laptop and have quite a few peripherals to plug in (keyboard, mouse, speakers, USB flash drive) and this has worked flawlessly.  It's so convenient that I bought a second one for use at my house so I can switch my keyboard/mouse at my home office easily between my work laptop and home PC.Pros:Ports have a button to turn them on/off so you don't have to unplug something to remove it from your PCPorts have LED lighting to let you know which ones are turned onDurable - So far at my home office I've switched this around between my PC/Laptop quite a bit and it's holding up quite wellCons:A longer cord on this would help it's lifespan in the long run from not hanging off of a PC if that's what you are plugging it into.

CommentsTitle: Easy to use, and so convenient.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2016
CommentsContent: I absolutely love this USB hub. I work from home, and many meetings are handled through my Mac. As part of our privacy policy, I have to use headphones for these, since private customer information may be discussed.Previously, I used the ports on the aluminum full sized keyboard that came with my Mac. Since that keyboard finally died, I replaced it with another one that did not include the two USB ports. I was a little annoyed at first, since trying to fumble to plug the headphones in for meetings behind the mac was somewhat difficult. Additionally, needing to plug and unplug my iOS devices to accommodate this left me unimpressed, as well as having to sometimes juggle my USB stick when I needed headphones, and the iPod.This wasn't much of an issue when I could plug in to the keyboard, but behind the mac was just a pain.This USB hub was the PERFECT answer. In addition to giving me plenty of extra USB ports, the switching feature means I can leave my headset plugged in full time. I just press the button to have it go live for meetings, then go back to internal mic/speakers by turning off the port. Super Simple! The blue power indicators for each port are very nice, without being overpowering.I am looking to purchase a few more for my PC, and my family's PC's as well (including one with a wall adapter, for my power hungry devices)

CommentsTitle: Does not work with USB Headphones
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this product to support USB Headphones since my youngest son has to do online classes.  He has his mouse and keyboard plugged in, however, I found out today that this product does not support USB Headphones.  I was trying to configure a one-stop interface with all of his devices connected to this hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2020
CommentsContent: 12-8-2020 Now the connection is so loose the device is unusable. I got 9 months out of the device. I'm giving it a star because price, and I'd give another for the design but I'm miffed I can't use it anymore.6-2020 Over the last few months if I leave the device plugged in, it will randomly re-plug itself in. Including while I am working from another file or drive. Really annoying. I have tried both of my USB ports. Same issue. Therefore I am taking back a star. 3 stars for the device, and adding a star for the price being low. 4 stars.3-2020 For some reason my computer has only two USB ports. So If I hook up my printer, charge my phone, and want to do some work? Or go between USB's from different owner's for work? I frequently plug in my Printer, Phone, extra monitor, and multiple USB's. With this you can have zero or 4 devices hooked up to your computer. Explaining my stars. I do not know how to evaluate the camera quality or the charging power. Cord length is about 10 inches. Is that good or bad? This works for me.

CommentsTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2019
CommentsContent: This is exactly what I need for my Microsoft Surface! Only having one usb port was not cutting it when I needed to plug in a mouse and a zip drive.  I haven't had any issues with it so far you can plug in 4 things at once. I mostly just keep 2 plugged in at all times (mouse and zip drive). The cord is just the right length to plug into the side of my surface and have room to sit on a desk with room to move it out of the way. The cord measures about 8.5/9 inches

CommentsTitle: Adds more USB slots for Ps4
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this for my nephew to hook up several things to his ps4 since sony took a step backwards from Play3 to 4. With this he can have his extended HD plugged directly into the system. While the controller, back up thumb drive, vr, LIveGP recorder or whatever else attached at the same time. It works great. Price point was perfect as well.Next i'll purchase the 3.0 version with adapter so I can hook his up extended Hard drive via extender since you can't do so with this 2.0 version.-David L. Lee(on sister's account)

CommentsTitle: Would not recommend buying this product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased on 6/17/20-I use it daily for 2 external monitors and external key board. The first 3-4 weeks it worked perfectly - then it started losing connectivity with the monitors every 15-20 minutes repeatedly. The monitors completely go black screen losing the image.  Then it reconnects and they show the image.  This is everything plugged in correctly, nothing moving and it's not running hot like some of the other reviews. I use this for work while doing demonstrations and other things and it's a huge hindrance causing major issues.  I am outside of my return window and have notified the seller asking for an exchange. I received notification that the sellers email no longer works.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2019
CommentsContent: Needed these for a project which we are using a numberpad, mouse, hand scanner and sub network connector.  Received  and they went right to work.  Setup was used all day and wil be for at least the next three weeks.  Two were purchased as a test - just ordered two more to fulfill our total required setup.  Love the ability to turn off /on each port and also that the port button lights up.  Being based on a low budget these fit our needs perfectly.

CommentsTitle: Perfect for peripherals that you turn on and off.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I have a number of peripherals that I plug in and out regularly. For instance, I have a Logitech webcam that I use for Skype calls with family, but it confuses windows some times locking the mic from, so I try to unplug it when I am not using it. I also have a headset I use for business calls, but it is easiest to just unplug it when I want the speakers to work.PROs:This little USB hub is perfect for these types of situations. A simple button on the top effectively plugs/unplugs these peripherals. I have been using it for a week not and there do not seem to be any connection problems or issues with Windows not liking the connection. It is very stable. AND it let me organize the USB cords into a clean and permanent setup, so my desk got cleaner too.CONs:I wish it was USB 3.0 capable, but it's honestly not an issue for me right now as all the peripherals I turn on and off work just fine over USB 2.0.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2020
CommentsContent: The worst hub ever. Don’t buy it. Looks fancy but connection always has issue. Every time when I turn on laptop. I need to re-plug in the hub into my laptop. Even the laptop went to sleep. The connection will get lost. Have to replug couple of time per day. Want to throw away and buy a different brand. Totally waste money and time

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Needed this for my home-office set up... Works well, no issues thus far. Good price and nice product, would def recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I gave it a two but that might be generous.  Even with the light indicating that it has power, it won't always charge. A couple of the ports burned out quickly.  I'm going to invest in an anker product.  I've never had trouble with them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2021
CommentsContent: This item really isn't what it seems. It won't even charge two phones at once. Or a phone and watch

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I have purchased numerous extenders over the past couple of years.  A couple died within a couple of months and if you get more than 4 spot they have more problems.  This one has worked out so well, that I have bought a couple of more for my office computers.  Excellent product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased the Sabrent 4 port Hub with individual power switches because not all of the USB 2.0 ports on my older computer were functioning.  It was "plug and play" and although it took a little time on my Windows 7 computer to recognize it, once it did it functions well.  My grandaughter is home schooled and needs headphones and a mike as well as a camera for video conferencing. I only have three port that are either occupied or not functioning and this fills the bill.  I especially like the lighted buttons that indicate which port is powered and whether the usb it is plugged into is powered when the computer is turned off.  The connects seem solid and have had zero problems with how it functions.  If your computer is older like mine, checking for newer drivers wouldn't hurt.

CommentsTitle: Here's another product I love, Sabrent 4-Port USB with power switches that you ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2018
CommentsContent: Here's another product I love , Sabrent 4-Port USB with power switches that you can shut of , I guess it depends on buyer how it is packaged my came in blue box with foam and hard cardboard on back of foam to protect it ...Some come in big hard plastic package . This item is very light weight to it and like how you can turn one of ports of or 3 of them ...comes with 4 ports 2.0 Hub USB ..works well with extra devices .

CommentsTitle: Cheap, handy way to expand USB plug ins!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I have a lap top and apparently an overload of things I use USB plugs in for. This was so nice to be able to plug in and start using all my items requiring USB plug ins without having to constantly switch things. I would definitely recommend it in order to expand USB plug ins.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2020
CommentsContent: If you attach any device that requires a little extra USB power, it fails. The mouse worked, the PC mounted camera did not. My USB keyboard also did not work but it did work with my hand held camera which does not require USB power. So bottom line, you cannot use it to charge or supply much USB power to devices.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this for work to use with a chrome book.  I have attached a mouse / keyboard usb, document camera, overhead webcam, and speaker charging port.  It works perfectly!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I wanted to be able to charge multiple items at the same time from my computer. This charges everything and at a pretty quick pace. I was nervous because it was such a great price, but I am very happy with it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2014
CommentsContent: I have  purchased similar multi USB ports devices in the past. However, most, if not all of them, weren't very quick. Or, they hung up and none of the peripherals connected wouldn't work. even though this is only 2.0, it's miles ahead of any other device I've used, including one from D-Link. this thing is quick and hasn't failed me once. I like that it has an on/off switch for each port. That's useful if you plug a flash drive into a port and plan to leave it there. I think one of the reasons it's so quick is that it has a short permanently mounted cable attached. The others that I have tried used longer cables. Regardless, to me, this is a must have.

CommentsTitle: My mouse had become unresponsive pretty often
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2019
CommentsContent: Unfortunately, my laptop has only one USB 2.0 port. So, I purchased this device to plug my mouse and a key board.Maybe it's not the hub's issue, but since I plugged my mouse and a keyboard, they keep stopping to work randomly (most of the time a mouse does it). My mouse had become unresponsive, even it's the lighting of the mouse still works. I have to push the Turn Off button on the hub, and then Turn On it again.It's annoying. Sometimes it happens every 5 min, then 1-2 times per hour. Otherwise it is a good item (not for charging!).I would appreciate any suggestion on how I can fix it. Thank you for reading my review.

CommentsTitle: The first one worked so good I bought another!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2020
CommentsContent: With having to work from home and now my son doing distance learning these hubs work perfectly for our needs. My laptop only had 2 USB ports and my son's surface only had 1 which was not enough at all. These hubs make it so we can actually work. We have our wireless mouses plugged into them, keyboard, and headsets. Being able to turn the headsets on and off with the buttons is very helpful as well. I don't have to make my son unplug everything and plug it back in. They work perfectly and I cannot say enough good things about them. You won't be dissapointed.

CommentsTitle: Solid option for wireless device dongles and selective ports
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this hub to extend the USB capabilities of my new Windows PC. I have a wireless mouse and keyboard, and after reading that USB 2.0 works better with 2.4Ghz keyboards (vs. USB 3.0), I chose this hub.The main reason I've given it an excellent rating is that "it just works." I plug it in, everything works, no configuration needed. I like that I can selectively turn on ports, even though I don't really use that feature most of the time. I like that even if I don't want to unplug it entirely, I can turn off the lights for sleeping (my office doubles as our guest room). I like that the cable is long enough to reach my laptop's port even when my laptop is on a stand.As another reviewer mentioned, there isn't great light isolation; particularly when the room is dark, the light from one button bleeds through and partially illuminates its neighbors. This doesn't bother me, but if it'll bother you, it's worth noting.

CommentsTitle: Works well and at a good price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This item came in 1 day, even though this is the holiday season during a pandemic. It connected immediately and all the ports were perfectly. A great bargain!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this to add additional USB outlets to my laptop now that I’m working from home. This worked perfectly to plug in my headset and mouse. I like that you can turn on only the ports you need and leave the other ones off. Highly recommend especially for the price.

CommentsTitle: Works great for what I need it for
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2021
CommentsContent: I needed this because I work from home online and only have 2 usb ports on my laptop which is used for internet and flash drive so I couldn't use my mouse or anything else so I bought this just so I could use my mouse and anything else I might need and it does the job. It does seem if you try to charge something in the ports it charges very slow so if that is the reason you are buying I would advise you not to get this one

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought two of them a while back; then my kids yanked on them too many times, so I bought another. Works as expected.Fortunately, my kids are older now and know better (mostly), so we'll see how long this one lasts.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2016
CommentsContent: ok I had that I loved this device but it blew my screen and USB ports out the other night on my DELL XPS 15Z. I don't know how or why all I did was plug it in and it killed the machine. I had used it hundreds of time before but it did kill my machine. Everything fried on it and I know it was this device because as soon as I plugged it in everything died. sorry I liked it before but hate it now. UPDATEAfter discussing this matter with Sabrent and looking online at all of the complaints about my DELLXPS 15Z I concur with Manny that this product did not effect my laptop my laptop just died by coincidence. I apologize for giving bad review but would like to state that the DELLXPS15z was the problem and not the HUB.

CommentsTitle: The product itself works great. I recieved one with a non-functioning smashed 4th ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2018
CommentsContent: The product itself works great. I received one with a non-functioning smashed 4th port. Giving it one star for poor quality control.Update: They reached out immediately and sent me a new one free of charge. Customer service is fantastic. The USB hub itself is great, but a lot of plug and play stuff won't work through it. You will need to have the drivers ready for everything.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2021
CommentsContent: This is SUPER useful. The bottons really help and get rid of confusion. Theres more room and the cord length is perfect. It worked so good my dad bought one for himself.

CommentsTitle: Works great, very short cord though
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This USB hub is super. It's much smaller than I thought it would be (hadn't bothered to check dimensions) & that is great since I definitely don't need anything else taking up space on my desk. The cord is extremely short though. This is not any problem for me because I'm using it with a KVM that it sits right on top of - it's actually ideal for me. However, If I was trying to use this with another set up I might need an adapter just to get more length. I would recommend checking the cord length before ordering if that will be of any concern. I'm very happy with this purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2019
CommentsContent: Okay. I love this...when I can get it to stay plugged in. I'm driving a pretty new Lenovo IdeaCentre 520 All in One, and at first, I thought the cord was too short, but after working with it for a few days, I think the blade part that plugs into the computer is loose. If I hold it in a "plugged in" position, I can get some files loaded onto the computer. As soon as I release the cord, the light goes off, and I lose access to my files on the thumb drive. What should I do?

CommentsTitle: Works really great and exactly as advertised.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2016
CommentsContent: I can't really say there are any problems with this USB hub whatsoever.  I use it when I need to charge my mp3 player and portable speaker at the same time.  I've got a limited number of USB ports on my laptop (3) and they're all full, so this was a great way to gain an additional 3 (subtracting the one it needs to plug into).  I like how you can turn each one on or off and I usually only use 2 of the extra ports, but it's something that makes having a mouse, a speaker, and a cooling fan possible if I want to use other ports to charge things or even plug in my external CD/DVD drive as mine is no longer operational.  Highly recommended!

CommentsTitle: Worked for less than one week.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Worked fine for a few days and now will transmit neither power nor data. Cable seems fine, awful blue LEDs turn on fine, but no devices plugged in can do anything at all.Cannot be opened as the case is either plastic-welded or very tightly clipped together, so no chance of decent repair. Unit has a power jack on it but does not give any indication of what sort of power adapter to plug into it. I assume a 5V input but not having a designation on the device is just terrible.On another note, the blue LEDs are too bright, can't be dealt with easily, and are extremely annoying.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I seem to gravitate towards the Sabrent brand for USB hubs for some reason. Could it be the price ? Could it be because I never had an issue with them ? I don't know. If I had to say one thing I don't like, it would have to be the cord length. I really wish it was a few inches longer. I like the ability to shut off a USB connection by pressing the button on the top and leaving the thing I plugged into the computer via the hub connected. (but always click the "remove device", or, "remove hardware" icon on taskbar first. These connections on the hub are light up in a blue hue. I like this feature.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2018
CommentsContent: I purchased this for use with Rock Band on the Wii (the original).  I was slightly concerned it wouldn't function, because there are known issues with some USB adapters.  I am happy to report that the adapter works well, and being able to turn each one off is helpful because some of the instruments power on just because they are getting signal from the USB.  Using the buttons is much easier than unplugging every time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this unit to add more USB ports to my laptop so that I could plug in a full-size keyboard, mouse and wired headphones.  Works beautifully.  The cord is just the right length

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought this to use with my laptop, which has only 1 port (who uses only 1 port?! Nevermind, don't get me started...) Anyway, this hub is terrific-- smaller than i expected, which is good because it doesn't take up too much space on my little, tiny desk. I wish the cord was just a little longer, but it's not a big deal. Really happy with this purchase!

CommentsTitle: A Good Little Device for the Travel Bag
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2016
CommentsContent: Seems to work well on both Mac and Windows computers.  I specifically purchased to use with an Azulle Quantum Access computer, which only has a single USB 2.0 port.  I didn't expect there would be issues when I used the hub on an older Mac Mini and that turned out to be the case.  There were no driver issues with either operating system.  I have used all four ports simultaneously with no issues, but all the devices were very low power draws.  I am not sure what the cutoff would be with four ports relying on a single USB connection.  It is nice to have the ability to switch off devices without having to unplug.  There is the option to connect a second power source though the plug looks to be a unique standard.  Overall, I believe the Sabrent represents a good value.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2021
CommentsContent: Great product! Ordered it for work because I don’t have enough ports for USBs. I like that you can “turn on” the additional ports you need.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This little usb port hub has been amazing. It's sturdy and the ability to press a button to turn off power to external devices (like a webcam, printer, etc) comes in very handy. Travels with me everywhere I go.

CommentsTitle: I can see why this is an Amazon bestseller. It does the job and does it well.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2015
CommentsContent: I picked this up for a live panel that was aired on BlogTalkRadio. We needed to hook up four mics to one PC and this did the trick wonderfully well. The sound quality didn't suffer and the show was a hit with lots of listens. I loved I was able to just hit a button on the hub to disable a mic instead of having to go through my switch board to mute a mic. It was faster using the hub for this purpose. My Laptop handled having five mic (this is counting the one I was using through my PC) just fine too. I haven't used this for anything else, but after using it for the panel and all the mics, I have a hard time thinking this won't work with things just as good.I can see why this is an Amazon bestseller. It does the job and does it well.

CommentsTitle: Gives me 4 more USB 2.0 ports for my laptop
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I was looking for something that would allow me to add additional USB 2.0 ports to my laptop and this was just what I needed.  It gives me 4 additional ports and the ability to selectively turn ports on/off is a nice bonus feature.  When a port is turned on, there is a blue led background light to let you know that port is enabled.  So far I have attached three devices to the hub and everything worked as expected.  I use this mostly for a USB mouse receiver and a separate USB mouse/keyboard receiver, but having the two additional ports open is a bonus.  I also have a Type C hub that I use for portable hard drives, and with everything connected I have never had any issues with any of the devices.  If you want to expand your USB 2.0 ports, this does the job nicely.

CommentsTitle: Super Cheap Quality Not worth the money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 6, 2020
CommentsContent: This USB port was super cheap and we you get what you pay for as they say. The plastic is super cheap and feels easy to break and you really have to cram in your usb to actually get what you want working to work. Overall awful product. Would not recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this thing. I have my Xbox controller plugged into it. My external hard drive. And many other things off and on. The cord could be a little bit longer but then again I made this work but I just parking it flush with the side of my computer. It is very light weight so I had to anchor it with some tape on the bottom of it.

CommentsTitle: Can't run my external hard drive
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2019
CommentsContent: It works great with my Bluetooth mouse and when I have a small sd card plugged into it. Its not powerful enough to run my external hard drive. and that was the whole point for me getting this. I have a surface pro and it only has 1 usb port. so I bought this so I can have my hard drive, mouse, an a sd card plugged in at the same time. Going to have to look for another option.

CommentsTitle: 4 slots, but cant use more than 1 at a time??
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2017
CommentsContent: I bought two of these, hoping to use it to enjoy my Chromcast and the LED back light for my Sony Bravia in my living room and bedroom.  I cannot tell if that's this UBS hub that's doing it or the LED light, but I cannot use the Chromcast and LED light at the same time.  I like to watch youtube videos on my large screen TV using Chromcast, but when I watch it in the dark I needed the back light to reduce my eye strain. When I turn on the light (push the button on the hub) my Chromcast will go on for about a minute, then lose its casting ability to quickly switch back to my laptop screen. I tried again and again to confirm that.  When I turn off the backlit LED light I can cast the video again on the TV, but I have to watch it in the dark. I am not sure if that has to do with the hub's capacity issue or not, but it really disappointed me. There are 4 slots on the hub but I cannot even imagine it an handle all 4 uses at the same time after failed on just 2.  I now watch TV shows in the dark with beautiful back light, but Amazon video or Youtube video in the bright room without back light. If the seller reads my review, please give me advice if that's normal or not.

CommentsTitle: Great tool for cord-cutters using TV USB's as power sources
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2017
CommentsContent: This is a great hub. I attached them to the USB ports on my TV, so I could power both my Roku stick and Chromecast from a single USB port. On one TV, I was able to power the Roku, a Chromecast, and an HD antenna through this simultaneously. (Powering a device via the TV's USB is a great way to ensure that you stop streaming when you turn the TV off.)
