CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2015
CommentsContent: This product came quickly, is versatile. simple set-up, and easy to use.  It will be a great addition for when you are on the move and want as little weight as possible.I bought it for my desktop, but should have purchased two -- one for my desktop, and another for my tablet/ laptop combo device when I am on the move.  So on my tablet/ laptop I will occasionally need to add a wireless mouse, DVD/ CD-ROM player, charge phones, and an external hard-drive.  You could maybe add one more port on the hub, but this gets the job done.This is is a great tool for being able to work remotely, and move with minimum weight.  I'm not a heavy-tech person, so I am not as particular about a 2.0 vs. a 3.0 or 3.1 port.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Works just fine. Exactly what I wanted.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2019
CommentsContent: This is the second one that I have purchased. The first was for me in my home office, the second was for my husband as he returned to school. This is a great way to add a lot of productivity to your computer/laptop while taking up only one USB port. I’ve had my first one for three years with no issues, and this new one has been performing perfectly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: My computer only had one available USB port, which made using all the virtual work very inconvenient. I ordered this and it arrived the next day. I plugged it in and it worked.I also appreciate customer service reaching out to me to make sure I was satisfied.

CommentsTitle: Really cool little guys and affordable!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this for my iMac to turn on and off my wireless devices, that being my keyboard and mouse and the two extra ports for my flash drives or portable hard drive. Needless to say, this thing is awesome and I love it. I love that its price wasn't as hefty as others. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a solid USB hub, but not willing to fork out too much money for one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2021
CommentsContent: Just received this hub - I like it!  I have only used it once, but I think it is going to be exactly what I wanted/needed. My new HP laptop only has one USB port, and since I use that port for the mouse, I needed another port for the flash drive. Love the on/off buttons.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: Gets the job done. I am using it for my usb accessories on the Xbox 360, as I only had two usb ports on the front and needed to plug in a kinect and wifi adapter via usb, in addition to my wired controllers. This fit the bill, and I like that you can toggle each port on and off separately so as not to waste power going to an empty port. I cannot speak to its charging abilities, as I only have 1 wireless controller and no cord to connect that one with for charging.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2014
CommentsContent: Nice length cord, cause I have velcro attached in strategic places on my adj. cooling pad, and on my lid of my laptop. Popped some velcro on the bottom so all I have to do is stick her on and plug up.The Buttons work great because I have a bunch of usb's  that have diff. programs and OS's loaded on them. Instead of unplugging them, all I have to do is press a button. Saves on wear and tear. The lights show which ones are active.Nice Price for a nice product. I give this 2 Thumbs up! A must have for someone that works with computers and their accessories....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2018
CommentsContent: I have a little Dangle I need plugged in close to my Mouse in order for it to work with my computer. It will not work without it. So I used this to have it closer and it turned out useful for plugging in my phone for downloading pictures, updating music on my iPad and so on. Very useful, especially with separate lights so I can turn them on and off as needed!  Very well make and works perfectly!

CommentsTitle: Good hub, slow to download drivers on new plugged devices
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2016
CommentsContent: I have had this hub for a few months now and have been using it daily on my desktop setup for gaming/audiophile/video production. The hub has all 4 ports used by gaming keyboard, gaming mouse, blue mic, and webcam.It works well as a stand alone hub with individual switches, but I have this inline with a USB 3.0 hub and it is very slow to initialize. It seems to not want to quickly recognize new devices and install those drivers. Once it does download the drivers and recognize the devices, it works great. Other than that fact, it works well and is able to connect my peripherals.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this product to add connections for my other devices I wanted to have available on my PC.  It is great with on off buttons for each connection port that are lit so you know if they are on or off...perfect for my needs and it is small enough not to get in the way of my other desk items

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2014
CommentsContent: I have a couple Sabrent USB switched hubs.  I run most everything through these because I can easily turn off and on the devices I want to use without having to un/plug them.  Saves wear on the ports and reaching behind the computer.  I use USB drives for backup, so I don't need them portable, lost, or running all the time.  -Click- Problem solved.  Same thing with my scanner; I don't need it on every time I sit down to my computer.  Also, I like being able to switch off my wireless adapter when I don't want to be connected to the internet.  It's especially handy if you are using a metered internet connection, like a cell phone.  If you plan on charging items or running multiple high-bandwidth devices at the same time (transferring large files between multiple external hard drives, etc.), I would recommend comparing this hub to Sabrent's 4 or 7-port switched hubs (USB-HPSS & USB-H7PS) which include a power supply that is optional to use.  The power supply just ensures maximum power to each port and can even be used off-computer as a multi-charge dock.  For simple accessory expansion (flash drive, wireless mouse, Bluetooth adapter, etc.), this hub is just right.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I can't speak to the longevity as I've only had it a month or so, but so far works great.  I'm a bit perplexed with the on/off buttons for each port, but other than that, it does exactly what it was made for.  Good price, good delivery!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Our computers only have one and two USB, respectively, so charging a fitbit and phone or downloading to a thumb means longer wait time.  This solve the problem.  I did buy an additional cord so things weren't hanging down.  Worth the money.

CommentsTitle: Thought it was faulty, needed to change device manager settings - FIX
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Initially thought this was defective - I would plug one usb in and it’d be fine but then I would plug another USB in and it’d stop working entirely. I use this as a usb hub to my work laptop. Found a solution from another review:Windows 10, or windows in general, defaults to turning off usb devices in order to save power. Go to device manager > USB controllers > select your hub > right click > properties > power management > uncheck the boxesI almost bought a $40 USB hub because I thought this was faulty. It works perfectly after I followed the above steps! Hopefully this helps someone too.

CommentsTitle: More Connections on Desk, One Disconnect for Portability
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2016
CommentsContent: Handy!  External hard drive (for backup storage), mouse (easier than trackpad), full-size "real" keyboard, digital camera download (via USB), iPhone/iPad sync with iTunes, Verizon dongle to connect via cellular to Internet -- the list of USB connections to my trusty 2009 MacBook Pro laptop is long and grows longer, and it only has two (2 - count'em) USB ports (more than recent Macs, but that's another story).  I do not want to wear out the USB connectors on Trusty 2009 (motherboards are pricey and difficult to replace), and would prefer to plug stuff into an external USB hub, replaceable/expandable as necessary.  This Sabrent 4-Port USB Hub fits the purpose. This rugged fellow is just what you need to expand, but allows you to remove just *one* connector when you want to walk off with the laptop for truly portable use.  Recommended - highly.  5-stars!

CommentsTitle: Excellent USB expansion hub, on/off indicators a benifit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2015
CommentsContent: I purchased this hub to use with Raspberry Pi 2 Mod 2 setups and functions quite well with the Raspbain OS, as most likely will other hubs. Individual switched ports are a definite benefit to conserve power drain from the small RPi when those devices are not in-use/needed. And obviously the additional ports allow for other devices to be connected since the RPi only presents four. I connect a wireless mouse through it that I also use on a laptop and thus need to easily remove when using the other machine. Has functioned quite well and continues to do so, the only con is that it in not powered, which would also make the device more expensive. For the price it is a good buy and seems to be of good quality.

CommentsTitle: Worked fine for about a month ... then ?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: It worked great for peripherals (mouse, keyboard, small light I use) I only had 2 ports in front of my computer, I really needed 3; so I got this thing.  It worked terrific, and no it didn't get hot as I'd seen others claim (maybe it did for them, but mine stayed cool). I had a minor water splash and I think some of it may have hit the unit, although all night last night it worked fine. This morning -- every port would NOT work.  So before I fully blame the unit, even though I've found quite a few claiming it gave out after a while, I'll give it another try, just to be certain it wasn't my fault.  Stay tuned.. because I *will* follow up when I use the replacement -- which, if it does the same thing-- I'll certainly add to this review.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I liked the first one so much, got one for my bride. Note to self: not the best anniversary gift. But works great and the one/off toggle switches are very handy because sometimes I have to toggle the bluetooth mouse in order for attached storage to be recognized by Windows 10.  I would buy more if I had more machines.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I got this to extend my pc usb hub for the mousepad lights, and occasionally my oculus rift sensor. It gave up on me, and I got it on July 22. Almost one month, it was working fine until one day I turned on my pc and it reads 2 usb I had plugged in as “malfunction” and it wasn’t connected. I’ve tested out the usb cables by plugging it into the mobo usb, works fine. And I’ve try plugging other usb plugs in here as well, and it didn’t work either. Tried plugging it into a different pc, same story.I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

CommentsTitle: Used with Raspberry Pi Zero W
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021
CommentsContent: Used this to connect a mouse and keyboard to my Pi Zero W that has only one USB port.  (yes, there are two, but the other one is for power only)

CommentsTitle: Simply Awesome!  I love this thing!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2016
CommentsContent: This hub is awesome!  The great thing is I can have 4 things plugged into it at once and turn each of them off, individually, with the buttons that power the ports.  I write computer software so I have a scanner, a USB stick, a signature pad and my USB rocker launcher on the ports.  I have the hub on my desk connected to my computer with a USB extension cable.  So, I don't have to reach under my desk to plug and unplug these things anymore.  Great product!I bought a second one for when I travel with my laptop.  Love this!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2020
CommentsContent: We bought this to plug into our TV.  I used to have to unplug my Roku anytime I wanted to plug in my TV antenna, and with this I can have both plugged in!  I like the on/off buttons for each USB plug.  The blue lights also turn off if the power is not on, which is nice because I thought they'd be on when plugged in, no matter what.  Especially for the price, I highly recommend this USB hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2021
CommentsContent: So far so good working well my Xbox One powers up a Thrustmaster TMX pro wheel and wireless headphones. It’s charging my headphones and wireless controller with the system off. Would have been nice if some Velcro had been added too keep it in place had to add my own but no big deal.(Update) well staring to lose faith in this unit. The port I used for a wireless headphones dongle started to mess up kept disconnecting and reconnecting the signal. Thought it was the dongle but it’s the port. Moved it to another one and it’s working again. Going to experiment with turning it off while not in use and charging the headphones and controller. For 8 bucks shouldn’t have expected top of the line.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2015
CommentsContent: My new PC arrived with just two USB ports. I needed a minimum of three USB ports so I decided to give this Sabrent a try. It is well worth the small amount that it cost. The cord is somewhat short at about 8 or 9 inches but long enough for my purposes. Each port has a switch and a blue light to indicate when the switch is on. It works well for hooking up my printer, the exterior disc drive that came with my PC and a SanDisk that I use for backing up data. Could not be simpler to install or easier to use. Wish it was made in the USA instead of China but I can't really complain because it is such a useful gadget.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought the 4port hub as I didn’t have as many ports as I needed for my key pad and external hard drive. It performs flawlessly. The cord length is just long enough for me. I have not used it to charge external devices or cameras. Costs less than half as much as a hub from a retail store. .

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this in 2015 and still use it once in a while but I've noticed it disconnects and then reconnects every once in a while. If I have devices connected to it, it gets annoying that I won't be able to use my wireless keyboard and/or mouse until it reconnects. Either it was faulty since I've had it or poor quality, but you could spend a little more on another one such as the Anker multi-USB (which I also have).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I seem to use a lot of USB connections - a backup USB drive, cameras, keyboard, printer, external mike.  I had a couple of old hubs that stopped working, so I finally ordered a new one and it works great.  I have not used it for much yet.  Lights show you which ports are active.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2021
CommentsContent: I needed a small USB HUB due to traveling between the office and home. This one is perfect and it has the on and off individual power switches which make it so easy for travel as well. I have only used it for a few weeks, but love it so far! Recommended!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Love mine! Coworkers and I no longer fight over who gets to charge what whe, now we can all charge at the same time! Easy portably!  Great for camping and the car too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2020
CommentsContent: This is great for adding multiple adapters to my laptop while working from home. One of my laptop USB ports doesn't work, but now I'm able to use one port for 4 plugs! I'm using my wireless mouse, wireless keyboard, and HDMI 2-split adapter for two monitors all plugged into this USB splitter. Highly recommend for a great quality product that makes working from home a lot easier and more productive!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this to primarily use with Pen Drives. I do a LOT of work with them and figured the on off switch and the USB lighting would be a benefit, and THEY are. The problem? You can only use two and sometimes 3 of the ports at a time due to them being too close together and pen drives being wider than USB cord ends! If they had given a quarter inch more between ports then ALL would work, and I would be happy. But, alas... I will use it until it fails which I suspect will be quite a while as it seems to be durable. It would have benefited with say a 24-30" cord instead of the 10". The port on my desktop is too far up so the unit dangles which will probably accelerate wear on the plug wires. The price was too good to be true, and once more that old adage holds true.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I have been pleasantly surprised by this item... it is small, which is a plus, and the ability to turn each port on and off is amazing. I am a teacher running my classroom from home, and I was exhausted switching out different microphones, clickers, cameras.... with this new setup I can leave everything in place! I love it and highly recommend to everyone working from home

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2021
CommentsContent: Super easy setup - just plug it in. I needed a couple extra USB ports and this is perfect. Sleek and small so it’s tucked out o the way behind my laptop. Works easily, all ports were immediately recognized by my laptop. Great find for so inexpensive!

CommentsTitle: Been using it for a while now
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Having used thus usb hub for about 6-8 months now, I feel it is of good quality and works as expected. Except for one or two occasion did not have any issue detecting the usb through this hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: This USB Hub does something that I find should have been made years ago. It shuts the Flashdrive off without having to actually select it on the computer screen to shut it down and then remove it. Also, you have to press a button to turn on a slot to use in the first place, this allows you to add more than one Flashdrive without thinking about which is which that you are using at the time. Nice find! Saves little headaches like when the Flashdrive won't shut down because the computer has some phantom notion that it is still being used when you know that it isn't. I hate when that happens, makes me wonder who is using, because I'm not. This USB Hub "prevents" all that NONSENSE!

CommentsTitle: It works, and it's worth it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2016
CommentsContent: I love this little gadget. I built my PC but it only had a few USB ports because the motherboard and case I went with were budget and I have yet to upgrade. I was going to go with a PCI USB hub but alas, my motherboard's PCI slots are already taken. I was really skeptical with this because I figured "How could a USB hub support 4 devices by plugging into just 1 USB slot?" It works though, and I've had no problems with it yet. I have my mouse, keyboard, wireless USB card, and my webcam all plugged to it right now and there's no latency, no connection issues, no power issues as of yet. I'd recommend this to anyone, and I may even buy another. This has freed up both of the front USB ports on my machine for game controllers, which I love.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2020
CommentsContent: Everything has a USB charging cord now, or runs via USB. I cannot constantly be hopping up to change out cords behind the computer, nor do I have enough ports. This does its job. I use it for my printer, my webcam, charging my fitbit and my wireless headset. It's not amazing, but it's not lame either. It just works.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2021
CommentsContent: I use it for my WFH set up. It's made moving my laptop away from my full work-desk setup much more convenient and allows me to hide most of the wires while working. I also like that I can turn the headphones on/off for video calls with the buttons instead of unplugging.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent: I only gave a four because I've just started using it.  Right out of box, plug it in to your usb port.  it gives me a little more flexibility.  I have a laptop and bought an external keyboard, so I was running out of ports. Works great, and can turn off ports I'm not using. (Blue light if on) i would give a five star if I had used it longer. Great price too.

CommentsTitle: Causes interrupt issues when used on USB 3.2
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I have both the 3.0 version and this 2.0 version from the same manufacturer.This 2.0 version causes all kinds of interrupt issues when being used while gaming on USB 3.2.Only my headset was on the hub, nothing else and it caused sound to mute, controllers to stop working and would, occasionally, even  cause my mouse to report 'close window' when in Chrome.I went back to the 3.0 and all issues went away.Again, I want to stress that the mouse and controller were not plugged into the 2.0 hub; only my headset.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2018
CommentsContent: When I first got this little hub, I was impressed with it. It was just the right size, had 4 hubs and individual on/off switches. I use hubs a lot since I'm getting my book ready for my manuscript and my laptop only has 2 ports and I need 1 tor my fan, so I was tickled to get this hubBut the romance soon disappeared as the hub started getting hot and kept getting hotter, heating my USBs along. Now I'm finding corrupted documents I'm trying to complete each for my manuscript. the pulling a document of onetitle and it opens to another document and I can't find the one I was looking for. One thing that got eaten/ misfiled or ... a document with the first four chapters of my book. I can't find them, but something mysterious happened to them. I believe the heat from the hub is slowly corrupting my documents. But the heat today was frightening as I had located 3 documents that appear lost. and I was afraid of an explosion. So I'd suggest you check your documents  and the heat generation  B 4 you lose chapters.

CommentsTitle: Great and practical product form an amazing company
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2016
CommentsContent: Great product and an even better company. I purchased this 4-port USB hub solely because my Macbook only has two USB ports which put me at a disadvantage because I have multiple USB flash drives and other tools that require a USB spot. The first item I received was faulty in the sense that only one of the ports worked; however, after contacting the company they sent me a replacement which works amazing. This item is a must if you use the computer often as it allows you to have your phone, flash drives, external disk drives and even more things connected at any given moment.

CommentsTitle: Great Product...and one that finally works for me!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2016
CommentsContent: This USB Hub is just what I was looking for.  I had previously bought 2 other hubs for my laptop from various online stores because they were really cheap.  I thought that a hub is a simple thing and there wouldn't be much difference.  Nope, I was wrong.  Those flimsy other ones are very finicky and work only when they feel like it, disconnecting and reconnecting my peripherals multiple times within the same minute or two.  I like that with this hub, I can turn off power to any device that I don't want to have on (like an external drive or DVD player).  Some consumers may want or need the faster transfer speed of a USB 3 or 4 hub, so take that into consideration before purchasing this product.  USB 2 is perfectly fine for my needs.

CommentsTitle: This is a piece of junk.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The piece started failing within a week of using it and now is as bad as the one I was replacing. I have my keyboard and mouse plugged in to it, and will suddenly find the keyboard or mouse has quit working. It revives when I turn the button off and on, but it happens all too often.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought two one for me and the other for my son and we love it.  My son uses to work 3-4 flash drives at a time and really likes that there is enough space for each one and can use at the same time. I bought it because I have to work at home and need 2 monitors for my laptop that only has 2 USB ports  Those ports are being used for the wireless keyboard/mouse and the other for my headphone, so definitely needed this which works great for the set up!

CommentsTitle: A 4-port's a 4-port, but this seems a bit sturdier.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2013
CommentsContent: Good little device for the price. Haven't had it but a short while, but it seems to meet my needs. It is a bit sturdier than other hubs I have used in the past, which is a primary concern for me. To a large extent a 1-port USB to 4-port USB hub is pretty much not going to produce a lot of surprises. It doesn't do USB 3, but I wasn't expecting that. In my tests, it seems to handle 4 peripherals at a time without slowing too much. This includes 2 hard drives that were powered through the port, so it does okay if that performance holds up.The little power switches might come in handy when I am doing something that would require my turning devices off for a bit, such as video chat which might be more data intensive, (I have not tried an external camera with this while using other devices,) but they really don't seem important for the price. I basically wanted a cheap,4-port for my 2-port laptop and this appeared to be as tough as any I could see.

CommentsTitle: Stopped working in less than three months.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I got it at the end of September and now, middle of November, it stopped working for anything but to power a light. Printer won’t pass through. Status lights aren’t working, charging stopped working (and was very slow/weak) to start with.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2018
CommentsContent: I absolutely love these, had to buy a second one for another device in my house since the first one is always being used on my PC with no issues. I've had the first one over a year already and its still working like it just came out of the box. very good product for the price and durable too. I'm thinking stocking stuffers next year for my family.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2014
CommentsContent: I could not be happier with this USB Hub.  I have never had a USB Hub with individual switches but it does seem like a good idea and I like the LED lights to let me know which ports are on.  I have used it for many things and it has worked great for all of my purposes.  The short cord makes this very portable and if I do need more I use a USB extension cord.The biggest load I have put on this hub involved charging my two Iphones (work and personal) plus a portable external battery (10000mAH).  This hub charged all three items as if they were all plugged directly into my laptop.I would recomend this to anyone looking for a good protable USB Hub.

CommentsTitle: Powerful little hub that does the job
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2017
CommentsContent: Great product, I've had one of these for years and used it on and off, and ended up getting another one a few months ago. Now I've got one mounted to my desk, and another connected to a hidden USB extension cord that extends to the middle of my house, for wireless controllers and accessories to have better coverage. Both are working reliably and provide better power to my gadgets than most of my USB ports do. The buttons are a great feature so you can easily reset a connection without even having to pull and re-plug the cable. And the lights let you know which ones are active. This thing does the job, I can't think of anything that needs change or improvement here.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2015
CommentsContent: Bought one of these quite some time ago (years?) and it has worked perfectly for all this time. Bought a new laptop and needed to add at least two more USB ports, so bought this one. Had to set it up upside down on the cradle, so plugged in my two stand alone hard drives to ports three and four. Port three worked perfectly, but when I clicked on port four it came on, then instantly went off. I did it again (thinking I did not push it hard enough to click in)m and it did the same thing. Really drove my new laptop crazy. Four four has a switch that does not and will not stay in the 'on' position. Oh well, three out of four isn't so bad.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Pleased with this product it helped to organize my USB wires while giving more USB ports. The item arrived very quickly and works very well. I especially like the fact that I can turn off any ports not in use.

CommentsTitle: Doesn't work with accessories - why bother?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2019
CommentsContent: My work computer has Windows 7, so when I started to run out of ports, I picked this one because it specifically stated it was compatible.Got the package, plugged it in. Nothing worked, even items that were working fine when plugged directly into my computer. Saw no drivers were necessary (nice), so called support.  They said this device doesn't work with accessories, like headphones, keyboards, and mice - only USB for data transfer.Why you'd need to transfer data from 4 sources at once is beyond me, as is why they wouldn't support accessories. SMH. Returning.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2016
CommentsContent: I needed a simple USB hub for my Xbox One so I could hook up more hard drives and controllers.  Day 1 out of the box, my joystick was having issues when hooked up to the HUB.  It would either not respond at all, or the controller would be constantly scrolling down over and over.  I double checked to make sure the appropriate power button was active, and it was.  Next, I tried hooking up a Rock Band guitar USB device that made the old guitars compatible with the new Rock Band.  While the device works when plugged directly into a USB port, it would not work when running through the HUB.  Lastly, I figured I would hook it up to my PC so I have more ports for charging USB devices to at least get SOME use from the HUB, but none of the devices responded when plugged into the HUB.  After trying the USB HUB in 3 different scenarios, all with poor results, I gave up.UPDATE:  The manufacturer sent me a replacement product for free, which I haven't had any issues with yet.  So I've had a 50% success rate with this item.

CommentsTitle: Does not charge certain items ex: Apple Watch , iPhones..
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this specifically for my Apple Watches and iPhones, but it doesn't charge them. I connect it to my outlet strip with usb slots, then my 2 watches and 2 iPhones into the product, turn on the top switch according to slot, and VOILA! It doesn't work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: Product works as designed. Very happy with device, since 2 out of 3 USB ports stopped working properly on my laptop. This device will help until I need to replace the laptop.

CommentsTitle: Good USB hub for my new gaming lap top
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2016
CommentsContent: I bought this USB hub for my new gaming lap top windows 10 PC ..I also got a lap top fan and a gaming mouse to connect to the usb hub..and becuse i had so many items I had to connect to my lap top this was why i made this purchase for a usb hub.For a mouse n a fan and a small speaker this works great. I have been using this every day for about 2 weeks now for many hours a day... All USB ports worked fine on my hub ..i did check all 4 ports.So far i have NOT had any connectivity issues..So far this is working very well for my lap top..The other thing I was quite please with was when you push the button to turn on ur USB mouse or wat ever u want to connect there is a light around the button to let you know that it is in use..this is imo a good feature..I took 1 pic with no flash to show the lights and 1 pic with a flash to show the usb hub.i am happy i made this purchase.The pakaging of the usb hub came in a clear plastic package..the hub fit nice n snug in to the package.. Whit a paper insert on how to use the hub.

CommentsTitle: check the width of your flash drives
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2018
CommentsContent: Item shipped quickly and was as described. I like the fact the switches are on this model and serve a couple purposes. As a pc hub for usb, you can connect and disconnect flash drives instead at the push of a button. The only con to this hub over others is that the ports are aligned tightly, only allowing 2 flash drives  (SanDisk cruzer) to be used at one time. You might be able to fit 4 slim drives, but I'm looking to add usb extension cables to the mix.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: my computer for work only came with one USB. this is a great way to extend that. Works perfectly. It was recommended to me by someone whose department has shared computers and the USBs are in the rear of the machine. this allows them to add and remove USB devices without crawling under the desk.

CommentsContent: This usb hub works as advertised.I’m currently using all 4 ports while working from home during the pandemic.I have headphones, 4K cam with light ring, keyboard, and external monitors running off this hub and haven’t experienced any issues.Works great. I would definitely recommend.

CommentsTitle: Comes with switches to activate ports separately
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2019
CommentsContent: This 1 to 4 USB hub (ver. 2.0) is probably the best one I have worked with. I came across it in our lab while I was copying saved data to my flash drive from a shared computer. Glad that it wasn't out of production and bought a second one for my wife. The provision of the switches (with LED!) to individually turn an port ON/OFF was very smart.

CommentsTitle: Super easy to set up and so portable!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2014
CommentsContent: I have a Windows 7 laptop and needed more USB slots. I just connected this hub into the USB, then connected the USBs, one at a time, each time turning on the USB switch, giving the computer time to recognize and connect.  Maybe I was being cautious going in this methodical fashion, but wanted to be sure all goes well.Have the printer, scanner, mouse and keyboard plugged in and works perfectly!  I was concerned about the printer and scanner (they are separate devices) that they would draw too much power that the hub wouldn't work, but it does!The price is great and shipping was super fast from the seller, LEXIVON.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021

Suddenly, I can add additional peripherals like anew scanner, for example. Works great a nice to have the on/off capability on each port. Great product. Thanks!

CommentsTitle: I’ve had two of these little hubs and they both have functioned perfectly.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I’ve used these for charging (even though it says not to) and is constantly on and running different things through all 4 ports. I’ve had not static problems or charging issues or build quality problems. Used these for years. Definitely a great bang for buck. They also look cool :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2014
CommentsContent: At home, I've a drawer full of USB hubs, all of which were supposed to be Mac compatible, none of which were.This unit performs exactly as promised.  It works with Mac and PC, sans any meddlesome software.  It has on/off switches for each port, handy if you plan to plug in powered components.  I've loaded it up all at once with an array of thumb drives, tablets, and phones, and the Sabrent reads data and delivers power with no problems.What I like the most is the overall design.  Non-obtrusive, unlike those octopus style doohickeys you find at the discount electronics store.  Built solidly, unlike the cheap plastic hubs that fall apart in your briefcase.  Compact, making it perfect for wherever you set up your laptop.  Aesthetically, this might be less-than-perfect for a desktop CPU, but just as functional, I'm sure.

Nice product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2016
CommentsContent: It's pretty cheap. Within a few months the first button/port stopped working, and after a little less than a year only one port functions anymore.This is NOT with heavy use. It is in my classroom and I plug it in once at the beginning of the day and unplug once at the end. No porting it anywhere or tough use. For something that stays in the same room all the time with mild usage it certainly didn't last long.I am sure the selling point is that it is so cheap you can buy five of them for when they inevitably break, but my environmentalist heart can't get behind that practice. I'm on the lookout for something that can handle the demands of minor desk work. Sigh.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Does exactly what I bought it for. I have an all-in-one desktop computer at the office. Two of the ports stopped working so purchased this device. Works great after two months.

CommentsTitle: This is awesome but as soon as I got it I tried ...

CommentsContent: This is awesome but as soon as I got it I tried to charge my phone, tablet, and portable charger and they weren't charging. CommentsContent: I have a globe of the solar system on my desk. I don't want it on all the time. So now I can just turn it on when I want it on.l instead of crawling under my desk to plug it in or unplugging it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: After my company started working from home, I wasn't allowed to keep the dock for my work laptop. Because of that, I no longer had enough ports for all of my devices, hence why I bought this USB hub. I currently have a mouse, keyboard, and headset connected to it and they all work perfectly. I would be skeptical of trying to use this hub for devices that are more demanding, but it's perfect for my purposes.I wish the cord was a bit longer and I wish the lights that show you which ports are active weren't as bright, but neither of those have caused me any real problems.

CommentsTitle: First I ordered a 3.0 USB Hub. ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2016
CommentsContent: First I ordered a 3.0 USB Hub.  I now use it on a PC and I'm very happy with it.  But I wanted to share my particular case in the hope this will helps others....Originally, I wanted to attach a K400 keyboard to an Nvidia Shield TV.  I found out (after long research, buried deep in [Nvidia] forums) that a 3.0 USB will not work to drive the K400 keyboard.  To use the K400, you *must* connect a 2.0 USB.So then I got the Sabrent 2.0 Hub.  I first attached the 2.0 Sabrent to my PC, loaded the Logitech Unifying software and it found the keyboard right away.So, it all worked out, but not before a lot of digging and research.  One feature that I really like about both of these hubs is the switches.  You can turn devices ON or OFF by simply using a switch.  I think that is so cool and very handy.  You might have an external drive that doesn't need to be on 24/7 constantly (I do), so that comes in real handy.  These Sabrent hubs do everything I need them to do.The Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub saved the day!!  And I like the Sabrent 3.0 USB as well. I put it to good use on my PC.Thank you Sabrent! I will most definitely be buying gear from you again!

CommentsTitle: All ports did not function for me
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm surprised this got good reviews, but it could be that they are mixing the ratings between different models. The unpowered units (2) I purchased only worked sometimes. The first one was fine with a wireless mouse USB, an external keyboard USB and ONE brick. The fourth slot on the unit would not operate simultaneously with the third slot. The drives would often make scary noises and disconnect. The second unit also would not operate more than 2 bricks at once. There might be some sort of pass-through limitation, so I would advise folks to try the powered, faster units, although I have not tried them yet myself. Limited functionality gets it two stars; at least it did allow me to transfer my data between bricks although with less convenience than for which I had hoped.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2018
CommentsContent: It works great for a USB extension for a ps4 console. adding a string of usb connections for a headset and any other usb connector accessory is great if you have the older ps4 model with only 2 usbs on the front of the console.

CommentsTitle: Effective USB splitter that does the job.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Effective USB splitter that will increase your USB ports from one to four. Each port can be individually controlled by a LED switch. Everything works fine on my laptop computer. It might be a good idea to spend a few bucks more for something that works like this device instead of buying some Chinese junk at rock bottom price.

CommentsContent: Shipping arrived day late.Not everything you connect to this 4 port usb device will work. Example an external hard drive will NOT work. In the onset thought loss all that wad on external device but was able to recover.I've had to adjust how I planned to use this 4 Usb port device. I regret ordering.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Four USB ports is the perfect size for me. I liked that each port had a button to turn off and on. Works well for my purposes. Not sure why camera quality and charging power was listed in the review of this hub rating by Amazon. Good value for the price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I tried several other brands over the years but was very disappointment. This product worked immediately - I no longer need to purchase an additional card for all my USB devices.

CommentsTitle: Looks great, works great.  You need it.  Buy it.  Seriously, buy it now.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2014
CommentsContent: Awesome little hub that works very well.  The leds on top let you know which port is on and which is off.  No more powering down things to unplug them, just click the button on top.  Brilliant design.What you don't know about hubs:Hubs used to be used in networks as the main connection point for computers to talk to one another.  Some people probably still use them at times.  This is fine until you get too many computers talking to each other.  A hub is stupid.  It will send communication it receives to every port attached - even if the port doesn't need it.  For networks, this is terrible because so much little talk is being transmitted and received across different computers.  It will slow down immensely.A USB 2.0 hub is no different.  It's sending the data to every port.  With this having the ability to turn off the ports not being used, it speeds up the communication.  I like that I can keep some things plugged in and just turn them off when they are not needed.  The speed does go up, but it's also handy not seeing those things pop up in my computer window when I'm working.Yes, I recommend this hub - it looks great and works great

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2015
CommentsContent: A little flaky...turn one connection on or off seems to momentarily disconnect the others. Not so good for external drives, but not a problem for keyboards and mice. Will not charge an iPad, but otherwise works fine with Mac.Updated for new model:Be aware that USB 3.0 (this xib and all other) can severely interfere with bluetooth and wifi. This is a known issue with USB 3.0 since it uses spread spectrum technology. For me, I have to plug this hub into the USB port on the left side of my MacBook Pro. When I plug it into the right side, my mouse and wifi do not work well.Another minor issue is that when used with a keyboard, the USB hub seems to go to sleep with the computer disabling the keyboard's ability to wake the computer after sleeping.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2020
CommentsContent: During this Covid time I am working from home and needed to plug multiple devices into my computer. This works really well for the four devices I have plugged in now. Great if you want to add a light and microphone to your zoom sessions but not give up your mouse and iPad.

CommentsTitle: It is an excellent product. I like that you can control which ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2016
CommentsContent: It is an excellent product. I like that you can control which one of devices you can turn on or off. For starting techies  each USB connection can have 128 devices attached to it of course this means a large power supply to handle all of the devices. So controlling what is running is a really nice feature. Now my wife wants one also. I have purchased a total for 4 USB 2.0 Sabrent hubs in matter of a few months and i am pleased with all of them. I have 3 computers under my desk; one computer has all USB port taken plus i have 2 Sabrent Hubs attached the other two computers have 1 each of the Sabrent USB hubs attached and they are all full. i still have not purchased one for my wife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2015
CommentsContent: Perfect for what I needed. I have a 2011 iMac, with all the usb ports annoying located on the back of it. Normally, I have to turn the whole screen just to see the ports and plug something in. So, I gave this a whirl to see if it would hold up and be a solution.Works perfect, and I love the little lights and ability to turn each port on/off. I use it to charge my vape-pens, iPhone, GoPro, and more, and 4-ports seems to be perfect.Would be nice to have a slightly longer cable, but I sit pretty close to my iMac screen so it's within reach whenever I need it, and now I never have to move my computer around. If it ever fails or breaks, I'll buy another one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2014
CommentsContent: It worked for me, but one of the issues I would have for some odd reason is that sometimes when I would have it connected, it would disconnect me from the internet. I spent a lot of time trying to troubleshoot this issue. As soon as I would disconnect the device, even though nothing was connected to it, the internet was able to be fine. Keep in mind I'm a Mac user. Also had this happen to another friend for the same reason who was also a Mac user. Not sure why this would happen. Their tech support didn't really provide an answer other than an RMA.The other thing is that it doesn't play nice with wireless devices like mice, which is kind of annoying, but oh well. Other than that it was great for hard drives and USB flash drives so if that's all you're connecting it, by all means it's a good product. Just had a few quirks that will not make me want to buy it again personally.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent: I am using this product as a hub so multiple devices (printer, wireless mouse, and keyboard) can be plugged into it and, in turn, I use it in the USB port of my computer. I just got it a few weeks ago and I'm very happy.. I haven't used the camera feature. this is the best hub I've had so far, and I've had quite a few over the years. I probably will get one for my office computer as well.

CommentsTitle: Didn't work in my car stereo
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2014
CommentsContent: It is probably a good Hub, but it didn't work for what I wanted to use it for.I bought it to plug into my USB port on my car stereo (JVC KW-NSX600) and the stereo won't recognize any device that is plugged into this 4 port hub. I tested it many ways, from multiple USB iPhone cables to USB sticks to one single cable nothing was recognized when plugged into the Hub. I was so bummed. JVC displays "device not recognized" on the screen. I thought this would totally work since it's not powered. It's probably not Sabrent's fault and I still don't understand why it won't work. CommentsTitle: Best USB 2.x hub I've ever used
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I use a 21" iMac for retouching. Because all of the ports are in the back of the monitor it is difficult to transfer images from cameras, thumb drives, and the like. Each port on the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub has its own dedicated power switch and blue LED power indicator. This speeds up the process of juggling different devices as I can turn off the port after ejecting without having to physically pull out the USB connector. The USB protocol implementation works equally well on the iMac, a MacBook Air, and a Windows 10 laptop. The construction quality is excellent. This is a great USB hub.

Basically, it will charge one thing at a time OK without hissing. But if you try to have more than one thing plugged in, it will hiss. It will also create a nasty background hiss while a Bluetooth speaker is plugged in. I lived with it for two years but I'm on here now trying to find something better b/c the hissing is driving me insane.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2018
CommentsContent: Does what it should, and gives me 4 USB 2.0 ports. The ports are a bit tight, and it's a little hard to plug things in and pull them out, but I'd rather have that than things falling out during a data transfer. I like that you can connect a device, but that it won't activate until you push the button to turn it on, because it makes it very easy to connect and disconnect devices on demand. The ports are a little close together, so some USB devices may be too fat, but it seems to work for most things.The plug you connect to your computer seems to be recognized by your computer as a fifth USB device, but I'm not sure what it's supposed to do for you. It was recognized and successfully installed in both of my computers, and I was able to use all 4 ports with no problems.I was able to plug in a wireless USB mouse, as well as a USB powered hard drive, both at the same time with no trouble.My only complaint might be that the ports are a bit close. If they could put some more space between them, or stagger then on either side of the device, it would be perfect.

CommentsTitle: it sits on my desk and is so light it slides back and forth a little too easily. None of these things factor into my four ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2016
CommentsContent: Exactly as advertised, nothing more.  I found the cord to be a little short for my purposes and had to tether it to a USB extender.  The cord length is specified in the item description, at about four inches.  I thought that might be long enough to plug into the back of my monitor and sit on the desk--but it's not.  As such, it sits on my desk and is so light it slides back and forth a little too easily.  None of these things factor into my four star rating, however, as they are clearly specified in the description.  However, I found that it is sometimes difficult to tell whether the push button toggle is off or on, as the lights from adjacent switches illuminate part of the indicator on powered-off switches.  It is functioning well though, and is reliable.  You might just have to look a little closely at the toggles to know whether there is power going to individual USB ports.

CommentsTitle: Very nice HD camera.  Use it with teleconference sessions with great success
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Teleconference sessions.  With the advent of COVID19 it is vital to have a camera that performs well.  I use it with my sons virtual learning, Business meetings with virtual background, or video taping education sessions for posting on internet.  As good as some of the very expensive products out there.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2016
CommentsContent: I needed this to use with my older laptop. 2 out of 3 of the usb ports had stopped working so my only option was to purchase a usb hub and connect it to the 1 remaining usb port. Needless to say this did the job well. Was definitely a good buy. It actually still works perfectly also, however I haven't been regularly using it as of late since the laptop I bought this for stopped working due to a different issue several months ago. Aside from that I have just been keeping this device in a draw for when the day comes that I need more usb ports than I have.

CommentsTitle: Simple basic little USB hub that works!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2018
CommentsContent: I needed a hub for my Tesla Model 3. The dashcam feature was added to a recent update to the system, but requires a front USB port. As both ports were being used for charging phones, I did not have a front port available for a thumb drive to record dash cam video. This small simple USB hub did the trick! I was able to plug in and utilize the thumb drive, as well as simultaneously recording dash cam videos. I highly recommend this hub for usability and portability.

CommentsTitle: Like the ability to disable individual ports on this device.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2020
CommentsContent: Quite happy with the quality of this and all Sabrent items I own. All Sabrent equipment I have bought, are of very good quality, and I have never experienced an issue with their operation.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Works. Hooked up a printer and mouse to a tablet with the USB port. This makes it so you can run several things through the one USB port.

CommentsTitle: I like this 4 port hub and the individual switches
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2016
CommentsContent: My hub stopped working but it was very old.  So I started searching for a replacement.  I like this 4 port hub and the individual switches.  I can keep my printer plugged but turn it off if I want.  I also have a flash drive I keep in but can also turn it off when I desire.  It is a nice size and doesn't take up much space on my desk.  When the pretty blue light is on that means it is in the on position, and the light goes off when I press the button to turn off what is connected to that particular port.  I would recommend this product, very nice.

CommentsTitle: NOT iOS Compatible OK for Android
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2019
CommentsContent: Will NOT Charge my iPhone 6. This was my reason for buying it. Unfortunately, the seller did not indicate if it would charge phones. It only mentioned it's data capabilities. Am keeping it for its other abilities. At least it powers my Android and other small toys.It would have been EXCELLENT if it could power my iPhone 6.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2019
CommentsContent: I liked this usb hub so much, wish it was longer though. It’s about 2-3 inches long in cable length overall around 5-6” but still works okay for its purpose. I needed a hub that worked for my PlayStation classic, I had a 3.0 usb hub but they were all 3.0 ports and would not work on the PlayStation classic, not sure if it was the brand or the fact that it wasn’t 2.0 so this works great for the purpose of playing games through retroarch. Does not work for playing other emulators through multiplayer though only works on ps1 games strictly for that. Still a great buy I can have up to 4 players with this usb hub, if you use after market usb controllers it works even better without having to shave bits off the usb on the classic controllers to get them all to fit properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this for my work laptop since it only had 2 ports and one was occupied by a mouse. I use it for my thumb drive and a little fan and it's awesome. I love that if I close the computer it turns them off and it only on when the laptop is on. I also love that you can turn specific ports on and off at will. Very happy with my purchase!!!

CommentsTitle: Wish it would charge my devices
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I have Alexa, fire tablet and my phone charger. This Hub works But will not charge my tablet and phone  or what I mean is it will not start the extra charging. Example if my phone battery is at 23% and I plug it into this hub it will stay at 23%. And I have try changing to each different out port.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This product far exceeded my expectations.  I have all 4 hubs filled. I just click on one, it lights up and comes on the computer. Nice product for home use for my many flash drives.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this product I am still using it now. This product solve problems of having only a few functioning usb port on your computer, whether due to old system or due to big tech company limiting usb ports to exploit their customers. The hub comes with 4 available ports. I love that you can toggle each port on and off, giving you control of what device you want to connect or disconnect to the hub and the computer. The usb draws power from your computer so based on my experience, it works better when connected to USB 2.0 or 3.0 ports. I am satisfied with this product.

CommentsTitle: stopped working after only two months
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2020
CommentsContent: With light use, this USB hub has all of a sudden stopped working. Whenever it's connected now, it will connect and disconnect every two seconds, so whatever devices I have plugged in do not function as intended. The USB hub I bought at Staples years ago still works and is much more reliant than this waste of money. I would return it if I could.

CommentsTitle: Good product, works just as needed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2020
CommentsContent: This was smaller than I expected but that was a plus, very compact design that still does the job.  I usually don't like lighted buttons since they are usually just for silly decoration but these lighted buttons really do serve a purpose if the switch is in the shadows under your desk.  The buttons clearly show which port is active.It was a little difficult to insert and remove a USB from the ports, but since I'm not going to be pulling them out to switch them (the whole reason to get this) that shouldn't be an issue.  Delivered prompted and in good condition from seller.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2014
CommentsContent: This Sabrent 4-port USB works great!I bought this along with some (Gold Plated Hi-Speed USB 2.0 Type A to Micro-B Cable 6 Feet - (cable not from this seller)Got it for my son to use with his xbox controllers! This allows him to keep all the controllers plugged in via the USB port on the xbox while playing games, this way it eliminates all the extra money we would have to spend in buying batteries ;) this is good because boy oh boy those controller really eats batteries!!!My son loves the idea of being able to turn on or off each of the four ports.Great product for such a small price! I would buy from this seller again! I recommend.Thanks

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I like the hub, I purchased the USB 2.0 Hub and I am able to plug in all my USB flash keys to read. I would have given it a higher to 4 stars but durability cannot be determined since I just got it and it is a plastic hub. So it seems good but only time will tell. I am confused on the side it looks as if it can take DC power but then again it could be a metal prong design to hold the case in place? If it takes DC what is the voltage it can safely take?

CommentsTitle: More flexibility to use auxiliary devices
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I have now purchased two of these. I use a two laptop (or actually a notebook and laptop) setup with an external monitor and an external webcam and microphones (Zoom and online teaching stuff). These USB hubs have given me more flexibility in how I set things up and allow me to attach and detach devices. My notebook only has one USB port, so this really helps. Inexpensive and working well for me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2016
CommentsContent: This USB Hub works well with my Mac and sits perfectly on my desk.  It does not interfere with the speed of data transfer at all and its ability to power on and off each slot works perfectly.  That feature actually makes it a lot easier to organize my desktop and deactivate USB's I'm not using yet.  I use a single command strip to hold it on my desk which holds it perfectly however pressing on it, the plastic feels pretty flimsy, so I don't think it can take much of a beating and the cord is a little short but it works well for my purposes of both charging devices and transferring data in mass.

CommentsTitle: I got this  Aug 2016, I'm writing this Feb 2021.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2021
CommentsContent: I use this for everything that has a USB. This works with my canon printer, my Logitech headset and gaming keyboard, my external hard drive, all my flash drives, my fans, and my mouse. Totally worth it since one of my USB ports broke and I only have 2 others. I'm about to buy another one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020
CommentsContent: My computer only came with two USB plug ins.  I ordered this Hub and the cord length is perfect to keep right by my computer.  I would recommend this especially with this great price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: Pues compre este hub porque necesitaba un par de puertos adicionales en mi estudio casero de grabación, les seré sincero el diseño y la estética con los led brillantes le dan un toque de elegancia, pero siento que la calidad del material el cuales plástico es un poco baja, siento que en cualquier momento se puede romper, cada vez que presiono los botones para apagar o encender uno de los puertos siento que algo truena ligeramente, el cable se siente un poco barato también; pero es una opción por si necesitas un hub y n tienes mucho dinero.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Needed to add 1 to 2 more USB devices to my laptop than I had ports.  This hub does the job and I like how it has a power switch for each connection as I do not always need one of the devices, so I can just switch it off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2014
CommentsContent: The ability to turn off individual USB ports is handy if you have more than one power-hungry accessory to plug-in. As long as all aren't in use at the same time, they can all stay connected and ready to use w/o having to disconnect one or more so there's enough power available (i.e webcam, portable drive, etc.)The on/off buttons are on top, and the cord is on the left side. If the cord were in back, it would be a little more flexible in placement on cluttered desks. An input port instead of a mounted cable would also provide more flexibility in situations like having the CPU tower under the desk and keeping the hub close at hand on the desktop.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2015
CommentsContent: I am quite surprised at this Sabrent USB hub. I have always considered Sabrent as one of the best manufacturers of hubs and such, I never experienced any connection or  recognization problems. However, I bought this 4 port hub, and when I plugged it into my notebook computer, the entire computer became unresponsive. So, I tried it on a nother PC that I own, and I got the same results. Since this hub came from a third party seller on Amazon, and he asked to be contacted directly on the Amazon returns page, I did so, and he promptly replaced the hub for me. There was evidently an issue with the first hub, because so far, the second one has been working just fine. I like the individual switches for each port, because it allows for the easy removal or exchange of a device. I recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2020
CommentsContent: My $1,500 laptop only has one USB port /: so, I could not use my USB powered cooling fans while also using my USB game controller; this was a great option. I like that you can individually turn off/on each port. The cord length is a bit awkward, but it's better than having one USB port.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2020
CommentsContent: bought a new laptop and it only had 2 usb ports. this allows me to dock and connect accessories as needed. I can even switch them off on the fly.Great product

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Needed to have more ports available on my iMac, and this works awesome!At age 63 I CAN say Awesome and it's true.  Perfect product and price, I would have paid more.Entire unit is compact, lights up the connected USB connections and done!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been using this for the last 2 days and it's helped me access my flash drives every single time I want to retrieve files and move them to my embroidery machine.  Simple to use, and hopefully it will allow my machine to not wear out the port anymore.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This little hub is awesome. My wife bought one first and recommended it to me, so now we both have one. I love having the individual push buttons, as I keep three charging cords plugged in all the time for my phone, smartwatch and Bluetooth headset. I hate wasting power when I don't need them on, so that's quite a handy feature. And it seems the hub has no problem passing plenty of power to the individual ports via USB3, though I've only had to use two of my charge cords at once so far.For the fourth port, I've used an SD card reader and my two-factor authentication dongle. I actually ended up moving the card reader to a port on my laptop dock because the SD card sticks out the side and interferes with the other cables. I think that's my only gripe, and it's a pretty minor one that not everyone will run into. Having my 2FA dongle in the fourth port is pretty nice so I can turn it off when not needed, eliminating the potential for some malicious code to give hackers access to my accounts somehow with the dongle sitting there unattended. (I've never heard of that happening, but I'd rather not risk it!)So yeah...good hub.

CommentsTitle: seeing this made me hope it would be easy for me to figure out and use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2017
CommentsContent: It seems every item I buy needing a USB port to charge or connect and my laptop only having 2 ports, seeing this made me hope it would be easy for me to figure out and use. I literally took it out of the box, plugged it into my laptop, plugged in my USB cable from my desk fan into it and pressed the button and it was on and running. I had every port filled in a few seconds with a solid connection. My iPhone charged up with ease also and allowed for data connectivity as well. Great little gadget that was so easy to use and compact enough it takes up no room on my desk.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the 3rd purchase of this product I have made in the last 2 years. They all work great. Will continue to buy the Sabrent 4-Port USB as needed. It would be great if the cord was longer. I don’t use them in conjunction with a camera, mostly for charging and connecting small portable USB lights. Highly recommended, can’t beat the price either for a quality product.

CommentsTitle: Works great with older Raspberry Pi
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I have an older Raspberry Pi with only two USB ports and no built-in WiFi. I needed this USB hub so I could use one USB port for a corded keyboard + corded mouse while leaving the other USB port for a WiFi dongle. This configuration works perfectly and I didn't notice any power problems due to overloading a USB port. I'm sure that adding a hard disk drive would require a powered USB hub, but for less demanding devices this was the perfect solution at a very reasonable price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020
CommentsContent: It works well, but only used it for two devices, I’m not yet sure if it can handle 4 without a problem. I like that I can turn off the connection to the attached devices individually. The cord is long enough it to rest on the table. It is light. So far so good.

CommentsTitle: It works, but not for long
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 4, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a nifty little thing in that you can control each port individually. The LEDs behind said buttons give off a glow, but at a certain angle, it pokes past the translucent plastic and straight into your eyes. At night, the glow gives off significant blue light, making it difficult to sleep. After about three months of use, the device stopped working. It still delivers power and I can still toggle the switches, but data will not transfer and my computer will not recognize anything I plug in.

CommentsTitle: Love the on/off buttons - works perfectly!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I currently have my headset, my keyboard, and my mouse hooked up using this USB hub and I LOVE it. The buttons to turn on and off each port have been super handy for when I want sound to toggle between my speakers and my headphones without needing to unplug anything. I didn't expect to like this product so much, but it has been an unexpected blessing. Works like a charm.

CommentsTitle: It allows me to have up to four flash drives connected and ready to turn on at a moment’s notice.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub because my laptop only has two ports and I need to use one for my USB wireless mouse. (I do not like using the touch pad.) Since I have had past experiences with computer crashes and lost data, I store all my “stuff” (documents, photos, videos, etc.) on USB flash drives. If I wanted to transfer info from one drive to another I either had to copy to my desktop and then to the other drive or disconnect my wireless mouse. While I am satisfied with this product, bit it does have both Pros and Cons that I will list here:Pros:• I can keep up to four flash drives connected to the hub without having to remove them once I’m done. Each port has an on/off button allowing me to only turn on the drives I’m using.• The hub is small and light weight and each port has a blue LED indicator light to let you know which port is in use.Cons:• The cord is only about 9” long, so the hub will dangle if the desk area isn’t wide enough.• The ports are very close together and it is impossible to plug USB flash drives side by side. I use only SanDisk flash drives, but other brands may be narrower and fit better. My solution was to use USB extension cables. Their plugs are narrow enough to fit between the flash drives.For me, the Pros out weigh the Cons. It allows me the convenience to have up to four flash drives connected and ready to turn on and use at a moment’s notice. I give it 4 stars.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 4, 2020
CommentsContent: It simply doesn't work. I tried plugging it differently. Every device (e.g. flashdrive) I attach doesn't work, while I can attach it to an old multi port and it works with no problem.I dumped it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2019
CommentsContent: The Laptop had only 2 port and I needed a extra port or two. Works good on the older module. I order a USB 3.0 from the same company when upgraded to a new laptop. Excellent build and works good I had no problem with either.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2018
CommentsContent: A life-saver!  My work laptop has only two USB ports. One is hidden, so I thought it had only one USB port when I bought this hug.  I wanted to plug in a keyboard and mouse.  Plus I need to use a usb encryption key, and sometimes plug my phone in for charging.  This handy little gadget handles all of that.  I recently bought an external cd drive, and that will not work through this hub; it needs to be plugged in directly to a port. I'm glad I'd found the hidden port for that.  So be forewarned that not EVERYthing will work through it, but so far the cd drive is the only thing I've found that doesn't.  In fact, the encryption key vendor had suggested that the key would not work through it, but it does.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: My laptop comes with only 2 USB ports. I have a monitor, a keyboard, a mouse, a printer all need to be wired for company security purposes. Plus you can charge your phone and other apparatus.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I really like this USB hub. I bought it mainly because my MacBook air only has two USB ports and I wanted to connect my new mouse and keyboard and still have ports for connecting USB drives, etc. I really like that you can turn each port on and off! This way I can leave things connected even if I don't want them active. Highly recommend this hub!

CommentsTitle: Great device.  Solved multiple problems for me.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2016
CommentsContent: I originally bought this for my main laptop so I would not have to unplug the USB every time I wanted to transfer pictures from my camera.  I have a wireless mouse plugged in as well as a remote keyboard.  I also have a external hard drive that I use for backup that I do not want to have plugged in unless I am doing a backup or retrieving something.  The switches of this hub are perfect for this.  I can just push the button.  This hub worked so well I bought another one to use on an old laptop that I am using to teach me how to play the piano.  The old laptop only had one working USB port.  With this hub I can connect the piano keyboard and a mouse.  I highly recommend this device.

CommentsTitle: Don’t work - piece of crap - waste of $
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I wish I would have tried it out when it arrived few weeks ago. I needed to use it today for first time and it’s broke .. don’t charge nothing! And I can’t return it anymore ... 6 days too late! Don”t buy piece of crap- don’t works!

CommentsTitle: cord is a little shorter than I anticipated
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I didn't read the size, but I underestimated the proportions.  It works perfectly well, just the cord is too short so it kind of hangs from the back of my monitor.  I was hoping it would lay flat on the desktop.  Still gets the job done.

CommentsTitle: Love finally having extra USB ports
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2015
CommentsContent: I purchased this product to use with a laptop, the laptop only has 2 USB ports, and when some of the keys stopped working, I hooked up a desktop keyboard to it, and I use a USB mouse on it, so that took my 2 spots up. I'd have to unplug the mouse to plug in the USB charger for my phone, or camera, and that was just getting annoying. I didn't want to spend a ton of money on a USB huh, when I came across this one I read the reviews, some were good some where bad. But I went with it anyway, I figured for the price, it wouldn't break my bank to give it a try for myself.I'm very happy I chose this product, Yes it has a short cord, but that is not a problem if its used on a laptop, OR the front area of most towers, I also like that it has individual on/off buttons for each USB slot, so that way If I have my Phone docking station in one, and my USB cord for my camera in one, but am not using those atm just keeping them plugged in (so I don't misplace them) I can shut those 2 sources off and only keep the ones I am using turned on.I will be recommending this product to family and friends who are in need of extra USB ports. It's made nicely, it doesn't feel cheap or flimsy , which I did expect it would for the price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Works perfect. Working from home and needed extra usb ports for laptop! Really helped!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2020
CommentsContent: The product does what it says it'll do mostly. I use it to connect peripherals and not to charge so I can't attest to charging speed. Cord length is short but I just taped it to the top of my desktop. I had the product for roughly 2 years and like another review mentioned, I kept getting the disconnect and reconnect sound. The hub would randomly stop working and then after a few seconds would work again. I contacted Sabrent directly and they sent me a new unit even though my warranty expired. A slight caveat is they sent me the USB 2.0 version instead of the 3.0 version that I purchased. Overall, for the price it isn't horrible, thought next time, I'll probably go with a different hub from Sabrent.

CommentsTitle: be careful, it messed up USB connection on my laptop
