CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I plugged in this port to laptop, and plugged in the USB for mouse and USB-operated small fan at the same time. Both worked fine for about 10 min, then mouse stopped working. Switch were on for both. Fan was still running. After checking all possible causes of mouse not functioning, I had to restart everything for the mouse to come back to life. Not using this port anymore.

CommentsTitle: It works in good condition. When I connect my keyboard and mouse ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2016
CommentsContent: My one is USB2.0 version. It works in good condition. When I connect my keyboard and mouse to the hub at the same time, they work well and there is no interference between each other. Switch is a good design.Good for USB devices that do not need lots of data transport or power consumption.But I don't know if it works for recharging of smartphone or tablet. I dare not to try charging four QC2.0 devices at the same time with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2013
CommentsContent: I used this product with an OUYA gaming console to expand the number of usable usb ports from one to four. I read on forums that A powered hub would more likely work, but since there were at least a few people who had success with non-powered hubs I decided to take a chance and it looks to have paid off. I can now use mouse and a portable 2.5' HDD simultaneously on my OUYA and I've got two extra ports I can use for other peripherals later down the road.It's worth noting that I had to use a Y usb cable to get the portable HDD to work because apparently the hub didn't supply enough power. After I plugged the cable into the hub and the OUYA I had to plug the extra connector on the double end of thy Y cable to my desktop via a USB extension cable. No big deal. The mouse worked fine without any adjustments. Just plug and play.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent: The Sabrent 4-port USB is perfect. I am able to turn on/off any of my devices plugged into one of the ports at the push of a button. The buttons are easy to see if they are hidden in the dark because they are lighted.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Working from home has presented challenges and this little gadget was exactly what I needed. Super handy to be able to turn the ports off or on individually.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2017
CommentsContent: No matter what USB slot I plugged this into it made my headphones have this horrible feedback in them. It also caused my other hardware plugged into USB spots to not show up as connected and whenever I pressed the buttons on the device to disable that USB slot or activate it it would cause my screen to flicker and weird sounds to be made in my headset.I'm not even maxed out on USB slots on my computer, I just wanted this so I could shut off certain USB plugged in devices that have lights on them at night since I sleep in the same room as my computer is located. My computer is a decently new high end computer that I use everyday for streaming top end video games just fine and I plugged it into my wife computer that had the same headset feedback problems and button pressing problems. These things happened regardless of how many devices were plugged into it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 21, 2020
CommentsContent: My laptop only have one usb port. I bought this macgafter and it works great. I’m still not sure why I want to switch the usb port off on the macgafter but the blue light is nice. I’m glad I got it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2021
CommentsContent: Works great!Needed more usb openings for all my cords (laptop only had one). This gadget works great. Thank you!

CommentsTitle: A very handy little gadget.  Very small with very short cord.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2016
CommentsContent: This neat little gadget lets me expand my USB ports in the front of my machine and very neatly lets you turn on only the ports you need with a blue LED to tell you which ones you turned on.  It seemed to take quite a while for Windows to recognize what it was and load appropriate drivers for it.  There must be some functions the operating system does not like about it, because it messed up an update the first time and corrected the problem when I turned off all of its ports and did the update again.  Weird, but no show stopper.  I like the functionality and presentation.

CommentsTitle: It works... but the buttons annoy me, maybe you, or not.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2020
CommentsContent: It works well. It is a hub and hard to eff up, I suppose. The buttons are useful to cut power to a device you are not using, and being a passive hub can solve problems, but I ended up finding them annoying as they are so easy to toggle I do it every time I handle the thing. I wish I had gone without the buttons. IMO. YMMV.

CommentsTitle: Great for USB 2.0 on Vista and added switches
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I needed additional ports with switches for my old Vista OS lab computer and these work great. I wish they had a 7 or 10 port version but I added a second 4-port and both seem to work fine. The buttons can be sticky when depressing on/off but not a big deal. The main USB lead to the PC is VERY short (6" or so), but that worked fine for me. I've tried a few other switchable USB hubs from other manufacturers and the quality was terrible. I recommend these from Sabrent.

CommentsTitle: this hub works fine. My friend uses it with his smart TV
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2017
CommentsContent: I was originally going to give this 4 stars because the lights can't be defeated even if the port is being utilized, but then again, I could've simply bought one that had no lights to begin with. i guess i was just getting fancy with these lighted ones. That said, this hub works fine. My friend uses it with his smart TV. When he plugs micro memory cards via USB adapters in them, his TV recognizes them as USB connection 1, USB connection 2, USB connection 3, etc. Comes in pretty handy if you only have one USB port in the back of your TV but you have several memory cards of movies and music like we do.

CommentsTitle: (I'd hardly call switching to an OS that renders your favorite apps obsolete and/or non-functional an "upgrade
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2015
CommentsContent: After I "upgraded" my MacBook to OS X Yosemite, it wouldn't recognize my Digidesign Mbox 2 audio interface.  (I'd hardly call switching to an OS that renders your favorite apps obsolete and/or non-functional an "upgrade," but that's a different conversation for a different product review.)A few different Avid/Digidesign forums presented viable solutions, including downloading previous audio drivers and/or plugging the Mbox into a USB hub rather than directly into the MacBook's USB port.  I dutifully downloaded a separate driver; the Mbox responded to the Mac but still wouldn't send audio out.  With nothing left to lose and my studio monitors getting lonelier with each day that audio wouldn't pass thru them, I opted to try the USB hub route.A quick search on Amazon turned up the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub.  The price was right, it arrived right on time, and it was the simple solution to what had been a complicated problem for several weeks!I have not used the hub for anything other than connecting my Mbox, so I can't speak to its performance as a multi-connector for external drives, etc.  I can only say that this simple, durable device has been a lifesaver at my particular work station.  If you work with USB devices and the recent "upgrade" to Yosemite has caused trouble for you, a separate USB hub may be a simple and inexpensive solution and the Sabrent 2.0 is perfect.

CommentsTitle: Broke 2 logitech unifying receivers!!! DO NOT BUY
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2016
CommentsContent: I bought this exclusively to use with my logitech unifying receiver and my remote HTPC setup (PC is upstairs and HDMI USB and ethernet run to the living room).  Not only would my receiver not work with this hub, but it stopped working altogether even when i plug it directly into the back of the PC.  Im beyond pissed right now as this is the SECOND receiver that i have gone through with this thing.  Im sure its the hub as each receiver stopped working immediately after trying to get it to work with the hub.  this piece of crap may be alright to charge an iphone or two, but it definitely is garbage when it comes to actual hardware.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I have this plugged into my laptop and use it every day for my wireless mouse, removeable hard drive, thumb drives and a whole host of other USB accessories. It works great and I like the ability to turn on/off ports not in use.

CommentsTitle: Works with one laptop but not the other
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I have two hp laptops - one is far superior to the other. This works for my good one but not my weaker one so I don’t think the issue is the dongle itself. It will charge devices using my weaker laptop, but the computer won’t recognize devices (like my wireless keyboard and my extra monitors) plugged into it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Works exactly as described. So much easier to keep it plugged into the back of the PC and rest the hub on top than constantly having to plug the removable device directly into the PC. each port has its own on/off switch and indicator light. I'll be buying another for my laptopn.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2014
CommentsContent: The feel of the device is a bit flimsy, but it works like a champ. Of course, I considered the lighweight design an advantage while traveling.I bought this to use with my transformer tablet which only has one USB port.  During a trip where I was swapping pics with other travelers, I was constantly swapping out flash drives and portable hard drives with no issue.  I really like the feature of the individual power items for each device.  It means that I can eject in software and power off, without necessarily having to pull the drive immediately from the hub.I was able to put most flash drives side by side, but as we've all seen some flash drives are bulky and they sometimes get in the way of the adjacent port.  The next model could be spaced a bit more, but I tend to put the blame for the problem on the bulky flash drives.I would definitely recommend this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The four USB port work, but they apparently don't generate enough "power" or connection or something... because I can't charge my phone or use my headset for work with these. Not sure why they don't... but that's what I bought it for.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Well mine didn’t work, there was no power to any of the hubs even with the lights on, so I returned. Also the cord length is ridiculously short.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2021
CommentsContent: I use this with XBOX One and PS4. Connect keyboard, mouse, and console remote control to it. It all works as advertised and with no hiccups.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2016
CommentsContent: This product took some getting used to. I originally thought it was broken but what I did not realize is that this product is not "plug and play." I have a surface pro 3 and it only came with one USB port. I use a USB Mouse because it's easier to use and I have my USB with all the stored documents. Not to mention, I also have my back up 1TB hard drive. At any given moment, I may need all three on at the same time. Sometimes I hook up speakers via USB as well. This device not only allows me to have all four plugged in at the same time, but allows me to switch on and off the device I am not using without going through wires and set. I literally set all my devices once and all I have to do is plug in this device instead of several other devices. So, if I am listening to music, I press the switch for USB and USB back up drive to off, leave mouse and speakers on. If I'm working from home, I leave everything but the speakers on. If I'm on skype or havine a virtual meeting for work, everything is on! This device can handle multiple devices without overheating or becoming dysfunctional! Great product!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021
CommentsContent: The first item sent would not work at all unless I used a power cord that did not come with the product, the one they sent me the following day is identical but works perfect and does not need a power cord1

CommentsTitle: How do I  get  the  splitter to work? If you can help, I  would give the splitter  5 stars
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I can't get this product to work for me the way I  wanted.  I am trying to put my Brother MFP on a splitter using the Sabrent 4 port USB. I thought it would work with the on/off switches but it's not.  I already bought a 2 port splitter and that didn't work.  I have tried it with both computers plugged in,  but one off. Then I  tried it with  only 1 cable  plugged in, but only the original  computer prints.  I know the new computer  is compatible with  the printer  because it has printed from that printer before I started buying splitters and cables.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2021
CommentsContent: Love this gadget! For laptops with limited USB ports, this is a must! I ended up getting 2 to be able to have everything at the ready; printer, mouse/keyboard,  speaker/mic, CD/DVD attachment,  flash drives all at the push of a button.  When not using or needed just shut it off (button).

CommentsTitle: My wireless keyboard's and mouse's receivers must be located close-by ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2016
CommentsContent: My wireless keyboard's and mouse's receivers must be located close-by to work reliably.  In addition, the keyboard (Logitech K800) requires power via USB for recharging, and used the third port for this purpose.  Because this Hub is very low, it fits under the computer's display.  The Hub's USB Cable was too short to connect directly to my PC, therefore, I added a 3-foot USB extender cable.  This Hub provides a clean and simple solution and installation for me.  I would certainly buy it again!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 5, 2014
CommentsContent: First off, no idea how these would work with devices that require USB power, what the transfer speeds are, etc.I use this $7 item to connect the receivers for wireless mouse, keyboard, etc.  Small items like that which need to be plugged in all the time.  This way, the wireless keyboard, mouse combo are plugged in to one thing togetehr that I can disconnect and re connect, I dont have to worry about losing the little things whenever I disconnect one, and they aren't eating up all my ports on their own.If you just need a few extra ports, then this is perfect.  Costs almost nothing and what else could solve the above problem for that price?

CommentsTitle: Good quality at a great price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Used as hub to power keyboard and mouse along with camera and seems to be working perfectly. Nice addition when your older computer loses some of its usb ports  or just didnt come with enough. Good quality and great price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2020
CommentsContent: In the world of USBs, I was finding I needed more than the couple USB slots my laptop was providing.  I purchased this one so I could plug in my phone, my watch, and my keyboard.  My keyboard actually behaves better when its FOB is plugged into this product, than directly in to the laptop for some reason.  It can charge all three with no problem.  Another reason why I LOVE this particular one is that you can turn the USB slot on or off depending if you are using it or not.  When your phone is charged and you are busy, you can just hit the button and turn it off and keep working.  Doesn't sound like a big deal but you would be surprised how helpful that is.  A great product for a great price.  I would have paid more.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I misplaced this item and finally found it!  Glad I did, because I replaced a 4-port USB switch that's been acting up.  No longer using the second computer, so I don't need the  switch feature.Connecting my keyboard, wireless mouse and USB microphone with this hub.The short lead, were it longer, could have let me put the hub right where the switch was, here on the computer table.  So the LED feature goes unnoticed.  On the other hand, my cable jungle on the table is now behind the table!

CommentsTitle: Does not charge an iPad. Read tech specs carefully.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2014
CommentsContent: I did not carefully read the tech specs in the detailed product info. This will NOT CHARGE an iPad Mini. Read the tech specs carefully. This is a hub only. I can transfer photo files from my iPhone 4S and Canon SX 50 easily to my Mac Air. No problems there. I have never connected more than two devices through this hub. It is so lightweight that I cannot leave it permanently connected because it flips around and causes problems. If I am careful, I can have my Le Cie Porsche connected and backing up at the same time that this is connected. I will use it to take with me around town, but for my work desk I am going to purchase the http://www.amazon.com/EasyAcc®-Charging-Smartphones-Specially-Included/dp/B00MLVTL88/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_top  Look at the video reviews for that product and read the tech specs and you will see that it is a superior product for daily use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Use it to extend PS4 USB ports. There is an extended storage connected directly to the PS4. This added four more ports to use for a fan/stand, headphones and charging other devices. Each port has a light that lets you know which port is being used and allows you to turn it off. NO MORE PLUGGING IN OR OUT!!!! Also makes it look more organized. 👍

CommentsTitle: Fixes wireless device connectivity issues when you only have USB 3.0+ ports.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I've bought two of these now to fix the same issue that a lot of people experience these days when building a PC - lack of the older USB 2.0 ports on the case itself.  For my personal pc I bought an internal NZXT usb hub so it's out of sight and mind for a cleaner look for my wireless keyboard/mouse but i like using this for others that I build computers for as they don't want to have to open the case and would have no idea how to even unattach something from a board.  This little device is perfect for slapping a piece of velcro on the back and just plugging it into one of the USB 3.0+ ports available on the back of your PC thus changing it into a 2.0 and allowing you to plug in those little wireless adapaters for your keyboard, mouse etc.  So if you're frustrated from your wireless keyboard/mouse seemingly not working correctly, do yourself a favor and pick up one of these (it HAS to be the USB 2.0...they do make an identical looking 3.0) some velcro tape and just slap this puppy on the back of your pc out of sight and problem SOLVED.  Cheap and effective solution!  When's the last time anyone could say that?

CommentsTitle: Works well with Logic and other Music programs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2015
CommentsContent: This very little usb hub works great! I saw some reviews of what must have been defective ones, which I guess is a possibility with these, but mine has worked very well, and I thought I would write a review (since I couldn't find one before) that mentions how this little guy works as far as music and a Mac goes. The answer is very very well. No latency what so ever with my Mac Mini and Nanokey2, or my other types of midi inputs/controllers. It is very simple and the power buttons are very cool for turning on and off keyboards without having to unplug them every time your done using and don't want to shut your computer down. These things are awesome and I'm gonna order three more.

CommentsTitle: Good little non-powered switched USB hub
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2014
CommentsContent: This hub is perfect basic USB 2.0 connectivity.  IT DOES NOT SUPPLY POWER.It is working perfect for an old USB printer to a MFP Storage Server device.I use it to provide a networked print station for Android and PC.  Works perfect for this scenario.A Modern solution for Old Hardware.IT MAY NOT WORK WITH ALL HARD DRIVES.Not a fault of the device or manufacture, more fault of USB 2.0 in general and this era of electronics.Remember USB 3.0 is backwards compatible with 2.0.  So if you need power, get a newer hub for that.Those have 5 amp POWERED connections you need for External Drives because they are designed for modern devices.This hub was designed before those drives were ever invented!  Of course it may not work with newer USB devices.I needed a tiny inconspicuous USB 2.0 hub with exactly 4 ports and this is PERFECT for that.  The switches were nice bonus.Consider your options before you buy anything always.Cheap, Chinese made, but well constructed and does the job nicely.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: This goes great with my laptop.  I like that each button can be turned on and off as necessary and it adds a nice amount of usb plugins to my laptop which only has three.  It works great and the blue LED's match my laptop keyboard although that is completely necessary.  It just looks pretty cool.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2019
CommentsContent: This is exactly what I needed to extend my use of USB peripherals.  The cord length isn't long but adequate for my needs as I like to have the on-off switches close to my laptop anyway.  My only wish is that the length of the item was perhaps one inch longer giving a little more space between the USB ports for ease in installing or removing a USB cord.  I found it easier to leave the cords attached and just remove or switch the items that were charging since most use the same style of cord.  I love the light-up feature on each of the on/off buttons.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this product!!! Multi plug for all our devices. I gave one to each of my boys, two to my husband, I have one my bedroom, office,  kitchen, living room, and home office. I can have multiple devices on one. When people are over, they can charge their phone or portable charger. Great value and product, and highly recommended.

CommentsTitle: Works well and does it's job
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2020
CommentsContent: So far this hub has been great.  I have only had it a week.  So far it is doing its job.  I am not sure if it was the hub or a peripheral device, but it took windows 10 a while to get drivers right.  The mouse and such had been previously installed somit may have been this device.  It worked out in the long run though.I wish the cord were a bit longer and replaceable.  I am hard on cables and foresee having to change the device out when I wear it out, instead of replacing a cable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2020
CommentsContent: For me, it keeps repeatedly shutting off and turning back on. I enjoy it and it works well but doesn't seem to work well. Even typing this out is difficult for me since I connect it to my laptop and my keyboard connects to it. If it is the only mine that has this malfunction I would wonder if there is a way to get a new one since this malfunction has occurred.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2016
CommentsContent: It has been a phenomenal help for me at school-I have a tiny little notebook with 2 USB hubs and connecting my printer, mouse, thumb drive, and other items has been a constant game of "which one can I unplug right now?"It is easy to see which of the hubs are active-the blue light behind the buttons is clear in the fluorescent light and the buttons stay pressed so I know which ones are turned on.  All in all, very good.  My only complaint is that the ports seem a little tight-I had to work to get my printer cable out without pulling it apart.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2021
CommentsContent: Worked fine with all ports in use.  Mic, camera, mouse and backup drive.  Today the port for the mouse (probably the one with the least power draw) failed.  The button would not latch.  In use about two months.  Three stars because it hasn't totally failed.

CommentsTitle: A very good value -- works with all the USB 2.0 devices I have tried so far.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2014
CommentsContent: I really like this hub.  I have two others...one that is a/c powered and one (like this one) that is unpowered.  The Sabrent worked perfectly right out of the box.  Performing flawlessly so far. I also like the push button feature that connects or disconnects any USB drive or other component connected to it.  So far, I have only been using it with USB 2.0 devices, so I do not know how it will do with my one USB 3.0 device, however, I have to assume it will rock, too.  I also liked the immediate and unsolicited follow up from the seller/manufacturer to inquire as to whether or not I am pleased with the unit.  Altogether, a most pleasant buying experience.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I've found this works really well for both charging my devices, using flash drives, and hooking up my wired or wireless mouse, and I've used it for a secondary desk light that works off USB.  Love it for all of them.  Does whatever I ask it to do.  Great at multitasking.  I can use 2 USB devices on the computer and charge 2 devices at the same time and it's as fast or faster than other devices.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2019
CommentsContent: This is nice since so many laptops are taking away all the ports to be lighter which having to buy this defeats the purpose of that but whatever. It works awesome and I love that I can turn off the drive to have it removed from the list of available drives. Wish cord were just a bit longer used at school for transferring data and it dangles a bit.

CommentsTitle: Good device, works well, nice price, needs a longer cable
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2016
CommentsContent: This gizmo is pretty neat. I bought it because my flight stick tends to confuse some games that think I'm using it for a controller. I needed a way to turn off the flight stick so I could use the normal keyboard+mouse. This works like a charm, even going through a KVM, it still has enough power to power my devices and I can turn them off as needed. My only complaint is that the cord is very short. You likely will need to plug into front ports, this thing simply won't reach to the back ports and still be close enough to turn on/off devices.

CommentsTitle: Almost a year, and it basically failed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2018
CommentsContent: I was using this for my wireless mouse/keyboard adapter, bluetooth, and wireless headphones. It ran just fine for the first 10 months with the kb/mouse & headphones, but after introducing my bluetooth adapter, it failed after about 1 month. This could be due to the data stream going to and from my PC for so many devices, which may need more testing. I'm giving this a tentative 3 stars pending more testing, but it definitely helped me for the use case and time that I needed it.

CommentsTitle: Beneficial when limited outlets are a challange. Prevents fast charging adaptors from working as designed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2017
CommentsContent: It's extremely helpful in helping us free up electrical outlets to charge more than two devices. I like that the lights tell me if the particular port is on or not. The price was outstanding!What's keeping me from 5 stars is there was no clarification on the fast charging adaptors. my androids have a fast charging adaptor but when used with this 4-port slows the charging wayyyyyy down. so this was useful for when we have a lot of time, and maybe traveling long distances and need more ports than our vehicle has to offer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this hub as we needed several ports for our machines in addition to the docking stations.  I actually bought two.  I like the fact that the ports have individual power buttons which is different from models from years back.  It is performing exactly as I would expect it to and that is high praise for many tech devices being sold today.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: The product is as expected. Purchased this item to expand my USB ports on my lap top docking station. Works great. the item does what I had hoped but I am more excited about the stellar service Store4PC provides. One week after receiving the product they contacted me asking if I had any questions on the product or anything else. Amazing!! Not many stores do this. Thank you for the wonderful product and the service you are providing. I would recommend this product and this company to others.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 5, 2017
CommentsContent: Wonderfully Good Product. 1) Cheap Pricing under $7.00  2) This 4-Port USB Hub has 4 individual switches with blue lights. Just beautiful.3)  My laptop mouse pad failed its point and click function.  I bought in an external mouse.  This 4-Port Hub serves it right.4)  Here we go.  I have just finished a video talk all the way to San Diego, CA.  Clear picture and sound.  Meaning connection is smooth.In all, purchase recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2019
CommentsContent: I have come to the point where I needed more usb ports.  I've got so many devices hooked up to my computer and didn't even think about buying something like this USB hub.  So, I selected this one.  It was cheaper than the others, but it also had on and off buttons for each usb port, which I love!  Its made sturdy, does the job, and I'm extremely happy with my purchase!  YAY!

CommentsTitle: Really good product at a great price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a really good compact USB hub and works for all Neolithic laptops provided by offices which eschew usb C and more ports. Like the ability to switch off any unused port.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I use this with my laptop that only has 1 working USB port. I can now charge my phone, use my mouse, control an arduino, and plug in my external hard drive all at once. I really like the buttons that allow you turn turn off and on the ports. They supply a satisfying click and light up when they're on. I haven't noticed any slower speeds or heating up when using all four ports. It's lightweight and small so it's easy to carry with you to anywhere you use a laptop. If you feel like you don't have enough USB ports and do not want to spend a significant amount of money I would recommend this one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2019
CommentsContent: First day using this and works fabulous. I will update this review if I notice anything in the future. Price is unbelievably low vs. quality for value. I had another component from Sabrent a few years ago and was very impressed with the quality for the very low price and this motivated me to buy their components again this time. This hub component is listed on the official Sabrent site at $13. plus shipping. Product arrived in a retail presentation package and the carton was secured with seals suggesting that it was probably not a used return. The only other feature to speak about are the on/off buttons. The 4 buttons can be used as 1 or all 4 or any combination of on/off 1 thru 4 and that is convenient. Only thing I can point out that does not show up easily in advertisement is that the hub is about the size of a  large pack of 10 stick chewing gum and is lighter in weight than expected so, the lightness of the hub weight will not necessarily allow it to stay lying flat on desk or table without cords flipping it over while using. However, the plugs stay in securely and it will remain connected. One must be alert and observe that moving one of the wires does not cause this hub to turn over and, then,  may press against one of the 4 buttons and turn off whatever one is charging. I combined this hub with the " Sabrent 22AWG USB 2.0 extension cord 6 feet (CB-2060) ". This is available from same Amazon seller as hub. Extension cord allows hub to be behind computer and moves the clutter and chaos of wires out of the way. NOTE: Both of these items are available in an identical  " USB 3.0 " from Sabrent.

CommentsTitle: Only one port works on my device.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: Cord length is very short.I am returning for a replacement because only one of the ports works on my device. Hopefully the replacement will function properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I really like the ability to turn off ports that are not needed. Cord could be just a little longer, but I would say the same about most USB hubs. Worth the value.

CommentsTitle: Works exactly the way I needed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this to attach to my laptop. I works perfectly. I can hook up my external mouse, keyboard and monitor when I need them. It only takes one plug to disconnect and make my laptop portable. Love it!

CommentsTitle: Very handy, works well, good value
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2016
CommentsContent: Works great.  Powers my WD 1TB Passport drive and a second drive at once while plugged into my laptop.  Having lighted push-button switches is a bonus too, since I don't always want my portable drives accessible to the local network and can connect/disconnect with the touch of a button.  I use my laptop with the screen out flat and an external monitor, so this is really handy for attaching USB devices without needing to move things around to access the USB port along the back edge of the laptop.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: Needed additional ports at work and this is what I needed.  Would recommend it for anyone and love that you can turn off the ones you do not need.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2020
CommentsContent: It will power multiple devices. What I mean is.... it will do keyboard, mouse and external hard drive no problem. Most do not. I have 2 others that won't. I have also used it with keyboard, mouse and laser printer. It is very convenient to turn each slot on or off as well. Great bang for the buck in my opinion.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this device because my daughter had an artist tablet she needed to hook to the computer. The problem was, one USB was on one side of the computer, and the one was on the other. So the cords she had wouldn't reach. I love this device because now, she can plug up to four things on one side, all nice and neat. PLUS you can turn each one off and on with the touch of a button. They're even lit, so you can tell how many you have plugged in at once. We love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I particularly like the on/off switch for each port, because I use an external had drive as backup via USB.  The switch is an added layer of protection.  Possible improvements: (1) would it cut too much into the profit margin for the included USB cable to be about twice as long? (2) two double-faced adhesive pads to anchor the device, which is very light-weight, might be helpful.  I would definitely buy this product again, even without the above suggestions.Amguez

CommentsTitle: Useful product for laptops with 1 usb ports
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I needed a usb hub because I was trying to jailbreak my iphone but I only had 1 usb port on my laptop and I needed 2 usb ports to fulfill the jailbreak. So i bought this and it worked out well. The on/off switches for individual USB ports comes in handy so you can't go wrong.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Product didn't work and when I contacted the company their wanted it to be shipped back. I explained it would cost way more than the product to ship back from the Caribbean but I was still ignored. Crappy customer service and even more crappy item.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2021
CommentsContent: Even though this is only a 2.0, its' still great and serves its' purpose for my needs. Let me know when U have another device with a 3.0 or Higher. Other than that I really like this device. I can keep up to four(4) devices and when not in use, I can just hit the either of the switches and shut this device off until need again. Great Product for hooking up multiple devices.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2017
CommentsContent: Bought this back in May 2015 and it's honestly worked so nicely. I'm only writing this review now because now 2 ports are dying and 1 died (but only within past 6 months).Given the fact that USB 2.0 ports are ESPECIALLY finicky and can break very suddenly, this has worked like a champ. The lights under the buttons are decently bright, which helps when getting up from desktop at 3am, to stumble into bed (and doing tasks that require focus can be tough tbh).I'm buying a new one now (April 22, 2017) and going to choose this brand (most likely USB 3 model though)

CommentsTitle: Liked It So Much I'm Buying Another One
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I don't pretend to be a computer expert or anything, but I'm not sure what most of these negative reviews are talking about? "Doesn't work with any of my devices or accessories". Really, because I plugged in my mouse, my keyboard & my monitor and they all work just fine? "It gets too hot". Really, because mine sits right on top of my tower and has never once become hotter than room temperature? Don't let the low price fool you because it works fine for the needs of 98% of us who use a computer everyday. Thanks to this hub the entire back of my computer tower is wide open and I feel I've alleviated a lot of the clutter. I recommend it.

CommentsTitle: No more fumbling around trying to figure out what I can unplug!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this because with my camera and ring light, I don't have enough ports for when I want to download pictures, etc.  It's very nice that you can turn off the ports that you don't need as well. The cord length is perfect for me (not terribly long, but all my cords were already reaching past that to the ports already).

CommentsTitle: Worth it if you need more ports!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I am glad that I purchased this product! I will likely get more. It's nice to be able to press a button to turn off one of the ports (not sure why it's necessary but the longer I own the product I might be able to provide an answer).Haven't experienced any noticable latency (yet).The registration process is simple!

CommentsTitle: Used to be a great product. Now?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2019
CommentsContent: I have purchased more than ten of these little hubs over the years and loved them. They have been my go to hub for a number of needs. But I just bought a new one and was sorely disappointed when I opened the box. They used to have a high quality cable with a thick, robust housing sleeve...close to  1/4" thick. This new one is barely an 1/8" and very flimsy. I don't think it will last long at all. I don't think it is durable enough for travel purposes. So sad to see another company ruin a perfectly good product to save a few pennies. I would have rather paid the difference to get a quality product. Now I will have to find another go-to USB hub.

CommentsTitle: It doesn't like it when I plug in my Galaxy S6
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2017
CommentsContent: It doesn't like it when I plug in my Galaxy S6. The computer recognized it and I was able to transfer files and then all of a sudden it starts flashing in the task bar and my netbook starts beeping saying it doesn't recognize the device. Sometimes it works, sometimes not. I have a Dino-Lite microscope, USB flash drive, and an external hard drive connected (not all on at the same time). I was able to successfully run a backup last night to the external drive. It seems to be okay when I connect the cellphone but once I wake the screen, then I start having problems.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2016
CommentsContent: It is a charger and it works so you wonder what else can be said.  However, there are two things that makes this item stand out.  First, each port has a switch to turn in on/off.  So every port does not have to be drawing power when you have only one device plugged in.  Second, the company very generously offered me an extension cord at no charge after I had purchased the charger.  The cord that plugs into the wall is quit short so you have to be selective with which outlet you use.  I got a message a few days after the item was delivered offering me a free extension.  The cord adds flexibility to the charging device.

CommentsTitle: The USB 2.0 Hub you were looking for. Excellent hub.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2013
CommentsContent: You will be quite pleased with your purchase of this USB hub.  I love it, it's a nice, minimal, clean design, with just the right length of main USB cable attachment.  By far my favorite feature are the toggle buttons above each USB port, that toggle power to the ports, and is indicated by a subtle blue LED light (unlike so many others (Bluetooth devices looking at you) that become an annoyance)Overall a great four port 2.0 hub.  I have one for my game consoles (PS4/XO) and another connected to a USB extension cable to a USB -> to AC Power adapter so I can charge devices without being hinged to a PC.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2018
CommentsContent: I ordered this so I can plug in my printer, scanner, mouse and keyboard that I like to use with my laptop. I have a work laptop and personal laptop and I wanted to be able to switch in between without having to unplug everything. This is very handy because now everything is plugged into the hub and I just unplug the hub and plug it into the other laptop. I also like that there are individual power switches for each usb port. Great deal!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I just started working a remote job and had trouble connecting to the internet through a hotspot and had to teether connection through my phone. It's a problem when you have a headset and mouse with only 2 ports and you need to connect a phone. A quick Google search told me to get a USB port and I looked for something affordable and looked like it would suit my needs based on the pictures as I'm not good with extra tech items. Quick and painless to use and it was delivered the same day. Everything works perfectly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2014
CommentsContent: it looks really cool, not built terrible, but the mechanism inside is loose... still works fine, still great product, but because of the loose mechanism, it can be difficult to press the buttons because in certian positions they dont go in all the way. not a problem for me with how i have it set up, but i could see it being a hastle for someone else...Caution!  do not plug in anything that is volatile in maintaining a specific voltage :  using this to plug in an external hard drive can damage the disk. using it for paripheral devices like webcams, mice, keyboards, or usb printers will probably have no issues, but it can damage your external HD.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2020
CommentsContent: This item was shipped quickly. Plug and play.  Fixed all my compatibility issues in about five seconds.  Fabulous!!! It's very lightweight.  Not sure about durability, but for this low price unless it only lasts a month or so, it's well worth it.  Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I read too many reviews which could poison you on every one of these types of hubs which are for sale.  But sooner or later, you have to buy something.  My new Mac has only 2 USB 3.0 slots (the rest are all Thunderbolt), but my Nikon cameras use USB as does my i-phone charger and camera for my computer.  All the ports work although I have not used them for hard drives as they consume more power and I don't know that this can take more than one power hungry devices. It worked and that is what is important.  Price was fair.

CommentsTitle: This little USB hub works okay, it works with ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2018
CommentsContent: This little USB hub works okay, it works with my keyboard, my mouse, and my USB thumbdrive but will not allow my portable Harddrive to connect.  I have tried in all 4 ports and it will not come up.  Anytime you plug something new into the hub, it seems to power cycle the rest of the devices connected which is annyoing if you have a USB stick connected.  Also the Cord itself is a little short so I had to purchase a USB extender.

CommentsTitle: 4 ports, 5 stars. USB hub with blue lights!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   This 4 port USB charger is compact and easy to use. The buttons all worked, turning on and off the ports. The blue led lights turn on for each port as it's used. Arrived on time and as described.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2016
CommentsContent: This is the first time I have to give a negative review.  It worked well in the beginning but now not even a month later it has begun to malfunction,  I use it plugged into my smart TV to control a mini wireless keyboard and also to host my USB to watch downloaded shows.  It will work for 5 minutes if I am lucky then the TV will indicate that my devices are not connected.  I decided to try it on my laptop only to be informed that the device has malfunctioned.  Good thing I did not discard my previous USB Port Hub.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I would have to say that this product is decentt. It connects very easily and runs smoothly. I would have to say that it is very useful and responsive. It has a couple of flaws.One of those flaws is when I went to plug it on for the first time it would unplug and plug back in. I finally got the dricer to install after restarting the computer a couple times. By the way it has not done it sense then.Another flaw is that it does not come with the power cable for the DC charger which I jonestly did not even realize was there until I fiddled around with it for a while.I got that plugged in and realized rhat you can use it as a charger when its plugged in like that. The lights already quit emulating all the way. Its just halfway around the buttons.Other than that I would have to say worth what you are paying for it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I love that I can put 4 items into this port. You can also control which port you want on. Because each outlet has a power button that lights up blue when on. The only dislike is the cord is to short but nothing a USB extension didn’t correct. It’s a great device.

CommentsTitle: Have had trouble with it not working on my iMac
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2014
CommentsContent: I've got an iMac and had some trouble getting this to work. It seems like it draws too much power for it to actually function and my iMac turns off that USB.UPDATED (2/25/14): Within 24 hrs of writing the review on this product, Sabrent contacted me and offered me a replacement. I just received it and it's working great. I'm so glad because it's a nice looking hub (gosh that's girly of me) and my iMac was sorely in need of more USB ports. Right now I'm charging my iPhone through one of the ports. I'm very pleased with the customer service. It'd be nice if the cord was just a tiny bit longer, but that's my only complaint. Love the blue lights.

CommentsTitle: Allows use of multiple input/output devices - not just for charging
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this equipment to use on my work laptop so that I could plug in a full sized keyboard and a trackball.  The laptop has only two USB ports and the second port is being used for a USB headset to take calls and participate remotely in meetings.  For the purpose I intended, the device works great.  It is low profile, unobtrusive and does the job more than adequately.  I am very happy with it and it is well worth the cost which was very reasonable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Garbage, plugged in, OS does not recognize it at all, tried all ports and nothing, attempted to plug wireless mouse, didn’t recognize that at all. Complete garbage. Left plugged, and restarted pc, to see if that worked, still didn’t.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2014
CommentsContent: I purchased a Surface Pro this past January and as we all know.... THERE'S ONLY ONE USB!!!!When purchasing the Surface I told myself that the 1 USB would not be a problem... I'm not sure who I was kidding? I love gadgets and most of my gadgets revolve around the computer.*** THIS WAS THE SOLVE ALL FOR ME ***So many hubs require additional power to support various hard drives or even an iPhone. This bad boy just makes my day. It is able to support an iPhone and numerous other usb devices without the use of an external power supply (I know... draining my battery like crazy). Also, let's stop and think for a moment about the ability of the buttons on top. I can eject my devices (Those of you who do not eject your thumb drives should hang your heads now!!) and leave them plugged in until I'm ready to pack up. Better yet, the buttons allow me to control my connection to other peripheral devices without even unplugging them.This Gadget gets ***** 5 Star APPROVAL  ( yes FULL GADGET APPROVAL) Stop here... take a look... consider the applications it can be used in... I doubt that you'll regret it. (Travelers especially)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2016
CommentsContent: I purchased this product to re-position some wireless receivers for my gaming mouse, keyboard, and controller (all Logitech). I think I was having issues either due to distance, or proximity to USB 3.0 ports, or possibly both.As soon as I moved the receivers to this hub, my problems stopped and I've been able to get my game on without annoyance of input device connection dropping or lagging.All of the ports on the device worked, and the ability to turn on or off certain ports is appreciated.

CommentsTitle: A Clutter Free Desk with the USB Hub
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2017
CommentsContent: I needed a USB hub with switches and this one works great.  I have two USB ports on both side and only one in the back. It makes it cumbersome to use the wireless mouse on one side and looks disheveled with wires on all three sides.  Now I have plugged into the hub my USB powered speakers, scanner, printer, and external hard drive that looks more organized. So far I have the speakers and the hard drive that works well with the switch on. I really like the light indicator indicating what is on and off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2014
CommentsContent: I ordered this for my wife.  She works at the local school as a lunch lady (hair net and all - hands off boys, she's mine ;).  The school district supplied laptop doesn't have enough USB ports for the USB pin pads that the kids use to debit their food purchases from their lunch plans.  This allowed here to install four pin pads which helps kids get through the line faster.  Since it doesn't require an external power supply and it is a simple plug and play it made it east for my non-techy wife to make it work the first time every time.  In other words it does what it says it will do, and it does it well.  She's been using it for nearly 6 months without fault.  Would definitely but it again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Aside from the cord being short at around 4in, I have no major complaints. The lights are very bright blue, keep this in mind if this is in your bedroom as it may disrupt your sleep.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2015
CommentsContent: I have used many usb hubs in the past. All of the ones that were used by me had a external power supply. And they didnt even perform as well as this one. Which did not come with a external power. The only things I needed it for was my mouse, keyboard and wired game controller. My  desktop replacement only has 3 usb ports. However one port is reserved for my bluetooth usb adapter, so I was constantly unplugging things. Because most of the time I am hooked up to a monitor for better resolution, my setup pretty much demands that I use a external usb keyboard. Fed up with unplugging things, I began the hunt for a usb hub again. Past hubs would often disconnect randomly, even when there were few devices plugged in. Once I saw the reviews for this item I decided to give it a try. I was also on a budget, so this one was fairly priced. Having been using it for nearly a week now, I must say this is the best working usb hub I have ever used for my setup. Have not had one disconnect since getting it. It does not come with a power supply, yet I see what appears to be a port for one. All I had to do was plug it in and vola. It also has buttons that activate and deactivate each port on it. Usually I only keep two ports active at all times. Other than whats plugged in, I dont use it for anything else. Because its powered from the computer, I am not going to plug high power devices into it, like usb external hard drives. For things like that I would recommend a good one with a external power. For what I needed it for, its actually really great. I am also running windows 10, and there are no compatibility issues. 5 our of 5 stars.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2019
CommentsContent: Not really the fault of the product I guess but this isn’t what I needed. Was hoping to be able to charge my ecig and play music in my car at same time. My car has one USB. Device won’t allow music to be played so, defeats the purpose of why I got it. Seems to work fine for charging through.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2020
CommentsContent: This is another product that I have purchased that is very convenient. Have you ever thought to yourself: "Man, I wish I had more USB slots where I am able to place a certain amount of devices into one computer?" Well, this item has answered your wish. And whoever just happens to have a MacBook this works even better with this USB type c adapter. Here is what I am talking about: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B015Z7XB30/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1I like how it lights up when you press the button after it has been plugged in. For me, it does not charge your device but I did not purchase this item for it to charge a device such as phones and etc. I got this item specifically for my flash drive and to sync up any data that is on my iPhone. I am glad that it came in clutch, now I know what to use when the time comes for me to store data or do whatever I intend to do. If you feel that you need more USB slots, go for it, the more space you have, the easier it will be for you and it will be more convenient.

CommentsTitle: A good thing in a small package
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2013
CommentsContent: In case you haven't noticed today's laptops have changed. Gone are the fussy, overheating, jumpy cursor, poorly lit, squinty, on-again off-again models of yesteryear. Nowadays, they are not only as portable as ever, but as powerful as all but the top of the line desktops. This capability is possible because of gadgets like the Sabrent USB 2.0 hub. Got a laser mouse? No problem. Need an external hard drive? No problem. How about a chillmat to keep things cool when the gaming gets hot? Well, no problem. You get the idea. Using too much battery life when everythings hooked up? How about individually controlled units that can be switched on or off as needed? It works very well indeed and the best part is that it doesn't take up much space to do it at a very affordable price. Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a nifty little product. I wanted additional USB ports and this is perfect. It’s compact, I can elect which ports are on, and works like a dream. I’ll plan to order one for my home office and a spare. Great product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought these to hold my 2-SDR-sharp dongles so I can run Unitrunker - police scanner software.  They work well, but sometimes getting the software drivers to distinguish between the two dongles is difficult.  Other than that, it's perfect.  The only negative is the 6-inch cable.  I wish it was at least 18 inches long so I can put it on top of my desktop tower.

CommentsTitle: Inexpensive way to add USB ports
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: This is an inexpensive solution to the problem of expanding the number of USB ports.  The strip of 4 USB ports can expand the number of devices connected to a microcomputer.  The device is small and lacks little space in a bag.  The ports are in-line, so if an external device has a wide plug, it will block at least one port.  The strip has an off-on button for each port.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2020
CommentsContent: It's a simple device and easy to use. I have 2 of them and they are handy to have. One of the ports stopped working so I gave it the 4 stars. I think I would have liked the cord a little longer, of course that is no fault of the product.

CommentsTitle: Updates review: disconnecting a lot now!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Update changing to one star cause now it’s USB is keeping in connecting disconnecting every now and then from my laptopSo annoying since it’s was bought just few months backWorks fine connecting mouse, keyboard and lync speaker

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I can't use this at all. That's why I originally purchased it but it's not powerful enough. Now I just use it for my mouse and keyboard and one of the ports is broken. I have to keep everything connected in the exact same slots or I waste time trying to figure out the exact combination of ports and sequence of connecting them in order to get everything to work, which is disruptive to my workflow.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2016
CommentsContent: This Usb hub arrived as scheduled and I was able to connect it to one of my systems running Windows 10 Anniversary edition. I did not have to load any software. Just connect it to the pc and then connect some usb devices to the hub. It works like it should, and having a separate switch for each port allows you to prevent wear & tear because you do not have to repeatedly connect and disconnect your devices. Also good when charging  devices because you can send the power to just the devices you want.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I love the idea behind this and the price was great, but it is not worth the price because it is as cheaply made as it is to purchase... I bought one previously somewhere else and only 3 of the 4 ports worked on it (and I had bought it for my son) so I decided to purchase one of these for myself.  The one I got all of the lights shine blue when you plug it in and it appears to be working great until you go to use the USB - none of the ports charged my phone or did anything when I attempted. I made sure they were turned on and the ligths were on and I tried multiple different sources to rule out each USB port- all 4 did not work - returning product and won't be attempting another purchase.

CommentsTitle: They work, but they are not power hubs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2018
CommentsContent: These hubs are merely okay at best.  It is partly my fault for not paying attention to detail in the description.  I was expecting powered USB 2.0 hubs with switches.  I had previously ordered the USB 3.0 versions with the switches, but needed a couple of USB 2.0 hubs.  I figured this was from the same company and BAM I would be done.  It is okay, I do not blame the company for my laziness.  I am sure I will find uses for these hubs.  They work as intended, but not exactly what I needed.  The company was insistent on me giving a review, so I am giving one.  For anyone interested in these hubs, please note.....these are NOT powered hubs.  They only get power from the USB port that it plugs into, which is never enough in most cases.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Good: it’s a space saving area for usb for our kitchen island. One star for that.Bad: it doesn’t charge but maybe one thing at a time... if you’re lucky. Tried various cords, items and maybe get one thing to charge.

CommentsTitle: For the price, this device is one of my top 10 life purchases.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2018
CommentsContent: I have had this product for a month+ now and it works GREAT!  For the price, this device is one of my top 10 life purchases. (my 6+ foot Russell Westbrook [OKC Thunder] Fathead vinyl wall decal is another) This device is so convenient and easy to use. This is one of those devices that makes so much sense!I purchased this product for my Pioneer A/V Receiver, that has a usb port, so my wife and I could listen to the different genres of music we like at the press of a bottom.  For example, I like a mixture of rock, country and r&b. My wife, mainly, likes r&b. I also purchased some SanDisk Cruzer Fit flash drives which fit perfectly in this hub. Each flash drive stores the different genres of music.Things to remember:-Ports are close together, so if your flash drives are normal size or bigger, then you may, only, be able to use 2 or 3 of the ports.-When you first insert your flash drive, for the first time, be extremely carful not to force or shove it into the port; there are tiny contact pins in the ports that will bend if not inserted gently and straight. ( I speak from experience...this is my second one.) After the first insertion, I pull out and insert the flash drives normally.

CommentsTitle: Dashcam & 2 chargers again in my Tesla Model 3!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2019
CommentsContent: If my review headline makes sense to you, this will work perfectly for that particular use case.  It also is pretty small and was easy to conceal.I've used Velcro to mount this on the underside of my Tesla Model 3's phone charging/holding area. With the update that brought the dashcam feature, one port had to be taken by the USB thumb drive used to store the video. So this allows me to still have the integrated dashcam setup, but still have the charging cable on both sides.The ability to enable/disable each port with a physical hardware switch is quite nice. I can keep other things plugged in and not worry about phantom power draw. Unless you are going to secure it somewhere or keep it out of the way, this may not always be the best choice though. I could see it may increase the likelihood of accidental "unsafe" device removal if the buttons are accidentally hit. So be cognizant of what you intend to use this for and where you'll put it!

CommentsTitle: I tested all of my cords and devices out by using my laptop's usb port and everything worked fine, so the fault is with this dev
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2016
CommentsContent: Unfortunately there was a loose connection or something, because when plugging in my headphones or mobile device I kept getting that beeping sound that windows makes when things are getting plugged in.  I tested all of my cords and devices out by using my laptop's usb port and everything worked fine, so the fault is with this device.  I really wanted this to work because the price point is right, the reviews were quite good, and the size / number of ports is perfect. Sadly, I did not have the same experience as other customers. I will definitely be purchasing a different brand.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2018
CommentsContent: I dropped my laptop one too many times, and all of the USB ports on the right side stopped working. I have way too many chargers and accessories for the one remaining port to cut it, so I bought this thing. It works well, it would be better if I had a desktop and didn't have to drag it around. I guess that's what I get for dropping my computer. The lights are a nice feature as is the ability to turn ports on and off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2014
CommentsContent: i was so excited to get this, so when i received it, i immediately plugged it into my computer and... nothing.  Ok, i'm no tech genius, so i had to try several different things before i could finally get it to work.1. Plug it into your computer BEFORE turning the computer on2. Plug the chargers or other items you want to use with it BEFORE pressing the little on/off buttons3. Occasionally jiggle the chargers or other items you want to use it with to ensure good contact.4. Sometimes you need to remove and reinsert the charger or other items several times before the hub will 'see' itOnce you can get it to work, it's great!  Oh, would have been nice if ANY instructions were included in the packaging!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm using it at present only to connect a dongle for my keyboard to my computer, and it works well.  The port lights as it is supposed to, and the Hub dangles from the back of my computer, sight unseen.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2015
CommentsContent: This device provides utility to notebook computers ... this one just does it a little better than most. It's well made, the status LED's  and all ports on a single side which makes access to the ports and cable management a breeze. This hub is limited to the power available only through the connection. While this seems like a disadvantage, it's really all you'll normally use because of mobility. Data transfer rates are good given this hub is 2.0.If you need a place for an RF or Bluetooth adapter, jump drive, card reader, etc. this is the accessory.

CommentsTitle: An excellent way to neatly add additonal usb ports to your computer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 24, 2014
CommentsContent: Just like the title says...my computer's usb ports are all used up for keyboards and mice and external monitors so it was a necessity to get this in order to plug in my Xbox controller and headset. The cord isn't very long so what I did was buy those velcro picture hanging things from the dollar store, and stuck one on the back of the usb hub and one on my desk next to the side of my laptop. It stays firmly in place, so none of the bajillions of cords on my desk are tugging it. The soft blue light it emits matches my speaker system light and it's not too bright (the lights turn of when the port isn't being used and you click it, and also when the computer powers down). A must have!

CommentsTitle: Love that I can turn off 2 of the ports ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2017
CommentsContent: I have a Viking pro tablet which has a USB port on it. I wanted to use a full keyboard and mouse with it since it was hard to type on. After discovering I could indeed use a keyboard I bought this so I could plug a mouse and keyboard in at the same time. It works perfectly! Love that I can turn off 2 of the ports so I save a bit of battery life. Now my tablet has the comforts of a full sized computer but with portability. If your tablet has a USB port this definitely works!

CommentsTitle: Not too sure about this one
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2020
CommentsContent: It seems like this thing can't power the items attached to it, simultaneously. One at a time goes OK. When I plugged it into my USB-C dock, the dock had a fit and had to be power cycled to recover. I used it on a TV to simply power 2 USB 5V 0.5amp bias backlights. It couldn't handle both lights. One would illuminate, and the other would start to flash in a weird accelerating pattern. I'll keep it for the occasional use, but it's mostly drawer filler. If you have power intensive accessories, move on to something bigger / better / faster / stronger. Perhaps the powered USB 3.0 version is better equipped.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2016
CommentsContent: I love this product. I bought one about a year ago which still works just fine but I wanted another one. The new one I bought has a little bit longer cable which I find more convenient but other than that it is still the same great product. I have run a number of things through the USB ports: usb piano keyboards, mice, computer keyboards, Turtle Beach headphones, etc. I haven't had any problems with them so far and would recommend them to anyone looking for a discrete usb splitter. I also would add I love the way the product looks. The light up blue lights for which usb port is activated are great

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2021
CommentsContent: So I purchased this item in December of 2020! It came in and the next day, I plugged it in, and it works amazingly.I definitely love the fact that I am able to turn on and off which USB I want to have in use, whether it's al four or just one of them only. The cord length is perfect, which allows it to stay close to the computer and doesn't take an ample amount of space! if you have a desk that has limited space or plenty of space, this little guy is perfect for you.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased one recently to enable me to have more USB ports on my HP laptop. It worked perfectly right out of the box. The computer recognized it and all I had to do was plug it in. So, I wanted more usb connections for my iMac and the description said this would also work on OS systems. I purchased a second one with the same results. I’m a very satisfied customer.

CommentsTitle: Disconnects USB devices from Windows when moved, got replacement, no longer a problem.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2017
CommentsContent: It works, but if I touch it or something jars it, my devices disconnect from windows.  After I move it a bit or sometimes it connects back by itself.Of course I tried different usb ports but it's the same.  I use different mouse devices and the push button option to turn one mouse off to use another is a desirable feature for me.Update:  Contacted Sabrent about the disconnect problem.  They sent me a new one and now I'm having no problems.  It works well.

CommentsTitle: Can't beat the price and also has some nice features.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2015
CommentsContent: This USB hub was purchased with a few other items that were being fulfilled by Amazon. This shipped the next day and arrived at my home the day after so that's always a bonus with the shopping experience.Regarding the hub, the overall feel is a little light and cheap-like, which I was expecting for the price. However, once plugged in and you get things plugged into it, you don't really notice and it works perfectly. The blue LEDs that are around the power switches for each individual plug-in are also a nice touch. Being able to turn each port on and off is also a feature I don't normally see when looking into these USB hubs.Overall, after you get over the first impression that feels like it's not going to last, the rest is smooth sailing as this is a solid little USB hub with some nifty features.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2019
CommentsContent: I have purchased several of these already and, when these start wearing out I will definitely be ordering more of them.  I try to aim for computer items that are plug and play easy, with no confusing installations or being forced to go hunt down a bunch of driver files online.  All of Sabrent's products fit that bill.  This 2.0 USB hub is a great one to keep on hand for when you're going back and forth between newer and older computers without the usual arguments from Win 10 wanting to snub "legacy" software and drivers.  Highly recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Extremely disappointed. Only one of the 4 ports actually worked when I turned it on and that died after a couple of weeks. I liked the size and the concepts but this one was just rubbish.

CommentsTitle: not robust enough for rough use, be careful
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2019
CommentsContent: The ability to quickly turn on and off individual ports is a great feature, especially when you do no want to expose critical files to cyber mischief or hacking.The only downside is that the cable to USB plug connection does not seem to be strong enough for my type of use.  What happens is that the cable wire connections to the USB plug break loose and lose connection.It is connected to my laptop USB port so I can connect multiple simultaneous devices.  However, since I frequently change location the unit gets treated roughly.  Using it in a fixed location would subject it to much less abuse.  Have not seen a unit at this price point that offers USB port on/off.Repeated plugging in will eventually wear out the USB port receptacle, especially if it is jostled while plugged in.  Just be careful about using it.

CommentsTitle: So for my purpose this item is almost useless. The inputs should be spaced apart a little ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2017
CommentsContent: I bought this to use with my USB Cruzer flash drives. Unfortunately there isn't enough space between the slots to fit them. I can only use 2 - one at each end. So for my purpose this item is almost useless. The inputs should be spaced apart a little bit so you can use them. If you're using regular USB wires it'll be a tight fit but it works fine. I gave the product one star so people would know about this. If I wasn't using any flash drives, I'd give the product a 4 or 5.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I have tried several others and kept having issued with a wireless headset and other items randomly turning on/off.  I believe it was because those ones had a 3.0 port on them from what I've read.  So I bought this one and haven't had any issues with it (4 months at the time of this review).  I can plug my external HD into my PlayStation then my headset, controller, and keyboard into this and everything is fine.  Plus the power button on each USB is a nice feature to have.

CommentsTitle: Functions OK for the most part
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2016
CommentsContent: I bought this hub to be used at work. It functions pretty well for the most part but I have noticed that when I have multiple flash drives plugged into the hub and I push the on\off switch for one port, the other drives plugged into the remaining active ports disconnect momentarily. I'm not sure why this happens but it does cause problems if I'm in the middle of transferring files to the online drives. I normally don't even use the switches but I have hit them accidentally when I'm trying to pull a device out of a port.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2014
CommentsContent: I have a very old computer that I am using since my laptop broke. Unfortunately for me, this computer only has one USB port on the front with a hard to reach 2 more in the back. As a seller on 2 different forums I am constantly needing more USB ports to get pictures from my Cannon camera onto my computer so I can sell. This is one of the best investments I have made and it didn't break the bank. For me this was a wonderful and necessary investment that I have not for one moment regretted. I use it daily and I paired it with the Amazon Basics USB 2.0 A-Male to A- Female Extension Cable and it gave me tons of room to move it around.Just what I needed. I highly recommend this item

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2015
CommentsContent: Love that Amazon makes suggestions @ point of purchase for similar products. We were purchasing a Logitec webcam and this product was included with it as a suggestion. Neither my husband nor I were aware there was such a product as the Sabren 4-Port USB Hub. We thought it was a good idea and being that we only have 1 port left on our tower, we did purchase it. We were so glad we did because it helped us not only with the webcam but ended up having issues with our printer. After doing all the PC directives on trying to get the printer functioning again, I thought why not plug it into this Sabrent rather than our PC tower..........IT WORKED THEN!!!!! I'm no geek, and really don't understand why this worked but I'm EXTREMELY happy we had the Sabrent @ this moment of frustration! L-O-V-E it! For this low price, get one!

CommentsTitle: Solid product for the price point
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021
