CommentsContent: My computer only has one USB port, so I needed a trip that would allow for multiple USB devices. This one fits the bill and is a great value for the price point. I like that there's buttons so you don't have to unplug (and lose) a tiny USB if you're not using it, just click off the button.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2013
CommentsContent: I purchased this to add a few more usb ports to my pc...I installed it on the back and wrapped around the side and added a small piece of 3m double sided sticky tape to secure it to the side of my tower. All the ports work and the lights as well for each port. The lights turn on and off for each port when you toggle the power to that port. Its a bit chintsy that each light spills over to the next so when one is on it almost lights up two..no biggie just kind of cheap. But for the price what can you expect. It does the job its supposed to do,  The cord itself is a bit short for what I wanted but that's ok too. No biggie. Over all i'm satisfied with the product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2020
CommentsContent: It's good for....well almost nothing, if all you're doing is transferring a low bit files off of 1-2 drives then you shouldn't have a problem, but don't expect to thread your accesories through this thing and have the same quality of a direct connection.

CommentsTitle: Great For Use At The Office
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2016
CommentsContent: I recently was given a laptop from my employer and the model that they use only has one USB port per side. As I need to use a WIFI stick on one side that blocks the port, that left me with only one USB port! I ordered this product, as it would allow me to plug my cell phone charger cord, mouse, larger desktop screen, and flash drive in all at once. I have been using this for a few weeks and it has worked out perfectly! I also like that it gives you the option to "turn off" a port by pressing a button. I don't always use my desktop screen or my phone charger, so it is nice to be able to cut off power to those items without messing with unplugging and plugging back in wires all the time. This saves battery life on my computer as well!

CommentsTitle: One of the buttons is kind of broken....
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: One of the buttons is broken and really, I did not need the buttons, just needed an inexpensive hub, so this works for what I need it for.  The broken button is only if I try to use it, it does NOT stay in the locked position,

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This is an excellent product if you need to plug in lots of things into your USB port.  I am a tech coach in a school, and I purchase these for my teachers to use with doc cameras, wireless mice, and anything else that requires a USB.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2016
CommentsContent: I purchased this hub to use it for charging my Apple devices connected to a charger and not my computer, being able to keep them in the stand and turn on the one that needed to charge. It looked very smart for that purpose, the trouble was that it just doesn't work. The first line in the product information should have said: “Note: this hub can only be used connected to a computer and not to a USB charger”. If it had, I would not have purchased just another usb hub. It is only because it is too much work returning it for the cost of $6.49 that I don't.

CommentsTitle: Great Convenience From A Great Value
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2015
CommentsContent: A perfect solution to expanding available USB ports. Extremely reliable and just as well built for great dependability, it has a cord length that is long enough to provide distance from your computer (perhaps 6") yet not too long that excessive cord length clutters your work area.I use mine with my laptop that I use both at home and away. While I have four ports available, I leave it on my desk connected to my mouse, iPhone charging cord and WD MyCloud backup device to it, so that when I get home and connect to it (or leave) it's a single connect/disconnect. (I have a travel mouse for working away from home.)Am I lazy? That's not unfair. But on a practical level, forgetting to reconnect the MyCloud device after reconnecting the mouse and iPhone cord means I miss backing up that day's work; I'm diligent about backups because Murphy stalks me and his fourth law says something will happen to my laptop or hard drive the day it isn't backed up. For seven bucks, life is just a littttle less complicated. And I am worth it. In fact, I may be worth $14 as I am considering a 2nd device for my computer bag, even if there are a mere TWO devices plugging into it (the travel mouse & iPhone cord.I **am** worth $14. Ordering now ;)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2015
CommentsContent: I bought one, just to try it out. Well, in the end I bought three more!I didn't expect the size to be so small and when I got it, I immediately felt like it was a good purchase. It had a very modern design, travel sized, everything is necessary and nothing was over the top.It doesn't feel like a top of the notch hub, but it doesn't feel cheap either. I'd say it feels good, reliable.Second thing I like are the individual power buttons for each USB. Sometimes, you just want to keep things plugged in but turned off and it's so easy with this.Why did I buy so many? There are a LOT of people in my family.. I am usually the one that buys items and if it's good I buy a few more as gifts for my aunts/uncles and siblings, even friends. My sister has a surface pro 3 and brother with a surface pro - they both love this hub when I gave them one each.I would recommend this to anyone who needs a reliable; travel sized hub with good design.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Four switch controlled USB ports- like a gift from Heaven.  This is my second one and the first one is still working well.  Highly recommend if yu have the need for such a device.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2019
CommentsContent: I plugged the splitter into 5 different usb ports, and tried all 4 of the power switches on the splitter and none of them would charge my iPhone. I even made sure to try 3 different charging cables. I was sad to see this, especially after reading all the other great reviews and it being the #1 best-seller.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I was looking for a inexpensive way to expand my USB capacity.  It is perfect for my use.  I hooked up my wireless mouse and my back up drive.  This hub is small and unobtrusive, and it gets the job done.  I accessed my smart phone to download some photos and I noticed there was a some phone charging going on.  Nice.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Doesn’t charge cellphones. Charges anything else just not my iPhones. I bought 2 of these and the both have the same issue. Also, cord is extremely short.

CommentsTitle: Not enought power to feed more than one device
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this because I have only 1 usb port on my tv and I wanted to hookup 2 devices at the same time. So I connected a set of led lights and my chromecast to this thing. It didn't work. When I turn on the lights my chromecast shuts down. It seems like this device doesn't have enough power to feed both things at the same time. The whole point of this item is to feed more than one device. So pretty much it didn't work out for me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Using this USB hub with my laptop to supply extra ports.  Press the button to use a port, and it also lights up.  Very economical and efficient.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I was waiting for it for almost 2 weeks，but I was very excited when I starting to use it. I connect 1 Speaker, 1 USB 128GB, 1 Mouse, and 1 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard. Automatic install and going and All of the plugin ports work together. Also, the light can show the plug is working or not. But only one point is the port is a little bit TIGHT, it makes you push your USB and pull out your USB more hard. However, My device no often plugs out, so this no problem for me, it also makes my device better-fixed to the USB HUB.I wish this review helpful to all of the others.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Just got mine in the mail yesterday, and I love it! The reason I got it was because my MacBook only has 2 USB slots and I needed more. It works exactly the way I need it to! All of the slots work for it just fine! The only thing is that the cord length isn’t long, but that’s not a problem for me!

CommentsTitle: I couldn't be more satisfied with their customer service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2015
CommentsContent: When I first received this hub, I tested out all of the ports. They were a tad tight for a Logitech wireless mouse and keyboard USB drives, so I had to push a bit to get them in. One of the ports didn't work, and I noticed that the drive didn't go all the way in. Upon inspection, I realized--and I know this is probably not the technical term--that one of the teeth were bent and folded in. While I was hesitating over whether to contact the seller, since I couldn't be sure whether I broke the port when I pushed my USB drive in or if I received a defective product, the seller reached out to me for feedback. I wrote back explaining that one of the ports were broken, but that it could have been my own fault. The seller immediately sent me a replacement and told me I could keep the defective hub as well. I couldn't be more satisfied with their customer service. This was a situation where it's possible--maybe even probable--that it was not their fault (I spent quite some time pondering the likelihood of a bent tooth in the port being a manufacturing error...), and without hesitation they sent me a replacement. They were customer-oriented and responsive.So far I've had zero issues with the hub aside from their being a bit tight for my Logitech usb drive (other drives less so). It is a great product at a great price point. Overall, I am 100% satisfied with the purchase and with the seller's customer service.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2014
CommentsContent: I gave the Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 hub 5 stars because it does what it claims to, inexpensively.  The ports are spaced far enough apart to accommodate thumb drives.  The cable is long enough to let the body rest on a desk, but not much longer than that.  If you use a laptop on a very small surface, the hub will hang off.  I tried it, and it did not unplug.  I had no issues when turning on or off the power buttons.  Note that I used only flash drives, and have not tested the device with an external hard drive.  For an external hard drive.  Also note that it is USB 2.0.  If your laptop has USB 3.0 ports, I suggest that you buy the USB 3.0 version.In sum, I purchased this to use with an older Dell Studio 1525, with only 3 USB 2.0 ports.  The hub is compact, and fits nicely in my computer accessory bag, and lets me work with all my thumb drives at the same time, for less than $10.  It's perfect for this use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I ordered this because my PC has only 2 USB ports. This works just as I had hoped. Plugged it in and immediately had the extra ports that I needed. It solved my problem.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2020
CommentsContent: Love it, it was a tangled mess before and I did not have enough usb ports. this is great , now I have options if I want to connect anything else. I love that I can turn and off the ports not being used. Have not had any issues and I have had it for 3 months.

CommentsTitle: THIS IS NOT POWERFUL TO ONE RUN MORE THAN ONE DEVICE AT A TIME.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased a new comput that had just one 2UBS PORT.  I have a mouse plugged in and that's about all this decice will charge.. Cannot plug printer into it, cannot plug iPhone into it and other things. I sure didn't get my monies worth.I would NOT recommend to buy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021
CommentsContent: This gadget is really nice! The buttons light up when they're being used. It helps me connect more things to my laptop that use a USB. Laptops tend to not have very many USB ports. So, this is an essential purchase in my opinion

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this along with a USB extension cable to give myself an easily accessible USB hub. My computer is off to the side of my desk and it is a pain to lean over to connect or disconnect something.So far the hub stands up well and I am able to quickly connect and disconnect whatever devices that attaches to it, especially with the power buttons on it.I have a controller and a keypad connected to this hub. The power buttons help with disconnecting the controller especially because some games I don't use the controller and it vibrates in response to games. A resting controller not being used makes a lot of noise on a table when it vibrates.I can't speak to whatever power supply it provides because that isn't what I bought it for.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This works perfectly for my work needs. I would honestly suggest using this product, may get more for my kid's computers as well. I know so many people write reviews even the "ones" who own the product will make reviews on their stuff to enhance it. This one they don't have to it speaks for itself. Small, easy to use, and out of the way.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2016
CommentsContent: I wish i could say this was the best item i would have ever spend money as a computer nerd, but it isn't only because i wish i had 10 more of this but that would cost me alot so ~ yea.i Love this product, i plug my yeti and other usb stuff only when i need it i press the button which gives blue led when it is on. Since my yeti .. does not have a on of switch i have to use this which makes my life much more easier.but i would recommend to buy the 10 usb port one 4 is just not enough ~ ^^

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2016
CommentsContent: I have a laptop on my desk and a desktop underneath it, and one external mouse, keyboard and headset that I switch between the two. It was a pain to switch to and from the desktop because there aren't enough USB ports on the front for everything and scrabbling around on the floor to use the rear ports was a pain. Now everything is plugged into the hub (and my phone is currently charging on one of the ports too) and all I have to do is move the hub connector from the laptop port to the desktop port when I need it. Since none of the devices is data-heavy, USB 2.0 meets my needs just fine, which is why I chose the cheaper USB 2.0 model over the 3.0 version.

CommentsTitle: It does what I need it to do.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: I've got a camera and a couple of mini usb charging cables plugged into it. It works great for what I need it to do. No issues.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2018
CommentsContent: 100% satisfied.  This is the second one for us, now we each have one.  Love that we can turn off or on individual ports with a button. Fast delivery and packaging was realistic, not overdone. (Don't you hate when you buy a pen and it comes in an apple crate?). This is especially nice for us folks that don't have a lot of ports. Priced well within reason, probably cheaper than any you can buy in stores.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: Works well enough, and I enjoy the individual control for the USB ports. My only two gripes are the insanely short cord length and the flimsy weight that makes it hard to use on a desk. the lights are nice but the rings around the buttons doesn't fully light up and only the forward edge shines blue.

CommentsTitle: Solves the "not enough USB ports" problem!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2019
CommentsContent: Nice 4 port hub. I don't think the switches are really necessary, but it's an ok feature. The LEDs are very bright, so don't put it where you can see it in the dark.  The USB wire is a little short for my linking, about 9 inches. It does work with Chromebook which is what I needed. Have my keyboard, wireless mouse and printer hooked up with no problems.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: Works great. Wife needed a small device for her MS Surface pro. It only have 1 USB port this allows her to have her wireless mouse and portable drive hooked up at same time. The slot power buttons are nice also allowing to conserve battery power.

CommentsTitle: A Good 2.0/3.0 Conversion for a low Cost
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2017
CommentsContent: The 4-port USB arrived from Amazon early (as usual). This Sabrent 2.0 USB Hub was a replacement for a unit where the strain-relief started to crack. The 1st Sabrent unit lasted well past a year so I'm satisfied. I shove this piece in-n-outta my backpack at least 8 times a week so I think it's held up pretty well. I bought the 2.0 rather than the 3.0 (as my hp has 4, 3.0 USB ports already) to satisfy some peripheral demands. I know, I know I've heard/been-told that 3.0's vertically compatible with 2.0 devices but my experience is that 3.0 shall not mix with 2.0. So, this Hub takes care of my problems for a low cost. I haven't had any 2.0 devices rejected with this Hub. This Hub is plugged into a 3.0 USB... alliswell.

CommentsTitle: Awesome USB hub - Buying a second one
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Wonderful USB Hub. Working great since one year now and I am buying a second unit. I have a computer keyboard, a mouse, an external hard drive and a USB piano keyboard plugged on it and everything works perfectly. I can also plug my iPhone to back it up and charge it! I really like the lighted blue switches that allow me to disconnect my backup drive when I don't need it. Push the switch back on and my drive appears on my desktop after a few seconds. Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Very happy with this purchase! I bought it to replace the old USB hub that came with my Rock Band set over a decade ago. My old PS2 has one consistently functional USB port and all of the Rock Band components worked great once I plugged them into this hub and hit each switch.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I gave this 4 stars only because it has a bit of a delay. Purchased this for my surface pro to connect a usb mouse and keyboard. It is easy to use and I love that the buttons allow you to turn specific devices on and off but there is a noticeable delay *at times* which can be solved with the double click of the mouse.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2018
CommentsContent: I like that they hub connections can be individually turned off and on.  When on they are lit up.  But I do not like that fact that the connection is extremely slow.  When I back up my files to a hard drive connected directly to the computer it takes about minute to process.  When I have the hard drive backup connected to the hub it can take up to 15 minutes!  So not a good choice.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: The device works great----the price was excellent---went to two hardware stores---nothing in stock---I agree with "shop local", but finding you want is difficult at best,
